1553322121312.title: Clothes Swap/Life Swap

choices: She stands up and leaves the room. (Switch POV)
She points the remote at you.
15533221213122.content:
You hear a small click and then a soft thud as you land on the floor. You come to a stop after rolling a bit, your turnip eyes turned towards your now-clothed body.

You watch in horror as your body gets up and walks over to the remote. She bends over to pick up the remote and seems to notice something on the back. "Hmm, that's strange."

It's strange to hear someone else talking in my voice! You think desperately. You watch helplessly as the former turnip now living your life in your body puts the remote and manual back in the box before picking both it and you up.

Based on her direction, it looks like she's headed back towards your room. Your thoughts race around in your head. What's going to happen to me now? Is she... is she going to eat me? Or feed me to someone else? No! Someone! Someone please help me! Someone notice me! Please!

In a few minutes, "Princess Peach" returns to the room. She places you on a set of your drawers. You're positioned towards the room, so you can see as she sits on the bed, opens the box, and takes the remote out. She seems to be looking at the back of the remote. Then she carefully takes off one of your earrings and uses it to pry open a hidden panel. She looks at the remote, then at the manual. "That's strange..." You hear her mutter softly.

What? What's strange?! You think. You're shouting inside your own head, hoping uselessly that someone will hear it.

You see her as she places her finger on the exposed part of the remote as she points it at herself. Suddenly, she lets go of the remote and slumps onto the bed.

You stare, unable to do anything else. What happened? you wonder. What did the remote do to... her?

After about a minute, you see your body raise her (No! Those are my arms! you think to yourself) your arms. It seems to be staring at your hands for some reason. Then...
15533221213122.title: Life swap.

choices: Hide the remote and go out into the world.
Take the remote with you as you go out.
Take the box and try to remember or find out who's supposed to have it.
155332212131223.content:
Whatever she is, she's looking at you with a confused stare. She gets up and looks down, frowning at your dress. She looks through the manual, reading much more slowly than you would, then points the remote at you and presses a button.

I wonder what she did... because I don't even know! The realization makes you panic even more. The crown on your turnip head shakes, and the earrings stuck to the sides of your head vibrate. She lets the remote drop onto the bed, then gets down to your hands and knees and starts crawling towards you.

What... what is she doing?! That's completely undignified, you think as you watch her. She makes her way towards the drawers and maneuvers your hand to one of the drawers. She opens it, then closes it. Then does it again to the next drawer. It's on the third drawer that she pulls something out. Something round and brown...

That's... what is that? You wonder, Wait... It's mine. Why can't I remember it?I You try to think of what else you may have forgotten, but suddenly there's a flash of light. You feel much harder, and somewhat lifted up into the air and frozen that way. At least she's not going to eat me, you console yourself. But what did she do to me?!

**

(Switch POV)

A short while ago you were a turnip, to be tossed or eaten. The orange button you pressed made you remember that. But now you were Princess Peach, although oddly the orange button seems to have made you forget much of that. It's weird, you think. I remember doing what I just did, and remember that I remembered a lot more, but now it's all... fuzzy.

Slowly, you use the knobs on the drawers to pull yourself up to a standing position. You look at the trophy you made of the turnip that had once Princess Peach, wearing the clothes she used to wear and that you had swapped back with her, leaving yourself nude and unencumbered. You blink a bit, and then... shrug. I don't know why you wanted to be a turnip, but I'll keep you safe, you think.

Think! I can think now! Your lips part in awe as you raise your hands again. The very possibility of though empties your mind of it for a moment. On an impulse, you rub them against each other, feeling the heat they generate. Then you clasp them to your face. You gasp subtly as you feel your hair on the back of your hands. You hold your hair in your hands. It's so... "Soft." You close your eyes and smile as you stroke your long blond hair for several minutes.

You sigh, That's enough of that. So now what? You take a deep breath, I guess remembering I was a turnip means I have to learn what it means to be a human. Maybe the memories will come as as I live her life. I hope they do; I don't want anyone to realize I'm not really Princess Peach.

But what do I do with the remote? you wonder. I can't break it. Who knows what would happen? Let's see... You put a finger to your lips and cradle your chin - that seems to be a human thinking thing. I could hide the remote and go out, or go out with the remote. Maybe I can use it on someone else. Or maybe... You concentrate, thinking as hard as you can. The old Peach wanted to... give this remote to someone. Maybe I should do that.
155332212131223.title: She stays in the room.

15533222.content: Are you the cartoony doppleganger of Link, Toon Link?
15533222.title: More Characters

155332221.content:
You are Toon Link, or Toony as some people have nicknamed you. In your own world you were just called Link, but since there was already a Link in the tournament who had been participating longer, the Hands gave you a prefix for your name so people wouldn't get confused... only that it resulted in you getting confused a lot of the time. But that was the last tournament, and by now you had sort of gotten used to it. It still bothered you a little that the hands had just given you that prefix without even asking, and that you couldn't just be Link while you were here, but there wasn't really much you could do about it.

That is, you couldn't be much about it until you found a strange package lying in the hallway. Not one to turn down free loot, and not seeing anyone around who was looking for something, you open up the package yourself. Inside was some sort of TV remote and an instruction manual. You weren't too good with technology, what with your world being nowhere near as advanced as the stuff the Hands had, so you take out the manual to see how it worked. You were surprised to find the remote was not for any sort of electric device, but was more like a magic artifact you'd find in a dungeon. It could apparently change reality by swapping things between people, and it would only let certain people notice depending on which orange button was pressed. It reminded you of the Command Melody, but that was more like temporarily possessing someone to control their actions rather than actually swapping bodies with someone.

You were really curious about this remote now. It could probably end up being pretty fun, letting you be whoever or whatever you wanted to be. Of course, this could just be some sort of prank. You needed to test it out first. But to do that, you'd need a test subject, so you go wandering through the hallways, throwing the box the remote had been in in the trash while you do so, looking for someone to swap with. While you would have preferred to swap with another normal boy like yourself, you had no such luck with the first person you found. But you didn't let that discourage you, as you said to yourself, "Oh well, it's just a test." You point the remote at them, ready to test it on them. The person you had found was...
155332221.title: Toon Link

15533222111121.content:
Within seconds of pressing the button, you find yourself with your head on top of Zelda's body. It catches you off guard for a bit, since you weren't really playing attention to which button you were pressing. You slowly reach a hand up and poke your chest. This was definitely real, you actually had Zelda's body below the neck. You put your hands on your hips and grin as you realise that this means your new little toy actually works. You turn around to face where you had been standing before the swap, only to have your grin disappear.

You had expected to see Zelda, with her head on your body, where you had been standing before the swap, but find nothing but an empty corridor. It seemed that whatever Zelda was doing, she had gone about her business, taking your body with her. You look down at the tall female body you had below you neck. You swallow hard, thinking that it'd be yours until you found Zelda again. But you couldn't let that put a damper on your plans. You could still have fun with the remote even if you were stuck with Zelda's body. And then it hit you; the remote! Just because Zelda had run off with your body, didn't mean you had to be stuck with her's. You could just borrow some else's if you wanted, and then you could concentrate on playing around with the remote more.

Within seconds of pressing the button, the swap occurs, givin your tunic to Zelda, and dressing you in her dress. "Woah!" you quietly exclaim, trying to not be too loud. The clothes had completely adjusted to their new owners. You turn around a couple of times, trying to get a good look at yourself, feeling the dress swishing around your legs as you did so. Lifting up the hem of the dress, you found Zelda's boots on your feet, and feeling around your chest area revealed you had Zelda's underwear as well. Reaching up, you felt her tiara on top of your head, and your face felt strange because of what assumed was Zelda's makeup applied to it. Everything Zelda had been wearing, and every item of clothing she owned, was now yours. It was a rather odd feeling, wearing clothes that were meant for a girl, but not entirely an unpleasant one. What excited you more was the fact that this meant your new toy actually worked, and you could play around with reality however you wanted.

You hold the remote up so you can see it clearly and grin, thinking of all the possibilities. However, the gloved hand you saw holding the remote reminded you that you were still wearing Zelda's clothes. It wasn't that bad, and perhaps you'd be interesting in trying it again some time later, but right now, you had other plans, and dressing like a girl was not one of them. You aim the remote at where Zelda was before and get ready to swap back.

155332221112212.content:
"Toony!"

You turn to find the person that had been yelling was none other than Princess Peach of the Mushroom Kingdom. She eventually reaches you, seemingly little out from breath from running towards you.

"There you are," she says, "I've been looking all over for you."

"You have?" you ask, confused as to why Peach would be looking for you.

"Of course I have! We were going to hang out today, remember?"

"We were?" The more Peach said, the more confused you got.

"Oh come on, don't tell me you forgot about an agreement you made with your best friend!"

"Best... friend?" This time, you said it quietly enough that Peach didn't hear you.

"Come on," she says, taking you by the hand and practically dragging you down the hallway, "I've got everything planned out." For a princess, she was surprisingly strong, as you weren't able to get your hand out of her grip, and she seemed capable of dragging you wherever she wanted.

With Peach focused on where she was taking you, you look down at the remote you had been hiding. You had thought it was a dud, but it must have done something. After all, Peach wasn't your best friend; Peach was best friends with Zelda! Then it occurs to you; you had pointed the remote at Zelda before, and didn't the remote say something about swapping relationships? You really wished you hadn't thrown the manual away. So if you had swapped relationships with Zelda, then you'd still be you, but Peach would be your best friend, which was what seemed to be happening now. And along with that, you'd have all of Zelda's other relationships too... including Link.

You shudder. Whatever it was you had wanted to do with this remote, it was certainly not becoming Link's boyfriend. You needed a way out. As Peach continued to drag you to your destination, you thought of what you could do. Zelda was nowhere to be seen, so getting your own relationships back was out of the question. You could either use the relationship swap button, or perhaps the life swap button as someone else's life would also come with their relationships.

You let out a yelp as you quickly look up at the roof, and away from your body, blonde hair falling in front of your eyes as you do so. Maybe it was because you had just woken up, but you had forgotten that the body swap doesn't swap clothes. And because of the head swap with Jigglypuff, the only clothes you were wearing was your had, which was still sitting on your head, even if it wasn't really your head anymore.

"So, who am I now?" you ask yourself aloud, in hope of recognising the voice. Luckily it works. The voice, along with the fact that you knew you had a female body with blonde hair, led you to the realisation that you had swapped bodies with Samus.

"Okay, so I'm still myself, but I look like Samus, and I don't wear any clothes except for a hat, and everyone thinks that's normal," you say to yourself, going over what you knew had happened. You slowly lower your gaze to be looking forward instead of at the roof, but still refuse to look down again out of embarrassment. You feel around on the floor for the remote and eventually find it, picking it up and holding it in front of your face.

"So, what now?" You weren't really sure what to do now. Your body, clothes, and weapons currently belonged to Jigglypuff, while your head (and Jigglypuff's limbs) belonged to Samus, and you had no idea where either of them were. Finding either of them would be great, but finding Samus would be better because then you could swap everything back in order and things wouldn't get all messed up. Although you supposed it didn't really matter if everyone else was messed up, since they'd think everything was normal. What mattered was making sure you were comfortable.

Speaking of comfortable, you weren't exactly comfortable walking naked in Samus' body. It might mess things up even further, but maybe you could swap with someone else and take their clothes. Sure, then they'd be naked, but they wouldn't notice anything wrong, and you'd be less uncomfortable about looking down and seeing a naked woman's body.

"Well, at least it's better than being a head with arms and legs," you mumble as you start walking, trying to ignore a cold breeze you were starting to feel.

That said, you still needed some clothes if you were going to be at all comfortable with this. You kind of wondered whether it would be better to take a boy's clothes or a girl's clothes. Boy clothes were more familiar to you, but girl clothes would probably be better suited for your body. In the end, you decide to just go ahead and swap with the first person you come across, since that's what you did last time. Provided they have clothes, of course.
1553322212112121112.title: Swap clothes with someone

15533222121121212.content: "Urgh," you mumble, rubbing the sleep from your eyes as you get up. But as you do, you notice that the hands you're using aren't really your hands. And they aren't Jigglypuff's stubby limbs either. Since you still had your own voice, you figure you must have accidentally activated a head swap when you fell on the remote. The body you now had below your head belonged to...
15533222121121212.title: Head

15533222121121221.content: You slowly get up off the floor and pick up the remote.It seemed you were still just a head with tiny arms and legs. However, it seemed you no longer had your usually green hat, and you seemed to be wearing someone else's clothing, drastically modified to be able to be worn by a ball-person. You recognised the clothing as belonging to...

155332221211212212.content: You look down at your current, and kinda messed up body only to see that you are wearing rosalinas clothes! You also notice you have a silver crown on your head and a wand in one hand. You think to yourself "things can't get much more messed up now, can they?" You determined to get back to your old body, but the question is, where do you start?
155332221211212212.title: Rosalina

15533222121121222.content:
As you sit up, and pick up the remote, you notice you don't seem to have your hat anymore, and you're wearing someone else's clothes. Somehow, the clothing has been altered to fit you, despite you just being a head with arms and legs now.

"So, did I swap clothes when I fell on the remote?" you ask yourself. But something tells you it's more than that, and delving into your mind confirms that. In your mind, you still have your own memories, but you also have the memories belonging to the person who's clothes you were wearing, as if you had been them your entire life.

But whose life were you living?
15533222121121222.title: Life

155332221212.content: Which button did you press?

1553322212122.content: Which button did you press?
1553322212122.title: Relationship Swap/Gender Swap

choices: Stay as a girl for a while
15533222121222.content:
As you press the button, nothing seemed to happen. Or at least, nothing seemed to happen to Jigglypuff. The same couldn't be said for you, however. Looking down at yourself, you noticed a pair of small lumps on your chest, and your waist seemed to be a bit thinner. Your pants had been replaced with a skirt, and your boots seemed to have a taller heel. You could feel your hair was much longer, reaching down to your waist, and there was definitely something missing from your crotch.

"I'm a... girl?" you whispered, your voice more high pitched than usual. You reach a hand up to your face. Your skin felt smoother than usual. It was odd, but not unpleasant. You looked back up at Jigglypuff, still seeing no apparent difference in how she looked. You supposed that members of her species must not look all that different between the males and females.

You look down at the remote, wondering what your next move should be. If you wanted, you could easily swap back with Jigglypuff, and become a boy again. However, you weren't entirely sure you wanted to. The option to swap back would be there any time, so why not just stay this way and see what it was like to be a girl for a while?
15533222121222.title: Gender Swap

155332222.content: Are you the Blue Blur, Sonic the Hedgehog?
155332222.title: More Characters

1553322221.content:
You are the hero of Mobius, the blue blur, the defender of chaos, you are Sonic The Hedgehog.

It was odd to you that you'd received a package delivered to your door, since you'd already gotten the usual fan mail and the excessive love letters from Amy. But when you opened the package, you found it had inside of it a remote that looked like it belonged to a flat-screen television, and to further inspection, it had some oddly named buttons on it. A life swap? Body swap? Head swap? Could this remote really do all of that? It also came with a very descriptive manual of what each button does and its effects. This definitely seemed like the real deal. The only way to find out for sure, though was to test it out firsthand. You took your new toy out into the hall and decided you'd hit a random button on the very next person to come around the corner. According to the manual, you'd still be in possession of the remote no matter what you chose. Normally, you'd stay far away from this kind of tech, but you'd been very very bored as of late. Since Nintendo hasn't added any more Sonic characters to the Smash Tournament, you've been very lonely. This could pass the time.

So that arises the question. Who turns that corner?
1553322221.title: The Blue Blur

15533222211.content: Was it Link, the hero of Hyrule?
15533222211.title: The Blue Blur - Male Options

15533222212.content: Did Peach turn the corner, the seemingly helpless damsel that has been kidnapped over one thousand times, yet never upgrades her castle's security?
15533222212.title: The Blue Blur - Female Options

1553322222.content: Are you the blue-haired Prince, Marth?
1553322222.title: More Characters

15533222222.content: Are you the mysterious princess of the stars, Rosalina?
15533222222.title: More Characters

155332222221.content: You are Rosalina, the princess of the stars. You were currently heading back to your room with a few books you had borrowed from the library. There a training session scheduled for the newcomers later today, but you planned to relax for a while in your room before that. On the way there, you noticed something on the ground. Picking it up, you found it to be a small box, with a strange remote and instruction manual inside. You tuck your books and the box under one arm, hold the remote in your right hand, and read the manual in your left hand, all while still walking back to your room. You had every intention to return this remote to its owner, but if you knew what it was and how it worked, its owner may be a little easier to identify. However, this remote seemed to do something you had never even thought possible. It could alter reality without anyone except certain people indicated by the mode knowing anything was wrong. What if whoever owned this had already used this, but you just didn't know because the remote was set to mode 1? Had you always been the princess of the stars? Had you always had your tall, female body? While worrying about this, you bump into someone because you weren't looking where you were going. This causes you to drop pretty much everything except the remote, and you don't realise it yet, but you also accidentally press the life swap button, targeting the person you bumped into. Who had you bumped into?
155332222221.title: Rosalina

1553322222211.content:
You hold one hand to your head, the other hand holding onto the remote, as you had bumped it on whoever it was you ran into. You supposed you should have been watching where you were going. But something felt... off.

"Sorry, I wasn't watching where I was going," you hear Bowser say. Well that explained why bumping your head had hurt that much, but why was Bowser apologising? He was a villain, normally if something like this happened, he'd just make some rude remake and stomp off. Speaking of stomping off, you hear Bowser start to walk away, but rather than the usual stomping, you hear the clicking on high heels on the ground. Something was definitely wrong.

With the pain from the collision subsided, you open your eyes, and instantly realise what was wrong. Looking down at yourself, you saw that you dress had vanished, all your clothes had, leaving in their place only some spiked arm bands and a choker around your neck. The books you had borrowed from the library were no longer lying on the floor; only the manual and the box the remote came in were left there. You had a pretty good idea of what had happened; you had accidentally pressed the life swap button on the remote when you bumped into Bowser, so now you were living his life.

You had to find him and switch back as soon as possible! What would happen to the Lumas if you weren't there for them? What would Bowser do to them? You do your best to calm down. You remember how Bowser apologised for bumping into you, something he would normally have never done. Bowser probably thought he was you now, so the Lumas were in no danger of their kind mother being replaced with a cruel dictator. In that case, if you could somehow turn Bowser's life around and stop him from being a villain before you went back to your own life, perhaps you could remove the main villain of the Mushroom Kingdom once and for all.

However, as selfless as an act as that would have been, you felt incredibly embarrassed to be walking around practically naked. Bowser had already disappeared from sight while you were freaking out, and you couldn't exactly go barging into your room, since it wasn't really your room anymore. It would be something you'd expect Bowser to do, but even if you were living his life right now, you weren't Bowser, and weren't about to go and do something so rude. No, you'd have to return to your old life later, but right now you still had the remote, and wanted to find some clothing that would leave you less exposed. You had two options right now; you could stay in Bowser's life and use a clothes swap, or you could swap lives with someone else. Either way would leave you with more to fix if you wanted to turn everything back to normal, but if no one could tell the difference, maybe it wouldn't matter if you didn't swap everything back. Still feeling self-conscious about the fact that you were walking around practically naked, even if no one through it was strange, you head off in search of someone to swap with to obtain some clothing. But which swap do you decide to use?
1553322222211.title: Bowser

15533222222112.content:
Despite your grand ideas of making Bowser a good guy, you didn't really want to stick around in Bowser's life. People would treat you like a villain, and thus you'd be expected to socialize with the other villains, something you had zero interest in doing. No, someone else would be filling Bowser's shoes, or armbands, you supposed, since Bowser didn't exactly wear shoes. And so, you head off in search of a new life to occupy until you could return to your own life, your footsteps significantly quieter than those usually made by Bowser.

Even though no one was around, you still felt very self-conscious about being practically naked. You tried to subtly cover up your private parts with your arms as you walked, but you ultimately end up dropping your arms again, as having those spike that close to your parts probably wasn't a good idea. The longer this went on, the more willing you were to swap with practically anything to get yourself some clothes. Out of the corner of your eye, you spot someone down one of the hallways. Without even really thinking, you quickly point the remote at them and press the life swap button.

But who did you swap with?
15533222222112.title: Life Swap

155332222221122.content:
With a click, you expected to find yourself decent, if in an otherwise unfitting outfit. But to your dismay, you were still naked, only this time your spiky armbands were gone! Looking over towards who you had hastily swapped with, you groan as you realize that you only swapped with Greninja, who was now wearing Bowser's armbands and stomping off in a Bowser-like fashion. You were almost tempted to swap back with him, but he already walked off somewhere else, ruling out that option. Now you had more stuff to deal with if you wanted to fix everything later.

"I can't believe this..." you say...or try to say, as it just comes out like "Ah can't buhleev thith...". Wait, what? Why were you slurring your words? Glancing down at yourself, you're more than a little shocked to find your own tongue practically pouring out of your mouth, elongated and wrapped around your neck like a scarf and draping down your side. Carefully, you reached up to touch it. You could kind of feel your own touch, but you could hardly taste anything with your now-exposed tongue. That must be why you didn't feel it at first.

You weren't really sure why this specific trait had carried over. Did Greninja use his tongue to battle? You didn't really remember, but you suppose he must use it in at least a few moves. That would explain why it carried over; it is a skill of his, after all. But that didn't make it any less weird and grotesque, so now you really wanted to get out of Greninja's life. You didn't really want people to treat you like a Pokemon anyway. Running down a hall now, you found yourself moving faster than you thought you could, another trait of Greninja's life. This wasn't a terrible perk, but not enough to justify keeping the weird tongue.

Luckily, with Greninja's speed, it didn't take you long to find two other fighters talking to each other; and they were both human this time, thankfully. But that didn't make them easy choices.

The first was Peach, princess of the Mushroom Kingdom. You wouldn't mind being in Peach's life for a while, at least until you got your own life back. She was another princess, like you, and you both lived in the same world, so she would probably be the easiest one to adjust to being. And if you wanted to get your own life back, probably the smarter choice, since you and her were friends. But that would mean giving Peach Greninjas life. You weren't particularly close friends, but you were still friends. Could you do that to her?

The other was Link, hero of Hyrule. He was a less appealing option, for a few reasons, but you didn't really know him that well, making it easier to justify giving him this life. Besides, you were going to fix everything later, right? There were a few advantages to being in Links life, one being that he knew most of the people on the tournament grounds, making it easy to get around and talk to people, and potentially find another life if that's what it takes to get yours back. One big problem is that you'd be Zeldas 'boyfriend', something you weren't sure you were willing to deal with. But it was only temporary, right? You could deal with it for a while if you had to.

Of course, you spent so long dwelling over the choices that they've both said their goodbyes, and have turned to walk away from each other! Not wanting to stay like this for much longer, you point the remote at one of them, and press the Life Swap button...
155332222221122.title: Greninja

1553322222211221.content:
Even if it meant forcing her into Greninja's life, Peach was the more appealing option of the two. You convinced yourself that it was only temporary, and you'd put everything back to normal before long. You aim the remote at Peach as she and Link part ways, and press the life swap button.

You find yourself across the hallway, fully clothed once more. A quick glance at where you once stood revealed Peach, now completely naked, with her tongue swollen and enlongated to match Greninja's, and wrapped around her neck. Right now, however, you were a little more concerned with your own position. Looking down at yourself, you find that your tongue...
1553322222211221.title: Princess Peach.

choices: Try to figure out how to reset
15533222222112212.content:
You are shocked to find that instead of returning to its normal state, you tongue had stayed like it had been while you were in Greninja's life.

"Wha? Whaee?" you manage to slur out despite your massive tongue still hanging out of your mouth. Why hadn't it gone back to normal? Thinking back, you seem to recall that despite you gaining Greninja's tongue, Greninja still seemed to have had his identifiable tongue-scarf when he was put into Bowser's life. So maybe the long tongue was a requirement of being Greninja, but it hadn't gone back to normal because having a small tongue wasn't a requirement of being Peach?

Now you were worried. Peach had already wandered off with Greninja's life, but right now you didn't particularly care what Peach was doing, despite the fact that she now possessed the same tongue-scarf as you and Greninja. You were more concerned about your own grotesque tongue. Now, even if you managed to.get back to your own life, you might be stuck with this tongue forever. There had to be a way out. There had to be.

Glancing down at the remote held in your now gloved hand, you figure there had to be something this remote could do to fix this. It had already caused you so much trouble, but right now it seemed to be your only way out of living the rest of your life with a tongue-scarf. But how? The manual didn't really mention a way to fix something like this. Maybe one of the other buttons could yield some results. After all, you had only used the life swap button so far. It would be nice if you could just reset everything though. Maybe there was a way to do that that the manual didn't mention.
15533222222112212.title: Is still large

1553322222212.content:
You hear the voice of Little Mac, one of your fellow newcomers, say, "Oh, sorry about that Little Mac. I wasn't watching where I was going."

Did Little Mac just call YOU Little Mac? Looking up, your eyes practically pop out of your head as you see Little Mac dressed in your clothing, picking up the books you had borrowed. You can barely speak right now. "Wha?"

Once he has the books, he says, "Well, I suppose I'll see you at the training session later." And with that, he turns to walk away, not missing a single step in your high heels.

You are still unable to comprehend what has happened. "Huh? How? Wha?" You look down at yourself, and find that you still have your own body, but it is now dressed in Little Mac's clothes, his boxing gloves hanging around your neck. Still confused by what has happened, your attention is drawn to the remote in your hand, and the box and manual on the floor. "No. Nononononono." If what you think has happened, you have accidentally performed a life swap with Little Mac, so now he thought he was you and everyone thought you were him. Your first worry is not for yourself, but for your children, the Lumas. If this device had truly done what it promised, they should still have a mother to care for them, but you would no longer be that mother, a thought that filled you with dread. You quickly pick up the box and manual and look around for Little Mac, only to find that in your moment of confusion, he's wandered off out of sight. You think hard about what it was you were doing before you bumped into him, but in the stress of the moment you can't seem to remember.

You think about your options right now. You could simply wait until the training session had been scheduled, but what if someone came up to you, thinking you were Mac and asked you to do something else? Maybe there was someone who could help you with the remote. One of the other newcomers, Mega Man, was a robot. He should be good with this sort of thing, right?
1553322222212.title: Little Mac

choices: Rosalina decides to play around with the remote some more.
Rosalina decides to wait until the training session to fix this mess.
15533222222121.content:
After a long and arduous line of thinking, you finally come to the decision to simply wait until the training session. You didn't want to bother anybody, and you doubt Megaman would believe you anyway. After all, you've always been Little Mac in this reality. Anything else would seem crazy to anyone else. With a sigh, you resign to wait until you get the opportunity to fix this, however long that may be.

After a bit of walking, you make your way to one of the leisure rooms, and plop down on a couch, realizing you don't have to adjust your dress to sit comfortably in this outfit. You'd have gone to your room, but it's not yours anymore, and you're not comfortable going into Mac's. Not right now, anyway. For now, you resign yourself to merely watching the TV, an activity you don't particularly care for. When you're the princess of the stars, you have much more important matters to attend to, and don't really have time for time wasters. But now, you did, and you were wondering if you liked it or not. Maybe you could stay like this for a few more days...no, you couldn't. The Lumas need you. You weren't going to stay like this any more then absolutely necessary.

As you lounged around, though, fingers awkwardly thumbing the remote, you gaze out into the hallway, and watch as the many figures pass by the room you're in. Many fighters and newcomers walk by, including Link and Peach, among others. Peach in particular would have a field day if she saw you watching TV, because try as she might, you never bothered with it before. Instead, she just glances in your direction as she leaves your view, reminding you of your predicament. Several assist trophies wander past, as well, such as Tingle or Midna. Even Pokemon, unconstrained by their Pokeballs, are seen passing by, such as a small and fluffy Eevee...followed by the towering form of Giratina. They just let them wander around the halls when not in use in the tournament?

Even other newcomers walk by the door aswell, such as the stubby Villager or the goddess, Palutena. 'Goddess of the Stars'...that had a nice ring to it. No, wait, what were you saying? You really can't use the remote again...or could you? You weren't technically "you" at the moment anyway...you were Little Mac. You could always try being somebody else for the time being...not like you didn't have time to kill as it is, anyway. As long as you didn't do anything other then "Life Swap",
you could easily return to your own role as yourself when the opportunity presented itself. But the other buttons did make you rather curious...

But, that would invariably leave the others in incorrect life roles, and you weren't sure that would be fair to anyone else. They would be none the wiser, of course, but that would be rather rude of you. And it'd be hard to adjust to. Maybe settling for being Mac until you can fix this mess would be the best option. You were the princess of the star's, after all. It'd be uncharacteristic to doom everyone else to random, unfitting lives for a little bit of fun. But, again, they wouldn't be aware of it, and wouldn't mind...Maybe...
15533222222121.title: Wait until the training session

choices: An actual fighter of some kind.
An Assist Trophy or Pokemon of some kind.
155332222221211.content:
You mull it over for a little bit, and decide that, if you have to wait, why not have a little fun. It was irresponsible of you to do, as a Princess, but if nobody noticed...did it really matter? You were originally scared by the possibility that you weren't originally yourself when you found the remote, but if it was impossible for you to be aware of any other possibility, did it matter to you? I mean, it was a little concerning... but you have a magic remote, what the hell. Why not have some fun with it?

So, you get up off the couch, once again realizing that your new, lighter outfit made moving around a breeze. No more adjusting to compensate for a long, floaty dress...when you get your life back, you're considering getting a new outfit of some kind...or using the clothes swap feature to get one, anyway. Stepping out into the hallway, you take a look around as others walk by you, paying you the same amount of attention they'd pay Little Mac himself. There's veteran fighters, who you wouldn't mind borrowing the life of temporarily. Specifically, Peach or Zelda, as you'd atleast be treated like a princess again. But the others...maybe. Other newcomers passed you by aswell, such as Palutena, a goddess you wouldn't mind being, if only for a little while, and Megaman, which intrigued you. What would it be like to be a robot? Probably cold and uncomfortable.

Finally, many of the assist trophies pass by you, and you again catch the sight of the short but somewhat cute Midna. You weren't sure how the others treated her, considering she wasn't a fighter, but if you recall correctly Link was fond of her...and she'd be an inconspicuous form to lay low as until the newcomer training began. And several non-fighter Pokemon make their way through the halls, without a trainer of any sort to watch them, though they seemed very well behaved. They would be very peculiar to swap with, for sure, but... it'd be interesting, at least. Maybe even fun. Although you weren't too keen on being treated like an animal, in any case.

You had a lot of options at the moment, and it was almost daunting. So, after some deliberation, you begin to narrow down your choices. Actual fighters, or an innocuous trophy or Pokemon?
155332222221211.title: Rosalina decides to play around with the remote...

1553322222212111.content: You had so many choices to make like who to swap with, what to swap, how long will you stay swapped among other things. At least you had somewhat narrowed down your options on one of those questions. You chose to swap with someone who was also participating in the tournament as a fighter. They would be the easiest person to find and switch with as compared to a pokeball pokemon or an assist trophy. You also thought that it would be easier to fix everything if you decide to do that later on. Looking at your options along the hall you were at right now, you saw only four other fighters. The first people you saw were the princesses of Hyrule and the Mushroom Kingdom, Zelda and Peach. You also saw two of the other newcomers, Palutena and Megaman. You could swap with either of the four of them. Each person's life was interesting enough for you to want to try out. You could always go look around for smoeone else to swap if you wanted to.
1553322222212111.title: An actual fighter of some kind.

15533222222121111.content:
You choose to swap with someone who was in the hallway with you. It was convenient and if you do find someone better you can just switch lives with again.

Right there were four options for you to consider. They were Peach, Zelda, Palutena and Megaman.
15533222222121111.title: Swap with someone there.

155332222221211112.content:
You briefly considered swapping lives with Peach but quickly changed your mind about doing so. She was from the same world as you so that wouldn't be as exciting as swapping with someone from a completely different place. Also, you noticed that people tended to baby Peach just a little. No offense to Peach but you didn't want to go from a poised and mature upbringing to being coddled and treated like a spoiled child.

Ruling out Peach, you had three options left. Zelda, Palutena and Megaman.
155332222221211112.title: Someone else.

1553322222212111122.content:
You eventually rule out Zelda too. Of the four people you could choose from, she was the one who was most like you from what you knew. You were both princesses. Unlike Peach, you both carried yourselves with a lot of grace and maturity. You were going to use the remote as a way to try being someone different not someone who was a lot like you.

With the two princesses out, you look up to spot your last two choices heading in opposite directions. Whichever one you chose would probably be final for now. In one direction, Megaman was heading towards the leisure room probably to watch TV or play some video games with one of the other smashers. You wonder whether his interest in playing video games would transfer to you if you switch with him. Palutena, on the other hand, was heading towards the library. You didn't know what a goddess like her would be reading in a library but you also consider that she probably didn't get to do what she normally did in her free time because of the restrictions the Hands put on using abilities outside of regulated areas.
1553322222212111122.title: Someone else.

choices: Do a clothes swap on someone
Stay nude and go with Villager
15533222222121111221.content:
Ultimately, you decide to swap with Mega Man. He really couldn't be more different than you had been before this, so he seemed like a good candidate to swap with. You aim the remote at him, and pressed the button, being whisked away from Little Mac's life and into that of Mega Man. Unfortunately for you, Mega Man was a robot, and thus he didn't wear clothes, which meant you found yourself down the hallway where Mega Man had been, entirely naked.

You gasp at the sudden transition, and the sudden lack of clothes, or at least you would, but you were technically a robot now, and thus you didn't breath. Everything felt so different. Your mind was filled with all the data Mega Man had stored within him, and that included everything within his variable weapons system. You weren't entirely sure how you'd use some of them, since you had a human hand and not one that could transform into an arm cannon, but you suppose you'd figure that out if the time came that you'd need to use them. More concerning right now was that you had no clothes on. You quickly look around for someone to perform the clothes swap with. Even though no one saw anything out of the ordinary when they looked at you, it didn't stop you from being embarrassed by walking around in the nude.

"Hey Mega Man!" you hear someone say behind you. You turn around, resisting the urge to cover up your private parts with your hands, and find that the source of the voice is Villager, one of the other newcomers, who was leaning out of the doorway of the leisure room. "You ready?" Mega Man's memories tell you that the two had planned to play some games together before the newcomer training session. You kind of wanted to sort out your clothing situation first, but you didn't want to make Villager suspicious. No one saw anything wrong with you being naked, so maybe you could just try to ignore it for now.
15533222222121111221.title: Mega Man

155332222221211112212.content:
After a moment of thought, you decide to swallow your pride and go see Villager. "Huh?! Uh, coming!" You say, keeping the remote hidden behind your back so he couldn't see.

In the room, you contemplate what to do with the remote. You could try to hide it on one of the nearby shelves where various games for different Nintendo consoles were stacked. However, there might be a risk of Villager finding it.

Do you try to hide the remote or let Villager in on it?
155332222221211112212.title: Stay nude and go with Villager

15533222222122.content:
Moving as quickly as you can without your breasts moving about too much, you head over to Mega Man's room, hoping he was there. You knock on his door, peering down at the box under your arm, rocking back and forth nervously. Not long after knocking, the door opens to reveal the Blue Bomber himself, Mega Man. "Oh, hey Little Mac," he says, "What's up?"

"Uh, yeah. I need a little help. Can I come in?" You still find it a little off-putting that he calls you Little Mac, but hopefully he can help you sort things out.

"Sure." He steps aside so you can come in, which you do, before closing the door behind you. He sits down on the bed and asks, "So, how can I help you?"

"Well... the thing is, I'm not Little Mac. I'm Rosalina." He looks more than a little confused at this. "I'm serious. I just, found this remote on the ground and I accidentally pressed a button and I switched lives with Mac and he ran off before I realised what happened and I couldn't switch back." You take a few deep breaths, before offering the box with the remote and manual in it to him. "Here's the remote and the instruction manual. I thought since you're a robot you might be able to help me with this."

He takes the box off of you and reads through the manual. As weird as it was for you, you do realise how weird it must be for Mega Man as well, to see Little Mac acting this way. "Well, the manual explains it, but unless we find Little Mac in your life, I'm not sure if we can do anything." You let out a sigh. That was not what you wanted to hear. "I'll have a look at the remote though. Maybe I can find something the manual missed." You stand in his room awkwardly, feeling a little exposed in Little Mac's outfit, as Mega Man carefully examines the remote. You note that he doesn't actually press any of the buttons on the front, not wanting to mess something up. After a while, he squints at an area on the front of the remote and beckons you to come over.

"What is it?"

"See this little slit here?" Her points to a spot on the front of the remote, under the buttons. Looking closely, you can see a small slit in the metallic surface of the remote. You nod. "It seems to be some sort of a secret panel. See if you can open it up. I don't have fingernails so I can't really do it."

Taking the remote from him, you fit your fingernail (which you noted was shorter than before) in the slit and try to wiggle it open. Just as Mega Man had suggested, a panel pops open, revealing 6 small coloured buttons.

"Just as I thought," he says. "Give me a second to see if I can analyse them without actually pressing them." You hand the remote back to him so he can figure out what the buttons do. You're not exactly sure how how he's doing it, but you presume it's some sort of robot thing. After a little while, he looks a little surprised. He mumbles to himself, "So if I press this one..." He points the remote at himself and presses the orange button. Had it been anyone else, you would probably have tried to stop them, but you hoped Mega Man knew what he was doing. He looks up at you, a little excited and says, "Well, now I can actually see you as Rosalina wearing Mac's clothes."

Your face lights up with joy as he at least makes a little progress. "Really?"

"Yeah. The orange button makes the person you're pointing the remote at aware of any swaps that have happened, and any that will happen later."

"Well, at least you know I'm telling the truth then."

"That's not all though. If you press the blue button, it will undo the last swap you've done. Just, leave my room before you press it so I don't have Mac confused about why he came to see me." He hands you back the remote with a smile.

"Okay. Thank you so much for your help."

"Not a problem. I can explain the other buttons once you have your own life back, if you want."

"Well, after this little encounter, I'm not sure I still want the remote anymore. What if something goes wrong again?"

"That's what the reset and undo buttons are for." Seeing you were still a bit fearful of what the remote could do, he makes a suggestion. "How about once you have your own life back, you come back here and we try swapping something in a very controlled environment, so you can try it out without anything going wrong?"

"That sounds... interesting. Thanks."

"No problem. Now go ahead and get back to your life."

"Right. I'll be back before you know it." With that you exit Mega Man's room. You had never been so excited for things to be normal. Being very careful not to press the wrong button, you press the blue button, and suddenly find yourself in your room, putting some library books on a shelf, instead of in the hallway. Looking down at yourself, you find that you are back in your usual clothes. A large smile spreads across your face. You're back to being you again!

You hear a voice behind you. "Mama? Are you okay? You just stopped in the middle of what you were saying." You turn to see that the one speaking to you is Luma, the small yellow star child who wanted to accompany you in the tournament.

"I'm fine Luma, don't worry." You don't want to worry your child, so you do your best not to let the past however many minutes spent in Little Mac's life affect the way you speak to him.

"What's that?" You notice he is pointing at the remote. Looks like there's not getting around this one.

After a long explanation of what happened, and pressing the orange button for Luma so he'd know what was happening. After that, the two of you head over to Mega Man's room. The door opens almost as soon as you knock, revealing Mega Man with a big smile on his face. "Good to see you back to normal. Come on in."

It takes a while, but Mega Man eventually explains all the secret buttons to you, and you've labeled them. The blue one is labeled 'Undo', the red one 'Reset', the yellow 'Set', and the green 'Scramble', the orange 'Aware', and the purple 'Unaware'. After all that, Mega Man gets up off his bed and stands in the middle off the room. "Well, if you want to try and swap something in a controlled environment so we can make sure nothing goes wrong, now's the time."

"You want me to swap something with you?"

"Well, that way we can make sure whoever you swap with doesn't wander off before you can swap back. Although I guess that isn't a problem now that we have the undo button."

"Okay." Looking over the different types of swaps, you wonder which one you might try. You end up deciding on a...
15533222222122.title: Go find Mega Man

155332222221222.content: You end up deciding on a...
155332222221222.title: More Swaps

1553322222212221.content:
You point the remote at your robotic friend and press the Head Swap button. It seemed like an interesting choice, especially now that you didn't have to worry about your old body walking away if you wanted to swap back. In an instant, your perspective had changed. You were on the other side of the room, where Mega Man had been standing, and your point of view was closer to the ground. Instead of your usual flesh and blood body below your neck, you could feel cold metal and mechanical parts, and looking down at your own body, or now Mega Man's body, confirms this. You move about a little to get a better look, and find your movements need to be a little more forced to control Mega Man's mechanical body. It feels so surreal, to have a living human head, but a mechanical robot body.

You look up at Mega Man, who is amazed at how freely he can move about with your body. "So this is what it feels like to be human," he says to himself. It looks a little odd to see his robot head atop your shoulders, but you suppose your look just as strange. Since you had made Luma aware of the swaps he flies over to you and exclaims, "Wow Mama! You're a robot!" You can't help but giggle. This situation was so surreal, almost like you had dreamed the whole thing up, except it felt so real.

Once you and Mega Man are done trying out eachother's bodies, you both sit down on Mega Man's bed. "So," he says, "This change your mind about keeping the remote?"

"Oh, definitely." Now that you had tried something out with Mega Man, your mischievous side was starting to come out. "In fact, I think it might be fun to have a little play around with other people who don't know about the remote. A lot of other people."

Mega Man seems to like your suggestion. "Sounds like fun. So, how many other people are we talking? Like, the other newcomers amount of people, or everyone in the tournament amount of people?"
1553322222212221.title: Head Swap

15533222222122211.content:
"I think we'll just swap the other newcomers for now. I was thinking we could continue the head swaps with the others."

"Ooo, that sounds nice. So, are we going to have a set order or are we just going to do random swaps? Because if we're doing random, we might as well try out scramble and just keep resetting until it does head swap."
15533222222122211.title: Just the newcomers

155332222221222111.content:
"I think we''ll have an actual order. I'd like to decide who's body I get."

"Well, if we're not randomising, may I suggest we leave out Pac-Man? We're doing head swaps and he's pretty much all head. Might lead to some very weird results."

"Hm, true. We'll leave him out. Now we've just got to decide an order."

"I have an idea for that too." He gets up, still not used to how light your body felt, and gets a bit of paper and a pen. On the paper, he writes the names of all the newcomers except Pac-Man, including the two on you, in a circle. "This is the order we arrived at the tournament. I was thinking, you decide on what body you want, and then we continue around the circle using however large steps we make for you."

"What about you then? You won't get to choose your body."

"I don't mind. None of the other newcomers are robots, so it'll be a new experience for me no matter who's body I get."

"Okay then." You think about who's body you want. Like Mega Man, you wanted a new experience, and you thought the best bodies for that would be Mega Man's, which you currently had, and Greninja's. Neither of them were human, or at least something like a human (since Palutena was actually a goddess), and it could allow you to experience something you wouldn't be able to otherwise for however long the two of you wanted to leave the newcomers swapped. You could always have swapped with Villager or Little Mac to hop the gender fence, but you figured there was plenty of time for that later, and right now you wanted something a little more extreme.

You figure out who would get who's body for each choice. If you chose to stick with Mega Man's body, then Mega Man would get Palutena's body, Palutena would get Little Mac's, Little Mac would get Wii Fit Trainer's body, Wii Fit Trainer would get Villager's body, Villager would get Greninja's, and lastly, Greninja would get yours. If you chose Greninja's body, then the pairs of heads to bodies would just be reversed. Interestingly, no matter which way you chose, everyone would get a body that wasn't the same species as them, or was the opposite gender to them.

After a little bit of consideration, you decide you want to have the body of...
155332222221222111.title: Actual Order

155332222222.content: Are you the regal princess of Hyrule, Zelda?
155332222222.title: More Characters

1553322222221.content:
You are Zelda, the princess of the land of Hyrule. You had been on your way to the library to pick out some books for some late night reading, when you spot a box lying on the ground in the hallway. Seeing no one around who could have dropped it, you pick it up and see what's inside. Inside you find a strange looking remote and a manual, that no doubt explains what the remote is for. You lean against the wall and flip through the manual, intrigued by this strange piece of technology. According to manual, the device could alter reality itself, and leave everyone except the user none the wiser. This was certainly a powerful artifact indeed, and one you were curious to try out. You look down either side of the hallway you're in, and find two possible test subjects.

On one end, you see your boyfriend and the hero of Hyrule, Link. You weren't sure you wanted to mess with him too much, but at least if you swapped with him, any traits you lost would be close by if you wanted them back. At the other end of the hallway was the fire-type pokemon. Charizard. Swapping with him certainly seemed more interesting, as he wasn't human, but you didn't see Charizard as often as you did Link. In fact, with how often Charizard was late to meals, or with how quickly he ate, there were many days were you wouldn't see him at all. You didn't want to, for instance, give yourself a firey reptilian body below your neck, and then not have an opportunity to get your own body back before the tournament was over and you had to go back to your own world. Still, that didn't seem like much of a problem right now, the tournament hadn't even started yet.
1553322222221.title: Zelda

15533222222211.content:
You decide to swap with Link. Although not as interesting to swap with as Charizard might have been, it could still result in some humorous swaps that you'd be able to see the results of on a regular basis. Then the question was what should you swap with him.

A life swap could be interesting. That way, you could be the hero instead of being the one that needs rescuing all the time. And it'd be pretty funny seeing Link dressing and acting like you. On the other hand, you were also curious about the head swap option. It could allow you to try out what it felt like to be male, without feeling like you were kissing yourself when you kissed Link. And of course, there were a few other options to try too.
15533222222211.title: Swap with Link

155332222222111.content: Which swap do you choose?
155332222222111.title: Head Swap/Life Swap

155332222222112.content: You think over the other swap options. There was the body swap. That'd be kind of like the head swap, except you'd have Link's face as well, and you'd be looking at your own face whenever you looked at him. You'd get to keep your dress too. Of course, you could also put Link's body in a dress by using the clothes swap option. Except that way, you'd actually get to see Link wearing the dress, and you'd get to use both your magic, and Link's weapons in the tournament. Then there was the relationship swap for a more subtle change. You had no problem with your circle of friends, but it might be nice to switch things up and hang out with Mario and Pit every now and then instead of Peach and Samus. Plus, if you understood the manual correctly, that'd technically make you the man in the relationship between you and Link, which could be amusing. Lastly was the gender swap, where you could still be yourself, but you'd be Prince Zelda, and Link would be the heroine of Hyrule. It could be interesting to try out.
155332222222112.title: More Swaps

1553322222221121.content: Which swap do you choose?
1553322222221121.title: Body Swap/Clothes Swap

choices: Find soneone else to swap with
Swap back with Link so you can make him aware of the swap
15533222222211212.content:
You point the remote at Link and press the button for a clothes swap. The swap occurs almost instantly, and you find yourself wearing Link's tunic. All the equipment on your back is a little heavy, but not too uncomfortable. If you decide to keep this for the tournament, you're sure you'll be a force to be reckoned with, having access to both Link's weapons and your magic.

Link, on the other hand, seems a little under-equipped for the tournament. You have to hold back a laugh as he walks down the hallway in your dress, completing the look with you gloves, all the jewelery, everything. You can even see traces of makeup on his face. The moment was short-lived, however, as Link quickly disappears behind a corner, taking your clothes with him. You don't mind, you can find some other targets to swap with, and you'd like to leave him with your clothes anyway.

Although, perhaps it would be even funnier if Link was aware of the swap. He couldn't have gone far, you'd just need to swap back, change the awareness setting to 2, and then swap again. That way you'd be able to see his reaction to everything without everyone being aware of it, and you'd be able to laugh about it while the two of you were alone. Who knows, you might even be able to get him to join you in swapping things if he's not too mad about being put in a dress.
15533222222211212.title: Clothes Swap

choices: "I'd still like my old clothes back though."
155332222222112122.content:
You decide that seeing Link's reaction to wearing your clothes is too good an opportunity to pass up. You quickly walk over to where Link had disappeared behind a corner, finding him a little ways down the hallway. Luckily, there wasn't anyone else around so you didn't have to worry about Link drawing too much attention by freaking out. You press the clothes swap button, putting you back in your dress and Link back in his tunic, then press the button labelled "2" and press the clothes swap again.

Unlike last time, Link stops walking as his clothes change. "W-woah! What the-!?" he exclaims. He frantically looks around at his clothes, twisting this way and that way, pulling at various parts. You don't bother holding back your laughter this time. He turns to see you, dressed in his clothes. "Zelda? Did yu do this?!" You're laughing too hard to answer, and just nod. "W-well, change us back! What if someone sees me dressed like this?!"

You manage to calm down a little so you can answer him. You still find it amusing how he's looking around frantically, worried that someone might see him wearing a dress. "You don't have to worry about anyone making fun of you wearing my clothes," you explain, holding up the remote. "I used this remote, which made it so everyone except me and you thinks it's normal for us to be wearing each other's clothes."

"Really?" He seems skeptical. He probably thought you had just used your own magic to do this. "How are you sure no one will notice?"

"Well I swapped before with a different setting that made it so only I would notice the swap, and you didn't seem to notice that you were wearing a dress before."

"O-okay. I still would have preferred we did this in private instead of having to walk around in a dress in public."

"Oh come on," you tease, "This is probably the most harmless swap I could have done on you."

"You mean there's more the remote can do?"

"Yes. And if you be good and don't make a fuss about your dress, maybe we can try them out together."

You can see him thinking it over. He obviously doesn't like wearing your dress, but you can tell he's curious about the other features of the remote, and he'd like to be able to try them out. After some thought, he says...
155332222222112122.title: Swap back with Link so you can make him aware o...

choices: Tell Link what each button does
Let him choose a button without knowing
1553322222221121221.content:
"Alright", he says, nodding, "it's a deal then."

"Really?" you ask. "You're okay with the dress?"

"Well, I don't really like wearing a dress, but that remote you found seems cool, and I really want to try it out. If all I have to do for you to let me try it out with you is wear your clothes, then I guess I'll wear the dress."

You smile, still trying not to laugh too hard. "Good to have you on board, princess." You giggle a little while calling Link 'princess'. He lets out a smirk and plays along, giving a little curtsey. The two of you are kind of lucky no one is around at the moment, since even though people would find it normal for Link to be wearing a dress, they'd probably still find it odd for you to be calling him princess and for him to be acting in a girlish manner. "So, which button do you want to try out first?"

He looks over the remote. "What do they do?"

"Well, the orange ones change who's aware of the swap. Number 1 is only people touching the remote, number 2 is the people touching the remote, and the person you swapped with, and number 3 means everyone will be aware of the swap. And the blue ones..." You hesitate. Sure, you could tell Link what each button does so he could choose properly, but wouldn't it be fun to let him choose a button without knowing what it swapped? It'd be even funnier depending on who you found for him to swap with. At the very least, you should probably tell him which one is clothes swap. You had already performed that one, and if he was going to be ditching your dress already, you wanted him to gain something else with it.
1553322222221121221.title: "Alright, it's a deal then."

1553322222221122.content: After a little bit of thinking you go with
1553322222221122.title: Relationship Swap/Gender Swap

15533222222212.content: You figure you would get the chance to see Charizard again before the tournament was over (after all, the tournament hadn't even started yet), so you didn't mind the risk that came with getting the more interesting swap. Then there was just the question of what to swap with this fire-breating beast. What first came to mind was the one you had thought of in your little scenario; the head swap. Placing your head on top of Charizard's long neck was definitely an interesting possibility. You seem to recall Charizard being male, but everyone would still consider you female, so you wonder what Link might think about your reptilian genitalia, should you go through with this swap. A life swap seemed rather interesting as well. You would have the body of a princess, but everyone would treat you like a large dragon creature. You'd also gain his Pokemon abilities, such as conjuring fire and flying. That option would leave you naked though, but it's not like anyone would notice. Of course, there were 4 other buttons you could try too.
15533222222212.title: Swap with Charizard

155332222222121.content: Which swap do you choose to perform with Charizard?
155332222222121.title: Head Swap/Life Swap

choices: Do a Head Swap on Someone Else
1553322222221211.content:
You decide to just go with your initial idea and perform a head swap. You aim at Charizard and press the button, and the swap happens almost instantly. You suddenly find yourself down the other end of the hallway, feeling a great deal larger than you had before. You look around at your new body, finding it much easier thanks to Charizard's longer neck. You most certainly had Charizard's body from the neck down, from his long scaly neck, to his large fire-tipped tail. You luckily still held the remote in your clawed hand, although you think it may be a little harder to press the buttons with Charizard's claws. You reach up and lean your neck down, to feel your face and confirm what you had assumed. Atop Charizard's neck, you still had your own Hylian head, complete with your jewelry. It was an interesting experience to say the least. You walk forward a few steps to see how moving around feels, although stomping would be more 'accurate' than 'walking'. You feel a little slower and more cumbersome.

You briefly consider swapping back, but find that's impossible for now, as Charizard has wandered off with your body, effectively preventing you from getting it back. You had initially wanted to try this out, but now it seemed a little big and awkward for you to control. But what could you do about it? Charizard had left with your body. Of course, there were other people around. You could borrow one of their bodies for a while, right? It's not like they could tell any difference.
1553322222221211.title: Head Swap

15533222222212111.content: With Charizard's body, you decide to test out some moves as a dragon like pokemon. You thought that it would be fun doing so. Or maybe you can show yourself to surprise people. You did not have to worry about Charizard as from the look of that pokemon, he looked happy. So you decided to...
15533222222212111.title: Keep Charizard's Body

15533222222212112.content:
You decide to head swap on someone else. You first try to attack Charizard with your own body, but not really damage it so much. You use your new body's strength to grab your old body and the remote. After you grabbed the remote and aim at someone else to swap with.

You decided to swap with Link as you aim at the hero. You couldn't wait to see him having a body of a Charizard. You then press the button and...
15533222222212112.title: Do a Head Swap on Someone Else

choices: Someone you don't want to meet appears
155332222222121122.content:
There was some intervention. Link left to fight in the tournament. Because of that, you ended up swapping heads with something.

Suddenly after the swap, you feel nothing. You try to feel a body, but there was nothing. You discovered that you swapped heads with a capsule that was nearby for some reason. This was really embarrassing for you. Your old lizard body still held the capsule as your Hylian head is left there on the floor. You try to call for help, but no one came.

You spend your time as a disembodied head until...
155332222222121122.title: There was some intervention

1553322222221211221.content: Someone found your head and the lifeless item headed Charizard body. That person would be...
1553322222221211221.title: Someone came to help

choices: Keep Charizard's life, see how different things are...
Make a swap of some kind with another fighter...
1553322222221212.content:
You point the remote towards the fire-breathing dragon, briefly wondering if this was a mistake, before you click the Life Swap button, and suddenly feel the air chill around you as your dress vanished, leaving you fully exposed. You'd expected this, however that didn't make the act of suddenly becoming naked any less embarrassing. You momentarily stop and cover up your genitals, and you gather looks by the other fighters walking by. But they weren't looks of lust or shock, they were looks of confusion, and it dawned on you. When is the last time you saw Charizard cover up? Never. Realizing how strange you looked doing so, you slowly remove your hands from yourself, and allow the cool air to encompass your whole body. It was a unique feeling, being so free. Not having to worry about being clothed, and being able to walk around buck naked without a care in the world. You make a mental note to clothes swap Charizard later after getting your own life back, just because of how nice it felt.

But realizing that you've spent far too long looking at yourself, so you look up, and stifle a laugh. Charizard is wearing your dress, alright. Despite the proportions being modified to fit his body, it still looked completely ridiculous, as his large tail lifted up the back end of it, giving you a clear view of your own underwear. It was an amusing sight, to be sure. If you didn't know any better, you could swear people were glancing at his...well, if people thought he was you, and your dress was positioned in such a way, they'd probably do the same. Looking at his face, he had your crown and jewelry aswell, along with your lightly applied make-up. The whole thing looked quite silly, and you were liking this swap more and more by the minute.

But you noticed something odd. He was...talking to Link? But Charizard's couldn't talk... "Char-" you begin and immediately cover your mouth. Slowly removing your hand, you try to speak. "Char-i-zard..." you say, speaking slowly. That was an unintended side-effect if you ever saw one! You were still making the sounds in your own voice, of course, but you were completely unable to speak! You suppose that was in-character with being the fire breathing dragon (or atleast, to appear as one to anyone else) but it was concerning nonetheless. But you were able to deal with it for now. The pro of being able to streak while nobody batted an eye, or looked at you in a sexual manner at all, heavily outweighed the con of being unable to talk, at least for now. Besides, this was temporary, you were fine!

But looking back towards the dragon who thinks he's you, you suddenly realize that he's gone. "Char." you groan. You were in no hurry to get out of this body, at least for now, but if you wanted to do it now, you'd have a little difficulty. Looking around at the other combatants, all disregarding you as if you were a pokemon, you wonder...what if you swapped with someone else, and got your life back later? That'd doom somebody else to the life of a Pokemon, but if they didn't notice or mind...did it matter? You were quite curious...
1553322222221212.title: Life Swap

15533222222212121.content:
With your own life not being an option to go back to right now, you decide to just keep Charizard's life for the time being. As long as nobody took this remote from you, you'd have plenty of time to try out all sorts of other lives later. You wondered what you should do now that everyone thought you were Charizard. In particular, you wondered what you could do now as CHarizard that you couldn't do as Zelda.

One thought that comes to mind is the speaking problem you had. As a Pokemon, you couldn't be understood by the other people here at the tournament, but the Pokemon seemed to understand eachother just fine, despite all making different sounds. Perhaps you could take the time to try and talk to some of the Pokemon, having the rare opportunity to speak their language.

There was, of course, another trait of being a Pokemon; their moves. Now that you were Charizard, you should be able to use his moveset, and perhaps even Mega Evolve if you got your hands on a Smash Ball. You could always visit the gym and try out some of your new moves. You were curious how you were supposed to perform some of the attacks Charizard used, since you obviously didn't have wings or a tail.
15533222222212121.title: Keep Charizard's life, see how different th...

choices: Someone else comes into the gym
155332222222121212.content:
You decide to head over to the gym to try out some of your new moves. It's certainly a different experience, walking through the halls completely naked and having no one stare at you. It makes you feel rather free, to say nothing of the fact that people thought you were some fire-breathing beast instead of a princess. Upon reaching the gym, you find it to be empty. You smile, this would let you try out your moves without attracting any attention if you screwed something up.

Positioning yourself in front one of the sandbags, you decide to start with Charizard's special moves. You weren't really sure how to go about that though. You knew how to call upon your magic, but how did Pokemon use their moves? You concentrated, searching for any trace of energy that might allow Charizard to perform its elemental attacks. You found a small warmth in your chest. Was this what gave fire-type Pokemon their power? You concentrated on this warmth, and felt it begin to build up. After a while, you tried to release it, and a burst of flames erupted from your mouth, scorching the sandbag. "Woah," you muttered. Or, at least you would have if you could speak normally, it ended up sounding more like "Char." Amazingly, despite the fact you had just spewed fire from your mouth, you couldn't feel any burns in your throat or mouth, just a bit of warmth that was slowly fading.

Deciding to try something a little more tricky, you take a few steps back so you can get a running start. As you charge at the sandbag, you concentrate on the warmth in your chest again, before leaping head first at the sandbag. You body catches alight as you fly through the air, but it doesn't hurt. The pain only comes when you collide with the sandbag, which sends the sandbag flying across the room, and you backwards a little onto your back. You let out a bit of a laugh at how powerful you felt with these moves. Since the sandbag you were using was now across the room, you move to a different one.

Charizard's up special was Fly, which would be rather self explanatory if you had wings. You weren't really sure what to concentrate on for this move, so your just focused and tried to push yourself off of the ground. Surprisingly, you find yourself lifted into the air, knocking the sandbag away in the process, before you slowly fall back down. Since you had all of Charizard's abilities, you'd probably be able to fly longer than that, but while in battle you'd be limited to using Fly like that. You'd definitely like to try out flying for longer one day.

The final special was the down special, Rock Smash. Charizard always seemed to pull a rock out of nowhere when he did that move. You tried to bring a rock out the same way you summoned a phantom for your down special, and it miraculously works. A large boulder appears in your arms. It so large you can barely get your arms around it, but you seem to have no problem holding its weight. You grin at the strength that came with Charizard's life. Thinking back to how Charizard performed the move, you recall he'd smash the rock by banging his head into it. That sounded a little painful, but you decide to try it anyway. You pull back your head, and then swing it forward, headbutting the boulder. It is surprisingly painless, and the boulder shatters, sending three parts flying towards the sandbag.

You put your hands on your hips, quite satisfied with this training session. You were able to perform all of Charizard's special moves, despite having your own body, and it felt great. You'd still like to know what Mega Evolution felt like, but the Hands only let items other than the sandbags out of storage for actual matches, so you'd have to wait until one of the practice matches if you wanted to try it out. Now you weren't entirely sure what to do. You still had the remote,so if you wanted, you could try out someone else's life, or try one of the other swaps. You could also just keep Charizard's life for now and see how different other things were.
155332222222121212.title: Try out your moves.
