1553322222222222222222222221.title: An Assist Trophy

choices: Swap with someone in the tournament
1553322222222222222222222221111.content:
You are Ashley, the young witch under the employment of WarioWare Inc. Currently, you were employed at the Super Smash Bros tournament, in which your boss, Wario, was participating. You were considered an "assist character"; during matches, a competitor might use an item known as an Assist Trophy, which would summon a random assist character to the battlefield to help them in whichever way possible, in your case, using dark magic. It bothered you that the Hands, the beings running the tournament, had cast you as some sort of helper, while incompetent fools like Wario got to compete in the actual tournament. Clearly they underestimated your power, or perhaps it was the other way around. Perhaps they thought you were too powerful and it would be unfair to the other participants to have them face you. You knew this wasn't the case, however, otherwise they wouldn't have let a Goddess participate.

Your familiar, Red, spoke up from behind you. "Uh, Ashley, you might want to watch where you're-"

Before he can finish his warning, your foot hits the item Red was worrying about. You stared at the box a little, not exactly caring what was inside. If someone had left it in the hallway, opened no less, it couldn't have been an item of much importance. Red, however, was more curious. While you watched, unamused, Red rummaged around with the contents of the box to see what was inside.

"Hey, check this out." He held up his findings, some form of electronic remote, and a small booklet, possibly explaining the proper use of said remote.

"Red," you said coldly, "What possible use could we have for such a thing?"

"No seriously, check this thing out." He seemed insistant for some reason, holding the two items up for you to take. Normally, you wouldn't have done any such thing, but the Hands were very strict on what sort of arcane powers you were allowed to use, and as such didn't have much to do, so you took the items from Red and looked through the manual.

Any normal person would have reacted with immense shock at what the manual proposed the remote could do. You, however, were no ordinary person, and were only minimally shocked, not that it showed on your face. This manual claimed the remote was capable to doing things you had thought near impossible, even with the use of magic. Swapping various parts of possibly even incompatible organisms, all while altering the fabric of reality itself such that no one would ever think something was out of place.

You weren't normally one for smiling, but a smirk came across your face as you thought of the possibilities this device presented, even if it meant it was better than your magic. Perhaps you'd be participating in the tournament after all. You could take the role of one of the competitors, preferably one with the ability to use magic, and show everyone you weren't to be trifled with. On the other hand, why bother with some silly tournament anyway? There were being of great power here, power which you could claim for yourself. There was, of course, the aforementioned Goddess, several powerful villains, though despite their best efforts, they never actually won, but the biggest of them all, were the Hands themselves. They had managed to pull together the greatest heroes and villains from across the universe, all for the sake of putting on a little show for crowds eager to see some fighting, and all this without the opposing factions tearing at each others throats. Clearly there was something to be gained from taking over for them.

"Uh, Ashley?" Red asked nervously, "Earth to Ashley?"

You didn't even acknowledge him. You had bigger things on your mind. You might need to find a way to make sure he still knew who and where you were so he could still serve you, but you could worry about that a little later. Right now, you had two big plans, and you needed to figure out which to accomplish first.
1553322222222222222222222221111.title: Ashley

15533222222222222222222222211111.content:
You figured you'd be here at the tournament for quite a while to come, considering it hadn't even begun yet. There would be plenty of time to take over someone more powerful later. Especially someone like Master Hand. You didn't particularly feel like running the tournament, and people would know something was up if you cancelled it. Finding a more powerful life would need to wait until after the tournament was completed and people were preparing to head home.

Of course, there was no reason you had to wait until then to use the remote at all. You could do your other plan for now, and switch again once the time came. For participating in the tournament, you'd need to swap lives with one of the competitors, which meant leaving Red behind. It's possible you could tell him a bout your plan and he'd still remember and come find you after the swap, but then whoever had been dumped in your life would know something was wrong, and if they had your knowledge of the arcane, that would lead to some disastrous results. No, you'd have to leave Red with your old life. You had enough experience now that you didn't really need him anymore anyway, especially if you were taking the life of a spellcaster who didn't require a wand to perform magic.

"Red, go wait in our room." you commanded.

"Huh? But-"

You glared at him. "Go."

"Alright." He was clearly confused about what you were planning, if not a little annoyed that he wasn't part of these plans, but he complied, waddling back the way he had come. Now it was simply a matter of locating a competitor in the tournament. Unfortunately, the Hands had imposed restrictions of where assist characters were allowed to go outside of their quarters, and how long they could be there, so you wouldn't have that much time. While you'd prefer to take the life of someone more skilled in the art of magic, you really just needed someone with less rules restricting where they were allowed to be. Once you had such a life, you could use it to locate one of the tournament's magic users. Some people might end up in wrong lives along the way, but it didn't matter if they couldn't see anything out of the ordinary, right? As luck would have it, or perhaps it was fate, you did run into such a person. It would seem they were returning to their own quarters after visiting a friend playing a minor role in the tournament. Their life wasn't exactly one you'd prefer, but it should serve its purpose for your plan. The person was...
15533222222222222222222222211111.title: Swap with someone in the tournament

155332222222222222222222222111111.content:
It was Pit. He gave you a friendly smile, "Oh hey there, uh..."

"Ashley. My name is Ashley," you said, gritting your teeth to hide your annoyance and hiding the remote behind your back. You decided on a button and positioned your fingers.

Pit chuckled, "Ashley. Right. Listen, I'm trying to find the Centurions. You wouldn't happen to know where they are, would ya?"

You scratched your chin. You barely had a vague idea of who the Centurions were, and no idea where one would find them. They were fodder, unimportant and unrelated. But Pit was here and you couldn't afford to lose this opportunity. "They room is down the corridor from which you came."

"Oh! Thanks." Pit turned around as he left, showing his back to you. With all the expertise of a master wand-user, you whipped out a remote and activated a-
155332222222222222222222222111111.title: Pit

1553322222222222222222222221111111.content: Within moments, you had been transferred into Pit's life. A quick glance behind you revealed Pit was now in your life, looking significantly less cheerful. Abandoning Pit's search for the Centurions, you head off towards the area where the competitors in the tournament lived. Pit's life would serve it's purpose to get you in there, but his was not a life you wished to keep. Your goal now was to find a more suitable life amongst the competitors, preferably one where you could use magic to some capacity, and where you wouldn't be expected to be super cheerful or anything.
1553322222222222222222222221111111.title: Life Swap

choices: You find someone you want to swap something other than lives with
15533222222222222222222222211111112.content: After a while of wandering around aimlessly, looking for someone suitable to swap with, you were still no closer to your goal. You were determined though, and wouldn't easily give up. However, you would give up your search momentarily due to a different distraction.
15533222222222222222222222211111112.title: Something else happens

155332222222222222222222222111111122.content: You spot another competitor in the tournament, but it was definitely not a magic user. You almost dismiss them and continue with your search, but something makes you reconsider. Obviously you weren't satisfied with their life, and any clothes or relationships you swapped would be discarded once you found a new life, but perhaps there was some merit in utilising the other buttons. Most of the competitors in the tournament were adults, and thus, you would probably be taking on an adult's life once you found someone you wished to swap with, so perhaps it would be useful to have the body of an adult. A body swap would completely give you their body, while a head swap would allow you to keep your own head and voice. The person you had spotted was...
155332222222222222222222222111111122.title: You find someone you want to swap something oth...

choices: You reach the Lady Palutena's room.
You run into someone else on the way.
The hands (or their minions) stop and question you.
1553322222222222222222222221111112.content:
There was only one thing from Pit that you desired, and that was his connection to Lady Palutena. With one press of the button, that was yours.

Pit turned the corner and was gone. You concentrated. You were still chafing under the shadow of another, although this time it was Palutena instead of Wario. Almost as important, Red was now his familiar instead of yours, and his loyalty had shifted accordingly. You would gain nothing from telling him of your plans now.

Your goal now was clear. Although you were still an assist character, you now had ample cause to see the Goddess Palutena. As befitting one of her - ugh - loyal soldiers, the location in her room was clear in your mind. All you had to do now was go there.
1553322222222222222222222221111112.title: Relationship Swap

15533222222222222222222222211111122.content: Who was it that Ashley ran into?
15533222222222222222222222211111122.title: You run into someone else on the way.

155332222222222222222222222111111222.content: Was it the male robin or the female robin?
155332222222222222222222222111111222.title: Robin.

1553322222222222222222222221111112222.content:
As you headed towards the Goddess Palutena, you turned a corner and heard someone, "Calm down! You'll hit someone."

You looked up and involuntarily held back a shudder; even through you were technically a child, it always galled you to have others treat you as such. "My... apologies."

"That's fine. Allow me to introduce myself. My name is Robin." She smiled, cutting a rather charismatic figure with her-"
1553322222222222222222222221111112222.title: Female Robin.

choices: Clothes Swap, followed by a Body Swap.
15533222222222222222222222211111122222.content:
You couldn't help but notice Robin's figure. Hers was an adult body. Red hair, twin tails not as long as yours, and an ornate set of clothes capped off with a red robe that put your own robe to shame. You normally didn't care about such aesthetic things, but then you never had a simple way to handle such matters before.

You had to respond, lest this woman get suspicious. You gave a courteous bow, "My name is Ashley." You examined her, "You are one of the fighters in the tournament, am I correct?"

Robin nodded, brandishing her sword. "Yes. This tournament has many powerful foes."

You nodded, barely veiling your disappointment at yet another brute force fighter.

Robin's smile widened, "I can see what you're thinking, but I am no ordinary swordsman." With her free hand, she pulled a tome. Then, with a brief movement of her arm that Ashley could barely observe Robin suddenly had a different tome. She took a few steps back, did a few sword swings, and ended it with a small explosion.

That got your attention. "You are also a magic user?"

"Yes, but I can only use my tomes so many times before they need to regenerate, which is why I carry my Levin Sword!"

"I see."

"Yes. Preparation is essential. I can see you are in a hurry to find someone or something, but charging in without caution will only cause you harm."

"I see." You consider her words. Perhaps something of Robin's would be useful to take on the way, after all.
15533222222222222222222222211111122222.title: Red robe and hair.

15533222222222222222222222211111122223.content: She smiled, cutting a rather charismatic figure with her-"
15533222222222222222222222211111122223.title: Other color palette.

choices: One of the Hands' minions, the Fighting Mii Team
15533222222222222222222222211111123.content:
On your way to Palutena's room, hoping she'd actually be there, you pondered the state of reality at the moment. Having swapped relationships with Pit, you were now serving under Palutena, and an inhabitant of Skyworld. Your role in that world, however, would probably be rather different to Pit's possessing an entirely different set of skills to him. He'd be working under Wario now, and probably be putting his otherwise useless wealth of videogame knowledge to good use making microgames for Wario. You also wondered about that black coloured version of Pit. From what you could tell, it wasn't just a different costume that Pit wore sometimes, it was an entirely separate being, perhaps some sort if evil clone of some sort. Was he now a clone of you? Would this swap affect his appearance in any way to reflect that? It was an interesting idea, but you had more important things to focus on at present.

Speaking of Wario, you can only imagine what sort of stuff Wario would get up to if he got his hands on this thing. Probably money making. Good thing the remote fell into the hands of someone willing to fully utilise it's power for more than a get rich quick scheme. You were after much more than a few coins in the bank.

You were slowly reaching the combatants' quarters, and were about to locate Palutena's among them, when you heard a voice behind you. That voice belonged to...
15533222222222222222222222211111123.title: The hands (or their minions) stop and question ...

choices: The Mii just let's you go
The Mii decided to escort you there
155332222222222222222222222111111232.content:
"Hey! What are you doing all the way out here!?"

Turning to face the person shouting at you, you find one of the Mii Fighters, the minions the Hands created to help them out with this tournament. Even you found it a little unsettling how they all looked like terrible knock-offs of other people. You had even heard there was one who looked like you, but you had luckily not run into her during your time here. This specific Mii Fighter looked somewhat like another of Wario's employees, Jimmy T. You couldn't really be sure though. Sure, it did look sort of like him, but the colour of the afro was grey instead of blue, and his moustache as completely wrong, among other inaccuracies. You had a feeling Crazy Hand played more of a role in the creation of these creatures than his brother, but you didn't particularly care. Right now all you cared about was getting this Jimmy lookalike off your back so you could continue with your plan.

"I'm going to visit Palutena," you replied bluntly. Although you now had Pit's relationship with Palutena, there was no way you were ever going to be heard calling her "Lady Palutena" like he used to.

"Oh you are, are you?" the Mii asked, crossing his arms. "And why exactly are you doing that?"

You knew the Miis weren't all too smart, and figured you could probably avoid the question entirely with the right choice of words. "Do I need a reason to visit her?"

The Mii scratched him head through his afro. "Well... I guess not. It's just, you assists aren't supposed to be wandering around too much."

"Don't worry, I won't cause any trouble." Bleh, you hated playing the "innocent little girl" card, but hopefully this Mii was dumb enough that he'd fall for it.

"Well, I suppose you can go see her."
155332222222222222222222222111111232.title: One of the Hands' minions, the Fighting Mii...

choices: Palutena (or her roommate) is in the room
1553322222222222222222222221111112321.content:
"Thank you," you said, not an ounce of sincerity in your voice. You'd be glad when this Mii would leave you alone so you could drop this act. He nods, and walks off in the other direction, as your usual scowl returns. You walk down the hallway, continuing your search for Palutena's room.

It doesn't take you too long to find it, as in this reality you served under her, and thus should know the location of her room. What you didn't know, however, was who her roommate was, since for some reason beyond your comprehension, the Hands had forced all the fighters to share a room with someone else If Palutena's roommate, or Palutena herself wasn't in her room, that that would throw a definite wrench in your plans. You raise a hand to knock on the door.
1553322222222222222222222221111112321.title: The Mii just lets you go

choices: Palutena's Roommate, or both of them
15533222222222222222222222211111123211.content: But who is in the room?
15533222222222222222222222211111123211.title: Palutena (or her roommate) is in the room

155332222222222222222222222111111232111.content:
After a few seconds, the door opens, revealing the goddess Palutena on the other side. Upon seeing you, she lets out a smile. "Ah, Ashley," she says, "Come on in." She holds the door open and steps to the side so you can come in. You still have the remote hidden in your hand, and would have already swapped into her life if not for an idea that came to you. Why leave the awareness setting on 1? Obviously you wouldn't switch it to 3, but if you switched it to 2, you'd not only have a former goddess serving under you, but she'd be aware of the fact that she stole your position, but would be helpless to do anything against it. You were fairly certain you'd be able to overcome whatever she might do with your powers thanks to the godly powers you'll gain with her life. Although, if she was aware of the swap, she may not be so willing to serve, and there was always the chance of her leaving altogether and joining another faction, which meant losing a powerful ally.

"So, what did you come to see me for?" Palutena asks. Before she can react, you quickly point the remote at her and press the life swap button, with the awareness setting on...
155332222222222222222222222111111232111.title: Palutena

155332222222222222222222222111111232112.content: But who is in the room?
155332222222222222222222222111111232112.title: Palutena's Roommate, or both of them

choices: Try to find Palutena yourself, or go back to your room
1553322222222222222222222221111112321121.content:
You knock on the door, but to your surprise, the person who answers is not Palutena. Instead, a woman dressed in blue with blonde hair covering one eye answers the door. You recognised this woman as Rosalina, the woman who rode the Comet Observatory around the cosmos and acted as a mother to the Lumas. She must have been Palutena's roommate here at the tournament. Apparently she didn't recognise you. "Can I help you?" she asks.

"I'm looking for Palutena," you reply bluntly.

"Oh, she's out at the moment, I'm afraid."

"Do you know when she'll be back, or where she is?"

"I don't. Sorry. I could tell her you came looking for her when she gets back, if you'd like."

"I'd appreciate that." This posed a bit of a problem for you. You could just head back to your room and hope Palutena came to visit once Rosalina told her that you were looking for her, but that would involve a lot of unnecessary waiting that would have been avoided had Palutena been in her room now. You weren't sure if there was an alternative, however. As an assist character, you weren't allowed to be wandering around in the competitors' living quarters for too long, and you could only avoid the Mii Fighters so much.

"Very well. What was your name again? Just so Palutena knows who it was that visited."

Rosalina snaps you out of your thoughts. "Ashley. My name is Ashley."

"Thank you, Ashley. I'll be sure to tell her you came looking for her."

Before Rosalina closes the door, leaving you alone in the hallway, you think of another possible way of getting into Palutena's life. If you swapped lives with Rosalina, then you'd be considered as one of the fighters in the tournament, and wouldn't have the same restrictions as your old life. Then you'd have plenty of time to find Palutena, and if you couldn't find her, then it wouldn't matter as much, since you'd be occupying the life of her roommate, so the two of you would see each other eventually. Of course, if you did this, Rosalina would be in your old life, and be the one totally loyal to you once you became Palutena, while Palutena would be Rosalina. While taking Palutena's life for your own was your primary goal, you'd also prefer that Palutena received your old life. That way you'd have a goddess (or more accurately, a former goddess) serving you.
1553322222222222222222222221111112321121.title: Palutena's Roommate

1553322222222222222222222221111112321121.content: Rosalina closes the door, leaving you alone in the hallway. You now had a little bit of a dilemma. Should you just go back to your room and hope that Palutena would come and visit once Rosalina told her you had been looking for her, or should you search for her yourself, and risk punishment from the Hands if you got caught wandering around for too long?
1553322222222222222222222221111112321121.title: Try to find Palutena yourself, or go back to yo...

1553322222222222222222222221111112321121.content:
Accepting defeat for now, you make your way back to your room. It was disappointing that you had such grand plans, only for them to be foiled by one small detail, but you'd succeed soon enough. Soon, very soon, you'd no longer be Ashley, you'd be Palutena, the Goddess of Light. But right now, that simply wasn't in the cards.

When you make it to your room, you notice that Red is nowhere to be seen. It made sense, since Red was now Pit's familiar instead of yours. You suppose this meant you'd need to perform your magic without him now. However, closer examination of your room reveals you now own a staff, which looks somewhat similar to Palutena's, as well as a magic broom. Searching your memories of he current reality, you find that like Pit had been, you are the captain of Palutena's guard. Since Pit's weapons had been given to him by Palutena, as well as her using the power of flight to aid him in his missions, you had received a staff and a broom from her so that you could perform the very same missions. Since Pit no longer had the goddess he worked for to receive his weapons from, Red now transformed into a bow for Pit to use, just like he used to turn into a wand for you.

You put the remote down on your dresser, and pick up the staff, finding it to be fairly light and easy to move about. You were still going to be taking Palutena's life at the first chance you got, but at least she wouldn't be useless when she got dumped into your life. Since the staff was somewhat similar to Palutena's, maybe you could practice with it a bit for when you became her. You weren't sure how much of your arcane knowledge would be kept when you stole Palutena's life, but a little practice never hurt anyone. However, your eyes are drawn back to the remote. Even though you had your plan laid out perfectly, the allure of using it to mess with reality tempted even you. Perhaps you could try it out a little more. As long as you didn't life swap or relationship swap, it shouldn't mess up your plan, right?
1553322222222222222222222221111112321121.title: Head back to your oom

15533222222222222222222222211111123212.content:
You wait a little while after knocking, but hear no signs of life behind the door. Clearly both Palutena and her roommate are out at the moment, leaving you with no indication of where she'd be. This presented you with a bit of a problem. While the Miis could generally be outwitted, it was only a matter of time before one of them, or one of the Hands, took you back to your room. You couldn't exactly wait here forever, and without somewhere to start from, you couldn't just wander around looking for her. You could probably ask one of the other competitors where she was, but even then if you couldn't find her in time, you'd still be carted off back to your room.

There was a way around that though. You could use the life swap button to temporarily put you in the life of one of the other competitors to buy you some more time, as you had originally thought to do. However, you wanted Palutena to be in your old life. Taking the life of a goddess was one thing, but putting that goddess in your old life so that she'd be the one serving you was another. Putting someone else in your life would complicate things a little, but it was still possible to pull off. You'd prefer if you didn't have to bother with other people's lives though. Although, it would also help you find Palutena, since if the person you swapped with knew where she was, then you'd know where she was. It's possible you could then swap back once you had the knowledge and try to find her while back in your own life.
15533222222222222222222222211111123212.title: No one is home

choices: You find one of the tournament's magic users
Someone interrupts you as you search
155332222222222222222222222111112.content: That cheerful kid, Villager. He certainly wouldn't have been your ideal choice, especially with how happy and friendly he always was around absolutely everyone, but he'd serve his purpose well. You waited until he was finished saying goodbye to that dog lady he seemed to be friends with, and hit the life swap button. In an instant, you were standing where he had been, dressed in his t-shirt and shorts. You could also feel that your hair was no longer in its usual twin pigtails. You have a brief look back at where you had stood before, to see Villager, wearing your clothes, a much more sombre expression on his face. You suppose he'd be the one working for Wario now. Now that you were in the life of one of the tournament's participants, you were free to move around the tournament grounds as you pleased, and thereby find a more suitable life to occupy for the time being, preferably one where you were still able to use magic. You seemed to recall a couple of the princess being able to use some spells, as well as one of the swordsmen. Even that goddess would be a good choice, if you got the chance. Now it was just a matter of finding one of them.
155332222222222222222222222111112.title: Villager

choices: Go through with the match as Villager
Swap lives with Wii Fit Trainer
1553322222222222222222222221111122.content:
While looking for one of the tournament's magic users, you hear a shout from behind you. "Villager!" It takes you a moment to realise that the voice it calling out to you, and you turn around to see who is interrupting your search. You see the woman known as the Wii Fit Trainer running towards you. Once she reaches you, she grabs you arm and starts pulling you along, running back the way she had come from. "C'mon," she says, "You're going to be late!"

"What?" you say, a bit caught off guard by the fact that this woman had run up to you and was now pulling you by the arm.

"You have a practice match in a couple minutes! Did you forget?"

Searching through Villager's memories, you find what Fit says to be true (barely registering that you were using Villager's nickname for the Wii Fit Trainer). Leading up to the start of the tournament, competitors had to compete in scheduled practice matches to make sure they were ready. Villager had one if a few minutes from now, and the Hands didn't take too kindly to tardiness. You try to think about who the match was against, but you can't seem to remember. Apparently Villager had been more focused on his visit to Isabelle than his match, although he had planned to be there on time before you took his life and started searching for a more suitable life.

You weren't entirely sure you were ready for this. You may have Villager's life, and therefore all his skills, but you weren't sure you wanted to go into battle with his improvised arsenal, as opposed to any of the magic powers you had been searching for. Perhaps it would be best to avoid the match altogether. Sure, as Villager you didn't have a way out, but you still had the remote so you could borrow someone else's life, and then continue your search. Unfortunately, you didn't see anyone else as the corridors sped by, perhaps they were all waiting to watch the match. Of course there was a life you could take nearby, if fact it was currently pulling you by the arm.
1553322222222222222222222221111122.title: Someone interrupts you as you search

15533222222222222222222222211112.content:
Although you had wanted to compete in the tournament originally, with this remote you had much grander plans than entering a little fighting competition. With the Hands gathering some of the most important heroes and villains from throughout the universe together in one place, you had your pick of becoming anyone you wanted, and what you wanted was power.

"Ashley," red buts in, "You've got that look in your eyes again."

"Red, this device could be the best thing that ever happened to us," you explain. "With everyone gathered here at the tournament, we can use this remote to acquire new lives. Powerful lives."

"Ah, I get ya. So, you got someone in mind?"

You think about who you could swap with. There were a few powerful magic users amongst the competitors of the tournament, but as an assist character your capacity to go looking for them was limited. There were also a few powerful people among the assists and background characters, such as another goddess from the same world as the one you had thought of before. They would probably be easier to access. There were also the Hands themselves, but you rule them out for now, as you had no interest in organising and running the tournament yourself. Who do you go looking for?
15533222222222222222222222211112.title: Swap with someone powerful

155332222222222222222222222111122.content:
"As we are currently considered assist characters, we can't exactly go looking for anyone currently competing in the tournament. Looking for another assist character, or a background character, would probably yield the best results," you reason.

"What about the assist Pokemon?" You glare at Red. "W-well, some of them are essentially gods in their own world."

"Regardless of their status, I will not be treated like an animal."

"Okay then. So, who's it gonna be?"
155332222222222222222222222111122.title: An assist or background character

1553322222222222222222222221111222.content: Who do you go looking for?
1553322222222222222222222221111222.title: A Background Character

15533222222222222222222222211112221.content:
"I'll swap lives with Viridi," you declare.

"You mean the goddess of nature, from Pit's world?" Red asks.

"Correct."

"Well what about me then? Are you just gonna leave me babysitting your old life while you get to be a goddess?"

"I don't recall ever needing to be babysat," you say, glaring daggers at Red. "I believe one the the commanders in Viridi's army is also assisting at the tournament. You may swap with her."

"But she's..." You continue to glare, silencing Red's complaints. He sighs, "Ugh, fine." If you had to guess, you'd say he was probably going to complain about swapping lives with a girl. "So how are we gonna do this?"

"If I asked you to head back to our room for no apparent reason and leave me alone, would you?"

"Uh, weird question, but sure, I guess."

"Good, that's important for the plan. Since the remote requires both of us to hold onto it in order to be aware of the swap, we shall find Phosphora first. We will both hold onto the remote, and you will swap into her life. I will ask Phosphora in your life to return to our room, and if your answer just now is any indication, she should comply, allowing you to return to me with the remote. We will then locate Viridi, and I will swap lives with her."

"Well, I guess that works."

"Well, we'd better start looking." The two of you head off in search of Phosphora.
15533222222222222222222222211112221.title: Viridi

choices: Red has left, with the remote
155332222222222222222222222111122211.content:
While walking through the halls of the living quarters for the assist and background characters, you happen to see Phosphora leaving Viridi's room. It seemed she had been visiting Viridi, and was currently rolling her eyes at how much Viridi had complained about the Hands' restrictions. "How convenient," you mumble. You crouch slightly, holding the remote at a height where Red could reach it. Reluctantly, he points it at Phosphora and presses the life swap button.

Instantly, you find yourself no longer crouched down, and standing next to Phosphora, who was completely naked and holding Red's trident. Trying not to be off-put by her lack of clothes, you tell her, "Red, go back to our room."

"What? Why?" she asks. It seemed the manual had held true to what it said. Phosphora truly believed she was Red.

"Just do it." Grumbling a little, Phosphora turns around heads towards your room. You normally kept a sombre expression on your face, but you let out a small smile. You turn back to where Phosphora had stood before the swap.
155332222222222222222222222111122211.title: You find Phosphora

155332222222222222222222222111122212.content:
After a while of searching, you still have failed to locate Phosphora. You had even checked her room. It seemed she was probably off somewhere else, doing something. "Well this is going nowhere fast," Red grumbles.

You let out a bit of a sigh, annoyed at Red's complaining. Did you really need to keep him around? Once you had Viridi's life, you'd have her entire army at your command. Red had been a loyal minion, but sometimes sacrifices had to be made. "Well, if we can find Phosphora, then we'll have to make a change to the plans."

"What do you mean?"

"Red, head back to our room."

"Wait, then-"

"I no longer require your assistance. It would do you well to forget that this remote ever existed, and to treat whoever is in my life as they are truly me." Turning you back on him, you head towards Viridi's room, since the Hands' had restricted her movements around the tournament ground even more than regular assist and background characters. You weren't sure if Red had obeyed your orders, but whatever he did, it was clear he wasn't still following you.

Upon reaching Viridi's room, you turn the doorknob, surprised to find it was unlocked. Clearly Viridi didn't expect an intruder since she had to stay in her room so much. You push the door open with one hand, and point the remote at her with the other, pressing the life swap button. You find yourself lying on Viridi's bed, dressed in her clothes, your hair repositioned to make one tail on the left side of your head, rather than two with one on either side. The opposite was true for Viridi, who now stood in the doorway of what used to be her room. Viridi, who now believed she was you, uttered, "Sorry, wrong room." The apology sounded entirely insincere, just as it would have been had it been you yourself saying it. Viridi leaves, closing the door behind her, and leaving you alone in the room.

You consider the current situation. You were currently Viridi, the Goddess of Nature, from the world the Hands had referred to as "Kid Icarus". You commanded the Forces of Nature, and had previously used something known as the "Reset Bombs" to wage war on humanity, and restore the land to it's natural form. It was because of this that Viridi had been brought to the tournament, to appear in the background of a stage based on Pit's first encounter with a Reset Bomb. Even though you had teamed up with Pit and Palutena to assist in defeating Hades and the underworld army, the Hands were still cautious of you, due to your past actions against the humans, and had placed many restrictions on where you could go and what you could do.

It was a shame that you had to give up a lot of freedom, as well as your role assisting in the tournament, in order to attain such power, but it was worth it in your eyes. You also seemed to recall that along with Phosphora, the competitors in the tournament from your world would apparently come to visit occasionally. Perhaps if Palutena, the Goddess of Light, visited you, you could claim her life instead and have both power and freedom. However, you felt a title such as "Goddess of Light" didn't suit you, so you'd probably return to Viridi's life once freedom was no longer an issue.

But for now, your freedom was still restricted, so you needed to find something to do to pass the time. Even though the remote had given you all of Viridi's abilities, it would probably be wise to ensure that knew how to properly use them. The Hands' had placed restrictions on what magic you were allowed to use, and it seemed the same was true of Viridi and her godly powers, but if the Hands didn't know you were using them, there was no problem. Speaking of the remote, you still had it in your possession. While Viridi might not have had as much freedom as you had, you could still leave for a brief moment in order to try using the remote again. You certainly weren't about to go swapping lives again, giving up your newly acquired position as a goddess, but that didn't mean you couldn't try out some of the other functions.
155332222222222222222222222111122212.title: You can't find Phosphora

choices: Bring the remote to Master Hand
1553322222222222222222222221121.content:
You are Isabelle, the assistant of the mayor of Smashville. When you had been asked to come to the tournament alongside the mayor, Villager, you had been a little worried about leaving the town without anyone in charge, but the townsfolk assured you that everything would be alright. Your brother Digby even promised to take care of town hall while you were out. The Hands, the people running the tournament, had wanted you to be an assist character to help out with the tournament. You weren't very good at fighting, so you helped out by throwing healing items to the person who called you to the field.

You had just gone to see the mayor, and were heading back to your room. The Hands didn't really like having assist characters wandering around a whole lot, so you followed that rule. However, on your way there, you came across a box left in the hall. A lost item perhaps? You'd have the get that back it it's owner. Unfortunately, the box didn't appear to have a name on it, and the address was just for the tournament grounds. You didn't really want to snoop, but you didn't really want to just leave it here either. The only alternative seemed to be to check inside the box and see if you could identify the owner from the contents of the box.

Inside seemed to be some sort of remote and an instruction manual. You quickly flipped through the instruction manual to see what the remote could do, and nearly dropped the box in shock. This remote could change things about people with anyone noticing?! This seemed way too powerful for someone here to have, and you were sure the Hands wouldn't approve of it if they knew about it. You'd have to report this too them!

...Of course, there was no guarantee this thing actually worked. But you couldn't actually try it out, could you? No, of course not. That would be against the rules, and far too irresponsible. But... maybe a little test wouldn't hurt, right? If no one knew about it what was the harm in it? You shook your head. "Bad Isabelle! You can't be doing that to people!" you thought. You headed towards Master Hand's office to hand in the remote so he could do something about it.
1553322222222222222222222221121.title: Isabelle

15533222222222222222222222211211.content: You had to hand this in. Not only would it be far too irresponsible for you to use something you found on the ground without permission, but this definitely seemed more advanced than anything from your own world, and the buttons weren't really made to be pressed with your paws. You didn't put it box in the box as you walked, though. You were fascinated by it, that something this powerful could even exist. You studied it in your hand, almost looking for some sort of sign that this wasn't real. And as the cliche would go, you bumped into someone while you weren't paying attention, accidentally pressing one of the buttons with your paws. But who did you run into?
15533222222222222222222222211211.title: Bring the remote to Master Hand

155332222222222222222222222112111.content: The person you had bumped into was one of the competitors in the tournament, who had come to visit someone else staying at the living quarters for the assist characters and background characters. But who was it exactly?
155332222222222222222222222112111.title: A competitor in the tournament

1553322222222222222222222221121111.content: The mayor of Smashville (and thus, your boss), Villager, seemed to have come to see you here in the assist character living quarters, even though you had just come back from visiting him. You felt strange after colliding with him, and it wouldn't be long before you discovered you had pressed the button for a...
1553322222222222222222222221121111.title: Villager

15533222222222222222222222211211111.content: You discovered you had pressed the button for a...
15533222222222222222222222211211111.title: Body Swap/Head Swap/Clothes Swap

choices: Villager leaves, which lets you swap back
Villager notices the remote, and gets curious
155332222222222222222222222112111111.content:
As you recoil from the bump, you hear something strange; your own voice, but it wasn't coming from you. "Oh, Isabelle," your voice says. "Sorry about that. I just came over here because you left your notebook at my room, but I guess I wasn't looking where I was going." You look up to see your notebook being offered to you, but what concerned you was the hand holding it. It was a paw, covered in yellow fur. Following the arm upwards, you saw that the person offering your notebook to you was you, or at least they looked like you, except their hair wasn't up in your usual topknot, and instead of your normal clothes, they were wearing the clothes Villager had been wearing when you went to visit him; a red shirt with a No. 1 on it, grey shorts, and blue shoes. Then you noticed yourself.

You certainly weren't a dog anymore. Even just looking at your hand, you didn't have fur anymore, and you had thumbs. How did this happen? And then you notice the remote and the box, still held in your hands. You must have accidentally swapped bodies with Villager when you bumped into him! Doing your best not to freak out, you say "Thank you, Mayor," and take the notebook from him. Now you definitely didn't want anything to do with this remote. You were going to switch back with Villager as soon as he turned away (so he wouldn't get curious and want to keep it, of course), and give it to Master Hand as soon as possible.
155332222222222222222222222112111111.title: Body Swap

155332222222222222222222222112112.content: The person you had bumped into was one of the other people who stayed here at the living quarters with you, but which part of the living quarters did they come from?

15533222222222222222222222212222.title: More Assist Trophies

15533222222222222222222222212222111.content:
You are Lyn, the princess of Caelin. You have been chosen to make your second appearance as an Assist Trophy in Super Smash Brothers. While you were disappointed that you had been neglected again as a fighter you still accepted the assist role. As you were walking, you stumbled upon a small box. Curious, you picked up the box.

You look inside of the box, and find a remote and an instruction manual. You are interested in the manual, and you start to read it. You are absolutely stunned at what the manual implies. The manual implies that you can swap around various parts with other people. Although you don't believe this at first, you decide to test the remote out.

As you look around, you find two potential fighters that you can swap with. You firstly see Samus, the intergalatic bounty huntress. You definitely think about swapping with Samus, but another fighter catches your eye. This fighter is Greninja, a new Pokemon intorduced during the tournament. Although swapping with Greninja would be somewhat weird, you find it somewhat interesting.

You think over which one of these two fighters you should swap with.
15533222222222222222222222212222111.title: Lyn

155332222222222222222222222122222.content:

1553322222222222222222222222.title: More Choices

15533222222222222222222222221.content: Are you the Embrace Pokemon, Gardevoir?
15533222222222222222222222221.title: A Pokeball Pokemon

choices: Seek out a Pokemon fighter, take their role (or body, if it comes to it).
Seek out a Princess, acquire Dress (or body, if you so desire).
155332222222222222222222222211.content:
You are Gardevoir, the previously only psychic, now psychic/fairy type Pokemon. Your role in the tournament is the same as all the other Pokemon; Use a pre-determined attack to benefit whomever summons you in battle, and dissapear. Even if you're summoned by a Pokemon, which caught you off guard the first time it happened. Either way, you spend quite some time inside a Pokeball on the field, but the hands were gracious enough to allow you, and all the rest of the pokemon, to wander the halls of the tournament grounds to your hearts content (aslong as your trainer is okay with it; and they were).

Despite how much fun it was to help out on the battlefield, you couldn't help wish for more. Heck, other Pokemon got to fight! You didn't even get to attack anything! It only you could have a chance to fight, if only for a little while...


...and as fate would have it, you nearly trip over a small cardboard box on the ground, which you raise off the ground telepathically to examine. Having no qualms with opening an unmarked package, you rip it open in an instant, and hold the contents of it up in the air. A remote and a... manual?

You nearly discard the objects, but the word "swap" steals your attention, and suddenly you find yourself reading the entire manual, finding each word increasingly hard to believe. Swap with...anyone? If what you were reading wasn't an elaborate fake, this was exactly what you were hoping for. You could finally fight, like the others, and nobody would be the wiser!

Of course, there was the matter of whom to swap with...logic dictates you swap lives with a pokemon fighter, and take their place...yet, looking down at yourself, part of you wished to experience something a bit more...elegant, than what you had. Sure, your dress was nice, but you couldn't exactly take it off. Imagining wearing one of the Princess' dresses was an idea you quite liked...or maybe having the body to go with it, too? Possibilities...
155332222222222222222222222211.title: Yes, you are.

1553322222222222222222222222112.content:
You decided to find a Princess and acquire their clothing. If the remote's manual was accurate no one would notice, so there would be no harm done, right?

You took the remote and started wandering the hallways. After some time wandering you ran into-
1553322222222222222222222222112.title: Seek out a Princess, acquire Dress (or body, if...

155332222222222222222222222212.content:

- Arceus
- Eevee
- Victini
- Chespin
155332222222222222222222222212.title: No, you're some other Pokemon.

155332222222222222222222222212112.content:
You are Eevee, the evolution Pokemon. You don't remember what trainer caught you, but the first time you had been let out of your Pokeball, you were in a strange, futuristic looking place, and a weird looking person explained what you had to do here. You were supposed to wait in your Pokeball while other people did matches, but if someone let you out, you were supposed to help them. It all seemed pretty fun, especially with all the other Pokemon and strange people here.

You had been wandering around, looking for something to do, when you came across a box in the hallway. Curious, you tried to open the box, but end up just tipping it over, knowing the contents out. Inside was some weird remote thingy and a small book. Since you couldn't read human language, you ignored the book and went over to the remote. Maybe it did something funny. You tried pressing one of the buttons with your paws, unwittingly swapping with a passerby. Who did you swap with?
155332222222222222222222222212112.title: Eevee

15533222222222222222222222222111.content: Which background character are you?
15533222222222222222222222222111.title: Kapp'n/Viridi

155332222222222222222222222221112.content:
You are Viridi, the Goddess of Nature, and you are fed up with this stupid tournament. When the Hands had requested your presence at the tournament, you had assumed you'd be on the battlefield like Pit and Palutena. Heck, even Dark Pit got to fight. At the very least, you had thought you'd be an assist character like Phosphora and Magnus. But nooooo, they stuck you in some stupid role showing up in the background of a stage. You didn't even do anything significant! You'd just show up in the background for a few seconds and then the Hands would drop the artificial Reset Bomb to transform the stage. You had told them several times that they could have just used a hologram or something instead of dragging you out all this way, but the Hands insisted on being authentic.

They could probably tell you weren't exactly happy about the situation, because they had placed even more restrictions on where you could go on top of those already in place for other characters, lest you get ideas about dropping a Reset Bomb on the tournament. Like you'd do that. You had just gone and talked (or perhaps 'complained' would be more accurate) to Phosphora about it, but your time was now up and you needed to head back to your room.

"Stupid Hands," you mumbled to yourself, kicking the air as you walked. Or at least, you had tried to kick the air, but there was something in the way. A small cardboard box, with the top opened up, lay a little ways away from you. Apparently you had kicked it without noticing it was there. "Hmph, what careless person would leave trash lying around?" You pick up the box, intending to throw it away once you got to a trash can. You do have a peek inside the box though.

"Huh? Looks like something the Aurum would use." Inside the box was a small remote of some sort, as well as some sort of instruction manual. "Hm... maybe this could be useful." You decide to take the box back to your room to investigate further.

Once in your room, you started going through the manual to try and see what you could figure out. The whole time, you were muttering things like, "What!? No way!" Even gods couldn't do the things this remote could apparently do. You really wanted to try this out. Maybe you could just do a little test, surely that couldn't hurt.

Then again, the hands had forced you into this stupid supporting role, maybe you could do something a little bigger to have a better time here at the tournament.
155332222222222222222222222221112.title: Viridi

choices: Choose someone specific to swap with
Swap with the first person you see
1553322222222222222222222222211122.content: You decide you're fed up with putting on a show for the Hands, it's time for a little fun. You head towards the area where all the competitors in the tournament stayed, planning to swap lives with one of them. Even if it wasn't for the tournament, the thought of living someone else's life, everyone thinking you were them, just excited you. You thought about who's life you might want to try out. There were plenty of good options. You could even stay as a god if you swapped with Palutena. It could get you some more time with Pit too. Then again, finding someone specific could take time, time in which the Hands might be able to find you and take you back to your room. Maybe you should just swap with the first fighter you see, and then you can find a better life from there.
1553322222222222222222222222211122.title: Do something big

15533222222222222222222222222111221.content: You decide you don't just want to go swapping with any random person. Thinking over who to swap with, Palutena instantly comes to mind. You'd still be a goddess, but you'd get to compete in the tournament. And considering her relationship with Pit, you'd get to spend a bit more time with him. And since Palutena came from your world, you shouldn't have much of a problem pretending to be her. She seemed like the perfect candidate, but you're sure you could have fun as other people too.
15533222222222222222222222222111221.title: Choose someone specific to swap with

15533222222222222222222222222112.content: Which background character are you?
15533222222222222222222222222112.title: Nabbit/Alfonzo

choices: Find someone to swap with to pin the blame on
Find someone to swap with and steal from
155332222222222222222222222221121.content:
You are Nabbit, the thieving rabbit of the Mushroom Kingdom. The Hands had hired you to appear on the Mushroom Kingdom U stage, catching fighters and taking them away. However, they knew what you were like, and had been trying to make sure you didn't steal anything. In fact, whenever something valuable went missing, your room was one of the first places they checked.

It didn't stop you though, you just couldn't help yourself when it came to stealing. You had just dashed back to your room after snatching up anything you could find. You emptied your sack over your bed to examine what you had collected. Something caught your eye, though, something you didn't remember picking up. It looked sort of like a TV remote, but with pictures on the buttons, well, most of them at least. Next to it was a little booklet, possibly an instruction manual, and a cardboard box. The box you did remember picking up, and you guessed this thing was inside the box, and fell out when you emptied your sack.

You take a quick look through the manual, and are surprised by what you read. Was this really possible? Those sorts of questions are quickly drowned out, though, as your mind begins to formulate how you might be able to use this to your advantage. You could pull off the greatest heist the Mushroom Kingdom, no, any of these worlds had ever seen! If you swapped with someone else while stealing, they'd get the blame if you got caught, and if you succeeded, you could put the stuff you stole somewhere safe for you to collect once you swapped back. Or better yet, you could just swap with the person you were stealing from to make them willingly give everything to you. Plus, how great of a thief would you be if you actually stole someone's life or body?
155332222222222222222222222221121.title: Nabbit

1553322222222222222222222222211212.content: Who do you swap with?
1553322222222222222222222222211212.title: Find someone to swap with and steal from

15533222222222222222222222222112121.content: Suddenly, you see princess peach at the end of the hall. You think she would be perfect, since she is the richest person in the Mishroom Kingdom. You get the remote ready but what button do you push?
15533222222222222222222222222112121.title: Peach

1553322222222222222222222222221.content:
You are Shulk, a homs from the world of Bionis. The invitation to the smash bros tournament had taken a while to get to colony 9 of the bionis, and it had taken you even longer to travel there. You stepped out of the spirit train, as Alfonzo from the legend of Zelda: Spirit track was kind enough to give you a lift, the rest of the way from when you first entered, into the residential area for the fighters. "Thank you, Alfonzo," you said. "No problem Shulk, see you around," he replied politely as you walked on to the platform of the train station, and he took of.

You lifted one arm up high into the air, grabbed it with the other, and did a few stretches, "Now where do I go from here?" You asked dropping your arms, and started to walk around, until your foot hit something, after picking up the box which you had just kicked, and seeing no one around, you assumed someone must had left it here. "Maybe I should ask around, someone may looking for this, but I didn't get a vision" you noted, but allowed your curiosity to get the better of you, and looked inside. A small remote, unlike any you had seen, it had nine buttons, with pictures on, but they did make sense, with it was a manual. "Perhaps this will help," You said sitting down on a bench and began to read. The buttons made sense.

"I wonder if this works?" you asked your self, "But if it belongs to someone I should return it. What should I do?"
1553322222222222222222222222221.title: Shulk

15533222222222222222222222222211.content: You figured there was no harm in testing it out. If the remote could truly swap things and make everyone unaware of the changes, you should be able to quickly swap something and then swap back, just to try it out, without causing any big panic. You didn't really have an idea of who this would belong to anyway, so maybe trying it out could give you a better idea of who could be its owner. You were also somewhat curious about the limitations of the swaps. From the descriptions of the swaps in the manual, it wouldn't make sense for it to work on inanimate objects, and things would get pretty messy if it did. From the description of the relationship swap, it would seem the remote was designed with a meeting of worlds such as this tournament in mind, which you found somewhat odd. You wondered if it would work on some of the non-humanoid competitors in the tournament. It was one thing it the remote could mix and match parts and abilities of lifeforms with a similar biological structure, but if it allowed you to swap things with, for instance, a robot or a Pokemon, that was another thing entirely. As you wander, you manage to find someone to test the remote on. It was...

You identified the green haired lady in front of you as Palutena, the Goddess of Light. You had a goddess as your first test subject for some questionable remote that you didn't know if it even worked. This was insane, and you were sort of questioning whether or not you should really go through with it. You ultimately decide that there's never a better time than the present, and suck it up and decide which button you wanted to press. Part of you wanted to do something small, like a clothes swap or a relationship swap. You hadn't originally intended to swap with a woman, and doing something small would make things less awkward, regardless of whether you were going to swap back or not. However, your more adventurous side was wanting to try something a little more wild. When would you ever get the change to be in someone else's body, or live the life of a god(dess)? Well, if the remote worked, then the opportunity would appear a lot more frequently if you couldn't find the remote's owner (or just decided to keep it for yourself), but once again, there was no time like the present.

Which button do you press?

You point the remote at Palutena and press the body swap button. Within an instant, you find yourself with an entirely different body, one belonging to the Goddess of Light. To say you felt a little different was an understatement. Even just looking down was a different experience, with Palutena's breasts sticking out underneath your shirt, and her long green hair falling in front of your vision. "Woah," you say, before reaching a feminine hand to your throat as you realise you had Palutena's voice as well.

You realise that if you had Palutena's body, that meant she had yours, dressed in her usual clothes. She probably looked a bit ridiculous. However, looking up at where Palutena had stood moments ago, you are greeted with absolutely nothing. "Oh no," you utter, panic creeping into your voice, "She's gone. I knew this was a terrible idea."

You contemplate.chasing after her, but without knowing where she was going, it would just end up a wild goose chase. You did still have the remote though. You may not be able to get your body back right now, but perhaps you could borrow someone else's for a while, or perhaps find a way to make your stay in Palutena's body a bit more comfortable. However, you had already seen what the consequences could be from swapping things. You had already lost your body because you swapped with Palutena and let her walk off before swapping back, were you willing to possibly lose more by doing more swaps?

Ness seemed conflicted, he wanted to test it, but would that harm someone he liked so much, but this was mostly resolved when he realized that she was offering to test it with him. He raised the remote, and looked down to it.

1553322222222222222222222222222122111.content:
Since you have Samus's permission, you decide to go with a full body swap, since its more straightforward and presumably less weir than the head swap. You click the button and immediately feel strange.

First of all, you're a lot taller! Looking down, you see your clothes don't fit you very well anymore. Your shit is stretched down pretty far, only barely going over your new midriff. You're still wearing shorts, but your legs are MUCH longer as well, and you see some blond hair falling in front of your eyes...

"I think that it worked," you mutter, dizzy as you notice a new voice in addition to your new everything else. Looking down, you see your own body wide-eyed, having a similar reaction to you. Its also wearing the tight zero suit... its a bit disconcerting to see your body in that outfit.

"Wow... didn't expect it to really work," Samus in your body says.

"Well, what do you want to do now."
1553322222222222222222222222222122111.title: Head or neck

15533222222222222222222222222221221111.content:
"The zero suit... its a bit tight... I think I probably need your outfit if I'm going to use this body." Samus says, clearly uncomfortable.

"Alright, just let me look at the buttons," you respond, trying your best to not be distracted by your new voice, or all the hair on your head. "Okay, two ways we can do this, clothes swap or life swap. The first one lets us keep our identities, the second one makes us switch them."

Samus, in your body, reaches out to hold the remote so she'll be aware of the swap too. "Alright, both accomplish the goal I suppose. I choose..."

Which does she decide on?

choices: Swap with the first person you see
1553322222222222222222222222222221.content:
You are Dark Pit, the clone of Pit created when he broke the Mirror of Truth. Even though you weren't one to follow orders, you didn't mind this whole tournament deal. You got to let out a rage by beating up on people, with absolutely no consequences. It was like Light vs. Dark, only with more variety, and people who weren't from your world. There were downsides, of course. People kept confusing you with that goody-goody Pit. A few didn't even understand why you were admitted to the tournament in the first place when you were so similar to Pit. It infuriated you. Sometimes you kind of wished you weren't created from Pit, that you weren't just his incomplete mirror image, that you were someone else.

While lost in your thoughts, you end up kicking a box that'd been left in the hallway. You walk over and pick it up, taking a look inside. Inside was some sort of electronic remote and an instruction manual. You smirk. "Hmph, finders keepers." You take out the manual to see what the remote is for. Your eyebrows raise in surprise as you read. Swapping parts of reality around, and making it so only one person can see it? That seemed pretty crazy. You wanted to try this out. But how? You could always just swap something randomly with the first person you meet, but if you took a little time to plan, maybe you could figure out something good.
1553322222222222222222222222222221.title: Dark Pit

15533222222222222222222222222222211.content: You figure it might be more fun to just mess around with whoever you see first. There would always be time for a more calculated plan later. You dispose of the box, and begin to wander through the hallways, searching for someone to use the remote one. Eventually you do find some, and that someone is...
15533222222222222222222222222222211.title: Swap with the first person you see

155332222222222222222222222222222111.content:
Passing by you in the hallway, you see someone wearing a large, orange, mechanical suit. Had you not already been here at the tournament for a while, you would probably have guessed it was a robot of some sort. In reality though, it was a bounty hunter by the name of Samus Aran. Samus had been a competitor in Super Smash Bros since the very first tournament, and was one of the first female competitors. That was the part of bothered you. Samus was a woman, and you weren't. You were looking for someone to swap with, but was Samus really the best choice? Did you really want to swap with a girl. After not seeing anyone else around, you sigh, decided that you might as well test the remote on Samus. You could always swap back afterwards anyway.

But what to swap? The first two options were body swap and head swap. With a body swap, you'd gain Samus' body completely, but somehow still be yourself. You kind of wondered how that would work. Samus' body didn't have wings, so how would you be able to fly? Not to mention, loathe as you were to admit it, you were a clone of Pit, so would changes to you effect him as well? Similarly, with the head swap, you'd also gain Samus' body, but only below your neck, keeping your own head. You'd also gain Samus' Power Suit, save for the helmet, whereas with the body swap, you'd still keep your own clothes and weapons. Of course, there were still four other buttons on the remote for you to try out too.
155332222222222222222222222222222111.title: Samus

1553322222222222222222222222222221111.content:
You decide that the best way to test out this remote with Samus is by doing a swap that would make sure that you definitely did not look like Pit. That would mean swapping bodies or heads with Samus. You would have the body of a woman because of this but you could swap back later on.

So now you just had to pick between the head swap and body swap. After some thinking you select,
1553322222222222222222222222222221111.title: Body Swap/Head Swap

15533222222222222222222222222222211111.content:
Still not entirely convinced this was a good idea, you point the remote at Samus and press the Body Swap button. The swap occurs almost instantly, catching you a bit off guard. The first thing you notice is how bare your back felt without a pair of wings protruding from it. Losing your wings felt almost comparable to someone losing an arm, and you didn't like it. You also noticed the weight on your chest, and the void between your legs, clearly indicating your new gender. It wasn't entirely unpleasant, but it still felt a bit awkward to have suddenly hopped over the gender fence. Although, if the manual was correct, then people should still see you as a man, despite your clearly female body. You look down at your new body, a bit of blonde hair falling in front of your eyes as you did so. You noticed that along with being slimmer and shapelier, taking Samus' body had also made you a bit taller, and you were glad to see that despite the change in your body, you were still wearing your usual black tunic.

Averting your gaze from your own body, you look up to see how Samus had been affected. While you couldn't actually see her inside her Power Suit, you could see a few changes made to the suit itself; namely, the fact that it was a bit shorter now, to compensate for its wearer's new stature, and extra pieces of metal extended out of the back of the suit to cover Samus' newly gained wings.

You look down at yourself again, the large bumps sticking out of your chest obstructing your view. You know knew for certain that the remote did in fact work, and you had succeeded in making yourself look nothing like Pit, although since you still had your own life, you would probably still be a clone of him. You couldn't help but wonder if this swap had affected Pit at all, since you were supposed to be his mirror image, except now you looked nothing like him. That said, you weren't sure you were entirely comfortable with taking Samus' body. Not because you felt guilty or anything, Samus wouldn't even notice after all, but rather because of the body itself; the sudden switch to being female, and the lack of wings. You looked back at Samus, and then down at the remote, still held in your now feminine-looking hand, contemplating whether you wanted to swap back before Samus left your sight.
15533222222222222222222222222222211111.title: Body Swap

155332222222222222222222222222222111112.content:
"I guess I can always swap back later," you mumbled to yourself, hearing Samus' voice come out of your mouth. You decided that there was no point in having a device like this remote and not doing anything with it, and if you were going to be using it, then you should probably get used to not being yourself. And so, you let Samus walk away with your body, leaving you with her's.

Thinking about what to do now, you decide to head to your room to put the manual of the remote away. You knew what the remote did now, so you didn't need to be carrying around the manual as well. It'd be better to leave it somewhere safe just in case you forgot what some of the buttons did. On your way over there, the difference between Samus' body and yours were even more apparent. The way your hips swayed subconsciously as you walked, the way your hair flowed behind you, the slight bounce in your chest with every step, it was all very distracting. Not unpleasant, but very different. The only part you'd really say you didn't like at all was the lack of wings, but that would be something you'd have to get used to if you wanted to keep using the remote.

After a while, you had made it closer to your room, regardless of the distractions your body was providing, but you were suddenly interrupted when you heard someone calling your name. But who was it?
155332222222222222222222222222222111112.title: Keep Samus' body for now

choices: "Yes, I need your help with something."
1553322222222222222222222222222221111122.content:
"Dark!" you heard a shout behind you. You knew that voice, and that nickname. Turning around to face the source of the voice, you saw none other than Lucina, princess of Ylisse. Although you didn't have many friends here at the Smash Bros tournament, you'd probably count Lucina as one of them. The two of you had ended up becoming friends over a shared hatred of being called "clones" (although the term was a lot more literal in your case). Even though Pit and Palutena had spread the nickname of "Pittoo" around to the other Smashers, once Lucina found out you didn't like it, she stopped calling you that, but still found "Dark Pit" a little long and awkward to say sometimes, and ended up giving you the nickname "Dark". You liked it much better than Palutena's nickname for you.

You waved to Lucina, hiding the remote and manual behind your back with your other hand. Even though Lucina was your friend, you weren't sure if you wanted to share the knowledge of the remote with her just yet. As she approached, you noticed that with Samus' body, you were actually taller than Lucina was. "Hey," she said once she was close enough, "Where have you been?"

"Uh, what do you mean?" You answered Lucina's question with another question, not wanting to explain that you had been testing out the remote.

"Well, I usually find you out on the balcony around this time. I was a little surprised when you weren't there."

"Was there something you needed?"

You weren't exactly sure why Lucina would specifically come looking for you, especially after finding you weren't in your usual spot. Lucina replied...
1553322222222222222222222222222221111122.title: Lucina

choices: Try to bluff your way out of it
1553322222222222222222222222222221111122.content:
"No, I just wanted to talk. But when you weren't at your usual spot I was worried something bad might have happened," Lucina stated.

"Well, you don't need to worry, I'm fine," you reply. You still felt a bit weird about hearing Samus' voice when you spoke, and being taller than Lucina, but you did your best to put that aside and not show it. You did your best to come up with an excuse for Lucina as to why you weren't at the spot she'd usually find you at. "I just, uh, felt like going for a walk."

"Oh, good. Uh, sorry for overreacting, I guess." Lucina seemed a bit embarrassed by her actions.

"Don't worry about it. It's fine."

The two of you walked towards the balcony where the two of you usually hung out, just partaking in casual conversation as you went. While the situation was entirely normal for Lucina, you couldn't help but marvel at the conflict between the normal and the absurd right now. You were having an ordinary conversation with Lucina, but at the same time, you were currently inhabiting the body of Samus Aran. Unfortunately, thanks to being distracted by the conversation, you relaxed the arm you were holding behind your back; the arm holding the remote and the manual. It took a while, but Lucina eventually noticed.

"Hey, what's that?" she asked, pointing at the remote in your hand.

"Oh, um," you stutter, realising you'd just accidentally revealed your reality-altering device that you'd wanted to keep secret. You did your best to not panic, which was easier considering the person you'd accidentally shown the remote to was one of your friends. Maybe you could bluff your way out of this? Lucina's world didn't have any particularly advanced technology, you could probably come up with some sort of fake explanation for what it was that would seem believable to her. Then again, Lucina was your friend, maybe you should just tell her the truth. Perhaps it would be more fun if you had someone else who could join in with you in the swapping.
1553322222222222222222222222222221111122.title: "No, I just wanted to talk."

1553322222222222222222222222222221111122.content:
You look around to make sure there was no one else within earshot, before telling Lucina, "Well, this is probably going to be hard to believe, but this remote can basically alter reality. It swaps things between people, and makes it so only people with the remote can actually see it."

You tried to read the expression on Lucina's face. She seemed fascinated, but didn't seem like she didn't believe it, not yet at least. "By "things", do you mean things like, swapping bodies or something?" she replied.

You were a little surprised that that had been Lucina's first thought. "Well, um, yeah."

"Oh. Cool."

"You don't seem surprised by that."

"Well, there were rumours going around that a certain dark mage in my father's army had figured out how to swap bodies using magic. Considering what I've seen here at the tournament, I'm not surprised its able to be done through technology."

You were probably more surprised than Lucina was right now. "Look, I don't know what your mage could do, but this can probably do more."

"Like what?"

"For example, it can give you someone else's body, but make it so everyone still recognises you as yourself even if you look different."

"Wow, really?"

"Yeah." You knew it was true from experience, considering Lucina seemed to have no idea you weren't in your own body right now.

Then came the question you had been expecting since Lucina locked eyes on the remote. "Can I try it out?"

You took the time to think about this. You did want to let Lucina try using the remote, but right now, Lucina thought that the body you were in right now was actually your's. If you were letting her in on this secret, you'd prefer she know what body you were actually in, which would mean that before you could let Lucina use the remote, you'd need to go find Samus and swap back with her. Although, you suppose there probably wasn't any harm in letting Lucina try it out first, as long as you swapped back before you went to get your own body back. You assumed she'd want to swap with you, seeing as there was no one else here.
1553322222222222222222222222222221111122.title: Tell Lucina the truth

1553322222222222222222222222222221111122.content:
Deciding you didn't want things to get things jumbled up, with Lucina believing this was your real body, you tell her, "Um, sure, but there's something I have to do first. You wouldn't haven't seen Samus around here, have you?"

"Actually, yes. I think I saw her heading over to the gym," she replies. "Why?"

You start walking towards the gym as you explain. "This isn't actually my body. It's Samus'."

"What!?" Lucina practically shouted, and she quickly hurried along to catch up with you. "But you look the same as you always do!" She looked you up and down, looking for any sort of different between the current situation and the reality she knew as normal.

"That's part of the remote's power. With the setting I was using, only people who were holding the remote can see the swaps. So since you weren't holding it, all this looks normal to you."

"So... that's what Samus normally looks like?" Lucina was clearly confused by the fact that you hadn't always looked like a human woman, and that Samus hadn't always looked looked like a male angel.

"Um, yeah. Don't try to think about it too hard. Once we find her, I'll swap back into my own body, and then you can try it out. I'm just doing this so things don't get confusing with you thinking Samus' body is actually mine."

"Okay," Lucina said, as if in a daze, as she followed behind you and you neared the entrance to the gym. You hoped Samus was actually there. The reality altering powers of the remote seemed to be messing with Lucina's head a bit.
1553322222222222222222222222222221111122.title: Swap back with Samus first

1553322222222222222222222222222221111122.content:
As you get to the gym, you see that Samus is there, your old body clad in her Power Suit. You let out a sigh of relief, before pointing the remote at her and pressing the body swap button. It definitely felt good to have your wings back, although if you continued to mess around with the remote, you had a feeling you'd lose them again before long. Lucina rounds the corner not a moment later, looking back and forth between you and Samus yet.

"D-Did you do it yet?" she asks, still unaware of what had transpired thanks to the remote's power.

You nod. "Yeah. I know I probably still look the same to you, but that's thanks to the remote. Want to try it out yourself now?"

"Um, yes," Lucina says, a lot less enthusiastic about it than she'd been before. It appeared the reality altering aspect of the device had shaken her a bit.
