You hoped that letting her try it out for herself would get her to be a bit less nervous about this, and bring back that excitement you'd seen when you first told her about the remote.

"Well, first off, who do you want to swap with?" you ask. "Samus is right there if you want to try it on her, but if you want to try it on someone else, we'd have to try and find them, and if you want to swap with me, it'd probably be better if we go somewhere a little more private so we don't get interrupted."

Who does Lucina decide she wants to try the remote on?
1553322222222222222222222222222221111122.title: Samus is there

1553322222222222222222222222222221111122.content: Who does Lucina decide she wants to try the remote on?
1553322222222222222222222222222221111122.title: You or Samus

1553322222222222222222222222222221111122.content:
"Um, if it's okay with you, I'd like to try it on you," Lucina says, still a bit unsure of herself.

"Sure," you say, having no problem with being the test dummy this time. You'd already walked around in Samus' body for a while, after all. "How about we head to the balcony? We probably won't be bothered there." Said balcony was where you and Lucina often met up. Originally, you had headed there when you wanted to be alone for a while, while Lucina seemed to head there when she was upset about something. Because of that, the two of you ended up becoming friends, and using the balcony as your meeting place.

"Right," Lucina says, nodding. Her mind was clearly somewhere else at the moment.

"Here, read this," you say, offering her the manual as you started to walk towards the balcony.

"What's this?"

"This is the instruction manual I found with the remote. It'll explain what the buttons do so you're not just making a blind selection."

Lucina nods, taking the manual from you and reading it intently as she followed you to the balcony. You noticed her eyes widen, or heard her mumbling occasionally as she read it. You couldn't blame her; this remote was amazing by your world's standards, you could only imagine how amazing it must seem to her. The two of you eventually make it to the balcony, and as expected, there was no one there.

"So," you say, turning to face Lucina, "Have you decided which swap you want to try yet?"

"Oh, um, yes," she replied, seeming a bit less nervous and a bit more excited than before. You smile. It was good to see she wasn't still freaked out by the remote's reality altering powers. You push the "2" button on the remote, so you'd still be aware of whatever swap Lucina decided to do, before handing it to her. She checks the manual again, which you assume is to make sure she's pressing the right button, before aiming at you and pushing one of the buttons.

Which button did Lucina press?
1553322222222222222222222222222221111122.title: Lucina Wants To Swap With You

1553322222222222222222222222222221111122.content: Which button did Lucina press?
1553322222222222222222222222222221111122.title: Body Swap/Head Swap/Clothes Swap

1553322222222222222222222222222221111122.content: Which button did Lucina press?
1553322222222222222222222222222221111122.title: Head Swap/Clothes Swap

choices: Lucina agrees to try the remote on other people
Lucina doesn't want to use the remote on other people
1553322222222222222222222222222221111122.content:
In an instant, you found yourself get a bit taller again, and you could feel the same female parts you'd felt when you were in Samus's body, albeit a fair bit less exaggerated. However, you could also feel that your clothes had changed this time, and you seemed to be facing the opposite way on the balcony. The reason was standing clearly right in front of you.

"Whoa!" Lucina exclaimed as she looked down at herself, although you weren't sure "herself" was the proper word to be using in this situation. While she still had her own head, she had your body from the neck down, which was currently patting down as if to try and confirm that what she was seeing was real. You looked down at yourself to confirm that the opposite was true for you; you still had your own head, but you had Lucina's body from the neck down." You were holding the manual for the remote, which Lucina had been holding before the swap, but the remote had followed her head over to your body.

"Well, what do you think?" you asked, placing your hands on your hips. The transition wasn't as jarring for you this time, as you'd already swapped with Samus before, but it still felt a bit weird to have someone else's body.

Lucina was looking over her shoulder when you asked, watching in fascination as her new wings moved about. She turned back once you spoke up, however. "This is amazing." Her worry regarding the remote and its reality altering effects seemed to have been replaced with excitement. She looked you up and down, clearly finding it amusing to see your head on her body. "And no one else will notice?"

You nod in response. "Yeah. As long as we use the right settings, everyone else will think we've always been like this." You looked for somewhere to put the manual to the remote, but found Lucina's outfit to be just as lacking in pockets as your own, so you chose to simply hold onto it for now.

"Wow," Lucina mused, looking down at the remote again. It was one thing to be told about how it worked, but it was another to test it out yourself, something you could certainly attest to. "So, what do we do now?" You noticed her wings still seemed to be moving around a bit more than you'd normally move them, so you assumed Lucina was enjoying having them. Your back did still feel a bit bare without them, but you were starting to get used to it after going through two wingless bodies.

"Well, if you want, we can always mess around with the remote some more," you suggested. You didn't really have a plan for the remote aside from just trying it out for the time being, but you figured it might be more fun messing around with it if you had a friend along with you for the journey.

"You mean, with each other?"

"I meant using it on other people."

Lucina seemed to be a bit unsure about that, as you noticed her wings drooping a bit. "I don't know. Doesn't that seem a bit... bad? Swapping with people without their consent?"

You shrugged. It didn't seem like that big of a deal to you, but you supposed Lucina was more of a "good guy" than you were. "Well, like I said, if we use the right settings, everyone'll think things have always been like this. Can't exactly get mad about something when you don't know it's even happened. It's up to you though."

Lucina thought about your idea for a moment, before deciding what to do.
1553322222222222222222222222222221111122.title: Head Swap

1553322222222222222222222222222221111122.content:
"Alright," Lucina answered with a sigh. "I guess it's okay if no one can tell anything's changed." She still seemed a little apprehensive about the idea, but her fascination with the remote had overtaken that.

A grin spread across your face, glad that Lucina was willing. Having her come along with you for this little adventure seemed like it would be more fun than doing it alone, but there was only so much that could be done if Lucina didn't want to swap with other people. "Alright, let's go then," you said, turning towards the door leading away from the balcony.

"Can we stop back first, though?" Lucina called out before you could leave. "I know we're going to be swapping with other people and all, but if we don't swap back first, then things are just going to end up even more jumbled if we want to get back to normal."

"Yeah, sure." You stand still as Lucina targets you with the remote, and presses the head swap button again. In mere moments, you find yourself back on your own body again, and Lucina is back on her's. "You should probably press the one button, so the people we're swapping with don't notice anything."

"Oh, right," she said, pressing the appropriate button as the two of you left the balcony. "So, do you have any ideas for who we should swap with?"

"Not really. I was just gonna do what I did the first time and swap with the first person I see. You?"
1553322222222222222222222222222221111122.title: Lucina agrees to try the remote on other people

choices: Dark Pit swaps with Lucina's roommate
1553322222222222222222222222222221111122.content:
"Well, if we want to both see the swaps, we need to both be holding the remote, right?"

"Yeah." You thought it was a bit inconvenient, but the remote didn't seem to have any other way to let specific people be aware when they weren't involved in the swap.

"Then, it'd probably be easier if we stick close together. So, maybe one of us should switch with the other's roommate.Plus, then we'd have somewhere private to talk about the swaps we've done."

"I guess that could work." While you didn't think it was really necessary to be roommates to use the remote together, you supposed it was better than just wandering around without any ideas. "You really wanna swap with Pitstain?"

"Well... I wouldn't mind having wings again, but it doesn't have to be me that swaps. You could swap with my roommate. Either way works."
1553322222222222222222222222222221111122.title: Lucina has an idea

1553322222222222222222222222222221111122.content:
"Well, if we're gonna be hanging out together, I'd rather you don't swap with Pit. I don't want people thinking I've gotten chummy with him. I'll swap with your roommate."

"Okay," Lucina replied with a nod. "You do know that my roommate is a woman, right?"

"Of course. I've already swapped bodies and heads with a couple of girls, swapping lives can't be much worse." In the back of your mind, you were actually a little excited about being seen as someone else, no longer being known as Pit's clone. There was one little issue, though. "Uh, who is your roommate, actually?" You'd never actually bothered to pay attention to who stayed in which of the rooms, besides your own of course. You didn't even know which room Lucina was staying in, let alone who her roommate was.

"You don't know?" Lucina asked, leading the way back to her room.

"You've never mentioned it."

"Oh, well, okay then. It's..."
1553322222222222222222222222222221111122.title: Dark Pit swaps with Lucina's roommate

1553322222222222222222222222222221111122.content:
"Oh, well, okay then. It's Bayonetta."

"...Who?" You didn't recognise the name Lucina had told you.

"She's pretty new around here. Apparently she was supposed to be some sort of secret fighter to get the audience excited by her reveal. She only arrived a few days ago, so I haven't had much of a chance to talk to her, but... apparently she hunts angels or something." She seemed to be a bit apprehensive about informing you of that part. And for good reason too, you were an angel, after all. The Hands had strict rules in place to make sure no one was killed during the tournament, though, so you should be fine even with her here.

"Well, alright then. I guess I'll get to see what she's like once I'm her." Lucina chuckled at your nonchalance, finding it amusing how you didn't even seem phased by the fact that pretty soon you'd be an entirely different person, let alone a woman.

Eventually, the two of you reached Lucina's room, and she briefly put an ear to the door, listening for anyone inside. "Okay, she's here," she said, holding out the remote for you, which she'd kept since the two of you had swapped back.

"Right, let's make this quick." You grabbed onto the remote as well, holding your finger over the life swap button. Lucina nodded, before pulling out her key and unlocking the door. The moment it was open enough for you to see inside, you aimed the remote at the figure clothed in black inside, and pressed the button.

In a fraction of a second, you suddenly found yourself inside the room, a little disoriented. Your body felt the same, but the outfit it was clothed in was rather different. Black leather hugged your torso and legs tightly, while you teetered on a pair of high heels. Your arms were cloaked in white gloves up to the middle of your biceps, and black hair spayed out from the shoulders and chest of the outfit. A large pair of earrings dangled from your ears, your could feel makeup on your face, and a pair of glasses rested upon your nose. Despite your outfit appearing to be normal clothes, now that you were Bayonetta, you knew that the outfit was actually made of your hair through some sort of magic. You looked up at the mirror you were positioned in front of, finding your appearance to be a little ridiculous, but not as much as it would have been had you tried to swap with one of the more feminine women competing in the tournament.

"Alright, I'll talk to you later," you heard Lucina say, presumably to Bayonetta in your life, before she entered the room and closed the door behind her. She chuckled a little at your appearance, before asking, "How do you feel?"

"About the same. I mean, I'm wearing her clothes, and I know things she knew but I didn't, but otherwise I'm about the same."

Lucina breathed a sigh of relief. "Good. I was a little worried you start acting like her instead of yourself."

You smirk, deciding to put the remote to the test and see if you really could mimic Bayonetta like the manual said you should be able to. Despite having never actually met Bayonetta before, you somehow find yourself channeling her personality and letting it go somewhat on autopilot. "Oh, I can act like her if I want to, darling." Your stance and tone even shifted to be a bit more feminine as you spoke.

"Whoa!" Lucina exclaimed, stepped back out of surprise.

"Well? How'd I do?" you asked, letting your own personality take control again, but keeping the smirk on your face.

"That was really good. Are you sure you haven't met Bayonetta before?"

You shook your head, feeling your new earrings shaking about. "It's all just the power of the remote. Speaking of which, now that I've got Bayonetta's life, I think it's about time we found someone for you to swap with." You approached Lucina, seemingly having little trouble walking in Bayonetta's heels, and held out the remote for her. Just as with the previous head swap, the remote had followed you to your new life.

"R-Right," she answered, taking the remote, still a little anxious about swapping with someone outside of the controlled environment in which she'd swapped with you.

"Come on," you said playfully, leading Lucina out of the room again, which Lucina remembering to lock the door behind her after tossing the manual onto her bed.

"Wow, you're even walking like she does," Lucina mumbled as she caught up with you. Looking down at yourself, you noticed you did seem to have a more feminine strut now.

"Huh, I guess I am." The fact didn't bother you much. The world saw you as a woman now, so walking like this would only help further the illusion.

"So, did you have someone in mind, or...?"

"Not really, but I do have an idea about where we might find some people. It's better than just wandering the halls, at least."

"Good idea. So were are we headed?"
1553322222222222222222222222222221111122.title: Bayonetta

choices: Find someone outside of your world to swap with
15533222222222222222222222222222212.content:
You decide to take your time with this. Provided this worked, you didn't really want to go swapping with just anyone. But what exactly did you want to do? You could always swap with someone outside of your own universe. Then you could get away from that whole idea that you were just some clone of Pit. You could really become your own person.

On the other hand, this would be the perfect opportunity to mess with Pit. You could swap with him, but who'd want to be that goody-two-shoes anyway? No, you had your sights set higher, one of the goddesses specifically. Swapping lives with Palutena or VIridi would give you a good opportunity to mess with him, but if you didn't want to be a girl, even just swapping relationships with Palutena would make Pit completely loyal to you.
15533222222222222222222222222222212.title: Plan out something

155332222222222222222222222222222122.content: You grin at the idea of being able to toy with Pit as much as you liked. You could just imagine the look on his face when one of his precious goddesses starts treating him badly. But who to swap with? Pit was the captain of Palutena's guard, so he was completely loyal to her. Swapping either lives or relationships with her would make Pit loyal to you, and you could use that loyalty to your advantage. On the other hand, there was Viridi. You were currently a commander in Viridi's Forces of Nature, but Pit and Palutena didn't know that yet. She was here at the tournament to appear in the background of the Reset Bomb Forest stage and for some sort of guidance conversation that her, Pit, and Palutena were supposed to have on the Palutena's Temple stage. You were pretty sure there was something going on between Viridi and Pit, but she'd always avoid the subject whenever you, or any other of her commanders, brought it up. You were sure you could exploit that in some way to get a reaction out of Pit if you swapped lives with her.
155332222222222222222222222222222122.title: Find Palutena or Viridi

1553322222222222222222222222222221221.content: Even though there was the possibility of something going on between Viridi and Pit, you'd have something a lot more concrete to go off if you swapped with Palutena to mess with Pit. You seem to recall that you had seen her heading towards the library earlier, so you decide to head over there to check first. Luckily, once you arrive it doesn't take you long to find her. Now you had to decide what to swap. You could swap lives with her, and have everyone see you as the Goddess of Light, as well as gaining all her powers. But, if you didn't want everyone to see you as a woman, you could swap relationships with her, which would make Pit completely loyal to you. Making your decision, you aim the remote at her and press the button for a..
1553322222222222222222222222222221221.title: Go find Palutena

choices: Swap with Palutena again before she leaves
15533222222222222222222222222222212211.content: Deciding it would be better to mess with Pit as Palutena than simply make him loyal to you, you aim at Palutena and press the life swap button. Within mere moments, you find yourself positioned in front of a bookshelf, wearing Palutena's clothes. A quick glance over at where you had been standing reveals that Palutena is now in your life, and thus wearing your clothes, but you only get a quick look at her from the front before she turns to walk away. She looked a bit odd wearing your clothes, but you supposed you looked even stranger wearing her's. It felt rather strange to be wearing a dress that had been adjusted to fit your male body. But perhaps you could do something about that before Palutena left. With just the press of a button, you could get some clothes more appropriate for your body, or maybe a body more appropriate for your clothes.
15533222222222222222222222222222212211.title: Life Swap

155332222222222222222222222222222122111.content: You decide you're not done with Palutena quite yet. Right now it just felt weird to be wearing her feminine clothes on your male body. Right now your options seemed to be a clothes swap, which would give you your old clothes back, or a body swap, which would give you Palutena's body, the body which your current clothes were meant for. Putting back the books Palutena had been looking through when you stole her life, you aim the remote at Palutena and press the button for a...
155332222222222222222222222222222122111.title: Swap with Palutena again before she leaves

1553322222222222222222222222222221221112.content:
Before Palutena has a chance to leave, you press the body swap button. Even though you knew the person walking away had originally been Palutena, there was really nothing of her left. She was pretty much entirely Dark Pit. A similar thing could be said for you; you now had Palutena's body, and were living her life, although unlike Palutena, you still remembered who you were originally. You have a bit of a devilish grin on your face as you leave the library. It felt a bit odd to walking around in Palutena's body, her long hair flowing behind you, but you were enjoying the feeling, knowing no one would mistake you for Pit ever again.

As you wandered through the halls, you thought about what to do next. Locating Pit to mess with him a bit should be pretty easy now that you were Palutena. You could probably even talk to him telepathically. But you didn't really have to act upon your plan immediately. After all, so long as you were Palutena, you could mess with him as much as you liked. There were probably a few other things you could have a bit of fun doing, between the remote, your new powers as a goddess, and your new body.
1553322222222222222222222222222221221112.title: Body Swap

1553322222222222222222222222222221222.content:
You decide to head over to the living quarters for the assists and background characters in search of Viridi. You knew she was probably in her room, since the Hands didn't like her wandering around too much after the whole Reset Bomb incident with the humans that happened back when Hades was still around. That'd make it fairly easy to find her and swap with her, unless she was doing something else at the time.

Knocking on her door, you hear Viridi shout, "It's open, let yourself in." She sounded grumpy. She wasn't exactly happy about being dragged out here and not even being able to do anything in battle. You open the door and walk inside. Viridi was lying on her bed, staring at the ceiling, but she sat up when she saw you. "Ah, Dark Pit," she says, "How's the tournament going?"

You don't reply, and instead you just do what you came here to do and swap lives with her. Within seconds, the remote works its magic, and you find yourself sitting on Viridi's bed, wearing her dress. It catches you off guard a bit, not having actually tested the remote before this, but luckily Viridi, who was currently in your life, didn't notice anything wrong, and replies to the question she had asked you. "It's alright. I think everyone who's competing is here now."

Not particularly caring about this conversation, you let Viridi's personality go on autopilot as you converse with your old life. You couldn't really do much until Viridi in your life left to do something else, so you had to wait it out. You wonder if you could use the remote on her again while the two of you talked. You had already taken Viridi's life, and right now you had two ideas of what else you could do. You could either makes things a bit more normal for you by doing a clothes swap, thus taking your old clothes back from Viridi, or you could immerse yourself a little more in your role as Viridi by swapping bodies with her. You discretely aim the remote at her and press the button for a...
1553322222222222222222222222222221222.title: Go find Viridi

15533222222222222222222222222222212222.content:
Thinking that it would be weird and confusing to be completely yourself, but having everyone else see you as a different person you decide to fully put yourself into the role of viridi and swap your body with hers. You aim the remote at your old life as it walks away and push the body swap button. In an instant everything around you felt a foot higher then you, as blond hair fell into your face you knew that the swap had worked.

Once your old life and body had left you stood up and looked at yourself, you were no longer the dark clone of Pit, Dark Pit. you were the childish goddess of nature, Viridi and you had full control of the forces of nature. Now you had two choices of what to do. You could either go through with your original plan and mess around with Pit, our you could go around and have fun being the goddess of nature.
15533222222222222222222222222222212222.title: Body Swap

choices: Use your powers, regardless of the Hands' rules
Find some other way to have fun
155332222222222222222222222222222122222.content:
You figure there would be plenty of time to mess with Pit later. You could even do that once you got back home to your own world. Besides, you weren't allowed to leave to go visit Pit that often.

...Wait, what?

You think about it. While thinking over your plans Viridi's life has subconsciously reacted, alerting you that while you were Viridi, you wouldn't be able to wander around as much as you had as you had been able to as Dark Pit. Now that you thought about it, you also wouldn't be participating in the tournament anymore. You were beginning to wonder if it had really been a good idea to do this while the tournament was going instead of once you were back home. With the limitations on where you could go and how long you could be out, you doubted you'd be able to get back to being yourself unless your old life came to visit you like you had visited Viridi just now.

There had to be some upside to this, right? Of course, Viridi was a goddess, and now that you were her, you had all her powers. Of course, Viridi's life reminds you that the Hands had also placed restrictions on what powers you were allowed to use. A scowl forms on Viridi's preteen face, and you scrunch your hands into fists. Despite becoming one of the most powerful beings in your world, all you had done was impose a whole heap of restrictions on what you could do and where you could go. You had the powers of a god, and you wanted to damn well use them! The thought of throwing a tantrum right now seemed very appealing, but you retain your composure.
155332222222222222222222222222222122222.title: Have fun as a goddess

1553322222222222222222222222222221222222.content:
You try to keep calm. You couldn't blow it all now. If the Hands threw you out, you'd be stuck as Viridi until the tournament ended. Not that you particularly minded being a goddess, but you'd prefer to stay here at the tournament for now. Still, there had to be something you could do to pass the time now that you wouldn't be able to get back to your old life for a while. You look down at your body, which was currently Viridi's. That certainly wouldn't be providing any entertainment. Even though Viridi was technically thousands of years old, her body still looked like it hadn't even hit puberty yet, so the thought of exploring her body didn't seem appealing to you at all.

Your eyes wander around the room before they eventually land on the remote again. Of course, you couldn't have fun as Viridi, but perhaps there was someone else around who it would be fun to be. Viridi wasn't really allowed to wander around too much, but you should at least be able to find another assist or background character who had a little more freedom than Viridi. Then again, you had plans for what to do with Viridi's life, were you willing to throw that away already? Maybe you could swap something other than your life. Or perhaps it was just better to leave the remote alone for now. It had gotten you into this predicament, using it more might only make it worse.
1553322222222222222222222222222221222222.title: Find some other way to have fun

1553322222222222222222222222222221222222.content: You pick up the remote once more. You might not be allowed to use your powers as a goddess, but this device could defy even the gods. But first there was the question of what to do with it. You had taken the time to come here and become Viridi for your plan to mess with Pit, but being Viridi had imposed all sorts of restrictions on you. Swapping lives could gain you a bit more freedom, but it would also get in the way of your plan. Of course, so long as you didn't lose the remote, you could mess with Pit as much as you wanted. But, if you didn't want to ditch Viridi's life just yet, there were other buttons you could try out. Perhaps you could do something about this preteen body you had borrowed.
1553322222222222222222222222222221222222.title: Use the remote

1553322222222222222222222222222221222222.content: Other swaps might make things a little more interesting while you were stuck in here, but regardless of how interesting it might be, at the end of the day you'd still be stuck. A life swap was your only escape from the Hands' restrictions. While you probably couldn't go looking for a competitor in the tournament, one the other people with the least restrictions on them, while you had Viridi's life, you could probably still find another background character, or an assist character, to swap with. You wouldn't have as many powers as you had as a goddess, but you'd probably have more freedom in using them. You leave Viridi's room in search of...
1553322222222222222222222222222221222222.title: Life Swap

1553322222222222222222222222222222.content: Are you part of the retro dog and duck team, Duck Hunt?
1553322222222222222222222222222222.title: More Characters

15533222222222222222222222222222222.content: Are you the 2D fighter from Nintendo's first handheld, Mr. Game & Watch?
15533222222222222222222222222222222.title: More Characters

155332222222222222222222222222222222.content: Are you the holder of the Triforce of Power, Ganondorf?
155332222222222222222222222222222222.title: More Characters

choices: Leave them out, just swap anyone you meet
1553322222222222222222222222222222221.content:
You are Ganondorf, the king of evil. You had been invited back to the tournament for the third time, as much as you liked it, just fighting others, and no one would complain at you for hurting other, however you wished they would make up their mind and invite you at the same time as Link and Zelda, but that would have made for an awkward trip.

You were walking down the corridor, at your own slow pace, causing it to shake slightly, as other fighters, particular the newcomers, avoided, or left the area you were in. You could only laugh at there cowardice. You, eventually, made it to the living quarters, but then you saw something, a small box. Deciding it was yours, you took it to one of the seats, and sat down.

Tearing the lids of the box off, you look inside. Their was a manual, and an odd remote. dumping the box on the floor, you read though the manual. "So this is a powerful magic item, that allows me to swap." You gave a maniacal laugh, luckily no one was around, as you planned how to mess up the other fighters, trophies, pokeball pokemon and any one else you meet.
"Should I go see Dedede, Bowser or the other bad guys for an alliance?"
1553322222222222222222222222222222221.title: Ganondorf

15533222222222222222222222222222222211.content:
Why on Earth would you share it? With a power like this, you can have all the allies you want, and no one has to even know!

You're more eager to see if it works first though. The best way to find out would be with the more overt switches: Body or Life swap. Relationship swap will be useful for gaining new minions/allies, but you want to try something obvious first.

As you approach the 'Lobby' of the facility, you ponder which one you should try first.
15533222222222222222222222222222222211.title: Leave them out, just swap anyone you meet

155332222222222222222222222222222222111.content:
Ganon's curiosity gets the better of him and he decides he's going to try switching bodies. It'll certainly get the biggest effect.

As he reaches his destination, he sees one really easy target: Princess Zelda. He had taken over her body once, it'd be interesting to try it again, but this time without anyone knowing. If he wanted, he could even try a life or relationship swap later to see if he could gain more of her power or influence...

There were other options though. In particular, the Princess was accompanied by one Hero of Hyrule: Link. The green-clad warrior glared at him from across the room, but Ganondorf only smirked back. Taking Link's features had their own draw. He thought of a life swap; if he was Link, then once he returned thos his world he could act freely without anyone knowing. A relationship swap would make him an ally of the Princess as well.

He put such thoughts aside though. At the moment he was determined to try a body swap. Who does he aim for, the Holder of Wisdom or the Holder of Courage?
155332222222222222222222222222222222111.title: Body Swap

1553322222222222222222222222222222221111.content:
You point the remote at Princess Zelda and push the body swap button. The swap occurs almost instantaneously. No longer were you looking at Link and Zelda. Link was now accompanied by what appeared to be you, only wearing all of Zelda's clothes. It looked rather odd, although it didn't really compare to how odd you felt right now. You had Zelda's body, although you were still dressed in your own armor. And despite this change, you were the only one who reacted to it.grin spreads across your face as you realise the power you now hold.

You look down at your hand, the Triforce of Power glowing. It seemed that despite the Triforce of Wisdom being linked to the royal bloodline, taking Zelda's body with this remote did not give you her part of the Triforce. You'd have to do that manually, it seemed. Perhaps a life swap would give you her part of the Triforce. That would make things a bit easier for you. Zelda and Link seem to say goodbye to each other, and they begin to head in opposite directions, giving you your chance to swap with Zelda again if you wished. Of course, Link was also in view, and it would be too hard to find someone else to swap with if you wished to try something else.
1553322222222222222222222222222222221111.title: Zelda

choices: Find someone else to swap with
1553322222222222222222222222222222221111.content:
As Link and Zelda head in opposite directions, you point the remote at Zelda once more, and press the life swap button. This time, nothing much changes about you physically, but instead you are now put further down the hallway, where Zelda had been standing, and you were now wearing her clothes. Since you also still had her body from your earlier swap, you were pretty much completely Zelda right now, and no one had any idea, not even.

You look down at your hand again, and are excited to see the Triforce of Wisdom light up, but disappointed to find that hat you had now lost the Triforce of Power. Although you had the power to mess up reality, this device was of no use for obtaining the Triforce. Looking over at where you had previously stood, you saw what appeared to be you; not an ounce of Zelda remained. Perhaps this remote would be useful after all.

As Ganondorf, you had been defeated by Link and sealed away, but as Zelda, no one would suspect you of doing anything evil. You could claim the Triforce of Power when your old body was defeated by Link, and with Zelda's life, it shouldn't be too difficult to get Link to drop his guard long enough to take him down and claim the Triforce of Courage. Zelda's life could end up being your ticket to finally claiming the complete Triforce.

You look down at yourself, Zelda's bust sticking out from your chest. You wondered whether you should keep this body. Zelda's body was not useful for your plan, only her life, but perhaps having the body to match the life would be better for you. You shrug it off, deciding that if you wanted a different body later, you could change then, since you'd still have the remote. You walk off to Zelda's room, planning to stash the remote in there somewhere for safekeeping. However, on the way there, you realise something. The tournament had not even begun yet, and the Hands certainly wouldn't allow Link to kill your old life so long as the tournament was going on. The moment that your entire plan hinged on wouldn't be able to happen until the tournament was over! Were you really willing to live out Zelda's life until then?

You quickly head back to the place where you had first swapped with Zelda, but by then, Zelda had taken your old life and body and wandered off somewhere else. For the time being, you were trapped in Zelda's life, and her body... or were you? Sure, you might not be able to return to your own life, but you still had the remote, so you didn't have to remain as Zelda if you didn't want to. There were plenty of other warriors here at the tournament you could easily become. Although if you wished for your plan to succeed, you wouldn't want anyone to notice anything odd about 'Zelda' before your old life was defeated. And what better a time to practice being Zelda than now, with a bunch of people you'd never see until the next tournament once this one ended?
1553322222222222222222222222222222221111.title: Swap lives with Zelda

choices: Go out and find something to do
Peach enters the room, looking for you
1553322222222222222222222222222222221111.content:
You decide you may as well keep Zelda's life for now. The easier it was to mimic Zelda, the better it would be for your plans. You head back towards Zelda's room to hide the remote for now, noting how your walk had changed thanks to your new body and life. It doesn't take you long to pick out Zelda's room amongst the rooms of the other competitors, and you unlock the door and head inside. You didn't actually know who Zelda's roommate was, but judging by the amount of pink on one side of the room, you assumed it was probably Peach, and Zelda's memories confirmed this.

Going to Zelda's side of the room, you find a small space hidden inside her closet, where a few precious items were being kept. You store the remote in there with them, and then close the closet. If no one had found Zelda's valuables up there, it was unlikely that they'd find the remote there either. "Well, that's one thing taken care of," you say to yourself, trying to get used to hearing Zelda's voice come out of your mouth instead of your own. "Now, what to do next?" The best course of action would be to just go out and try being Zelda. Even with the remote's power, it was probably for the best if you had a bit of practice imitating the princess before you went through with your plans back home.
1553322222222222222222222222222222221111.title: Remain as Zelda

15533222222222222222222222222222222212.content:
After having a little think about it, you decide to go and see one of your 'friends'. You quickly decide on who you want to see, the koopa king, Bowser. Although he didn't trust you very much, he was the perfect choice to form an alliance with for this bit of 'fun'. He was also much easier to find and plot things with than others were, since you and him share a room together. So you head to your room and, indeed, the koopa king was there. He noticed you standing by the door and glared.
Bowser: "Don't you have anything better to do than just stand there?"
You flashed a evil smirk at Bowser.
You: "Bowser, are you interested in having some fun today?"
Bowser: "If it's with you, then no."
You: "Not even if we were to mess up the others in a new way than what we've done in the past?"
Bowser: "How would we do that?"
You showed him the remote.
You: "I found this while walking down the corridor earlier."
Bowser: "So?"
You: "Bowser, this thing can swap things between two different people via some special magic. You might get a chance to make Peach yours at last. Or you could mess with that Mario in any way possible."
Bowser raised an eyebrow.
Bowser: "Are you sure about that?"
You nodded in response. Bowser then grinned.
Bowser: "Consider this a temporary alliance then. Just don't backstab me with it like you've backstabbed me in the past. Deal?"
You: "It's a deal. Now let's go have some fun."
Bowser nodded and the two of you left together. But who would be your first target?
15533222222222222222222222222222222212.title: Go see your 'friends'

1553322222222222222222222222222222222.content: Are you the pill shooting doctor, Doctor Mario?
1553322222222222222222222222222222222.title: More Characters

choices: You make it there without running into anyone
You run into someone on the way there
15533222222222222222222222222222222221.content:
You are Dr. Mario, the famous doctor from the Mushroom Kingdom who created the patented "pill-stacking" technique of eradicating viruses. As successful as you medical career was, you sometimes couldn't help but wish you were someone else. Almost every day, people would confuse you for Mario, the hero of the Mushroom Kingdom, or ask what your relationship with him was. In truth, you weren't related to Mario at all. You just happened to have the same name was him and look incredibly similar to him. Weird how it works, but that's the way it was, so it started to get on your nerves people constantly asking about it. As luck would have it, you were about to find a way to change all that.

You had just been heading back to your room after treating another patient at the infirmary (the Hands had gotten you to help out with that ever since you participated in the second tournament, Super Smash Bros Melee), when you happened to come across a box lying in the hallway. Normally you wouldn't snoop through other people's things, but today had been a rather stressful day, and you were curious. Inside the box seemed to be some sort of TV remote. You sighed, one of the younger Smashers had probably ordered it and forgotten about it or something. Too much TV was bad for them anyway. There was some sort of instruction manual included with it as well. Perhaps looking through that could tell you what TV it was for, and you could leave the remote with it. However, the manual seemed to say that this remote wasn't for changing channels of a television, but for changing around parts of people. The thought seemed ludicrous to you.

"Probably someone's idea of a joke," you muttered to yourself. You'd just take it to the leisure room and leave it with the TV there. Although you were kind of curious. Perhaps you'd just test it if you happened to run into someone on your way there. With that thought in mind, you alter your course and head in the direction of the leisure room.
15533222222222222222222222222222222221.title: Doctor Mario

15533222222222222222222222222222222222.content: Are you the greedy microgame dealer, Wario?
15533222222222222222222222222222222222.title: More Characters

choices: "Donate" some of the richer Smashers' money to you
Call up Orbulon to get the rest of your employees
155332222222222222222222222222222222221.content:
You are Wario, best described as fat, greedy, and flatulent. You had first participated in the third Super Smash Bros tournament, and were one of the first ones there, eager to get to get the one-up on Mario again. However, now the tournament was old news to you, and despite receiving your invitation long in advance, you had shown up to the tournament incredibly late. So late, in fact, that the Hands had no choice but to make you one of the secret fighters that wouldn't be revealed until the tournament began, since all the advertising had already gone out.

Being too lazy to train for the upcoming fights, you had become somewhat bored. The Hands closed off the kitchen between scheduled meals, so eating wasn't an option right now. You had recently visited the leisure room, established that there was nothing worth watching on the TV, and were now heading back to your room for a nap. You briefly wondered what your employees back at WarioWare Inc. were doing without you. Probably slacking off, you were really the only one who did anything for that company (or at least that's what you thought). At the very least you could make sure Ashley, Kat and Ana were doing their jobs, or doing as much as they could while they were here.

On the way to your room however, you encountered a box lying in the hallway. Perhaps encountered is a bit of an overstatement; rather you had ended up tripping over it due to how short your legs were. Once you got back up and made sure no one was around to see you fall, you grabbed the box without a second thought and took it with you as you headed back to your room, mumbling "Finders-keepers" to yourself. When you got to your room, you tore open the box, an action which was unnecessary since the box had already been opened on top and was merely folded closed, and examined the contents. You were a little disappointed that the box held nothing valuable, just some old TV remote and an instruction manual, but you kept them anyway and read through the manual, since you had nothing better to do.

While others, like those Crygor guys you employed, would see the amazing scientific potential behind the remote, all you saw was a potential money-making scheme. All you had to do was swap with one of the more wealthy people here at the tournament, like those princesses and such, and you could "donate" all their money to you, and no one would be able to tell anything was wrong. You grinned and rubbed your hands together at the thought of the riches you'd be able to gain from this.

Of course, that wasn't all you could use the remote for. Many people here at the tournament were somewhat significant in their own worlds, be they heroes, villains, or royalty, or a combination of the above. You could place your employees in some somewhat powerful positions to extend your influence all over the place, and gain some money in the process to boot. Sure, most of your employees were back in your world and not in this weird space-stadium the Hands had constructed, but there were certain benefits that came from having an alien on your payroll. You'd just have to call him up and get him to gather up your slacking employees and bring them here. And with your employees posing as many of the competitors in the tournament, you could always get them to throw the fight for you, making sure you'd win. Scratching your chin and letting out a fart in thought, you think about what to do with your new little money-making device.
155332222222222222222222222222222222221.title: Wario

choices: Orbulon lands with the rest of the WarioWare Inc. employees
Orbulon can't get inside, only ships authorised by the Hands can enter
1553322222222222222222222222222222222212.content:
You take the remote and manual and leave your room, heading to the nearest phone, or 'communicator' as the Hands called it. They had installed these around the tournament grounds in case of emergency, and not to be used for personal calls, but you didn't really listen to their rules. Selecting the icon for Diamond City and dialing Orbulon's number, you tap your foot impatiently as you wait for him to pick up.

"Hello?" you hear from the other end of the line.

"'Bout time you picked up."

"Wario? I thought you were at that tournament thing."

"I am. Which is precisely why I need you to gather up my employees and bring 'em here."

"Okay, sure thing. I'll be there soon." That was something you liked about Orbulon. He didn't question your schemes. Supposedly it was part of his 'research' or something, but as long as he did what you said for cheap, you didn't care. Not bothering to say goodbye, you slam the receiver down and make your way over the area where all the assist characters stayed. Orbulon may be gathering your employees from Diamond City, but there were a few already here.

You make it to the room shared by your employees. It seemed like assist characters shared their rooms with another assist. In this case, Kat & Ana apparently counted as one, as did Ashley and her minion Red, so the four of them had to share the one room. This, of course, made things easier for you. You bang loudly on their door, not caring if you disturbed any of the other assists.

The door opens to reveal an annoyed Ashley, glaring at you. "What do you want?" she asks.

"Come with me. We've got work to do." Ashley rolls her eyes, not that you notice. You were looking around her room for any sign of the little ninja twins, Kat and Ana. "Where are the kids staying with you?" You hear the faint sound of someone landing behind you, and instead of answering you question, Ashley just looks at the hallway behind you. You turn around to see that Kat and Ana have managed to sneak behind you. "You two come too."

"Got it!" the girls say in unison, before disappearing again. Ashley gets her minion, Red, and then follows you towards the spaceship docking bay. Presumably, the ninja girls were following too, just very stealthily.

Orbulon's Oinker had not yet arrived by the time you got there, so you had no choice but to wait. Ashley turns to ask you, "So why did you..." Before she even finishes her question, you shove the manual into her hands, not keen on having to explain everything twice. Ashley narrows her eyes in annoyance, but reads the manual anyway. Her eyes go wide, "WHAT! But that's...! How?!" You grin. So this was something even that little witch's magic couldn't replicate.

Before Ashley could could say more, you heard the telltale sounds of Orbuon's ship, the Oinker, approaching the docking bay. "About time he showed up," you mumble to yourself.
1553322222222222222222222222222222222212.title: Call up Orbulon to get the rest of your employees

choices: Orbulon analyses the remote inside his ship
Someone else enters the docking bay
1553322222222222222222222222222222222212.content:
The Oinker flew into the docking bay and landed, letting everyone aboard out. Orbulon came first, announcing "I got everyone I could." Along with Orbulon, there was Mona, Jimmy T., 9-Volt and 18-Volt, Young Cricket and Master Mantis, Dr. Crygor and his granddaughter Penny, Mike, and Dribble and Spitz. You nodded, along with Ashley and the ninja twins, who had miraculously appeared out of nowhere while everyone was getting off the spaceship, this was pretty much everyone you had on your payroll. You could have gotten Waluigi involved in this as well, but he wasn't getting his hands on your money.

"Good, everyone's here," you say. You swipe the manual out of Ashley's hands, and hold up the remote so your employees can see. "This here is my ticket to riches." Many of your employees groaned, a little sick of your hare-brained money making schemes.

Mona, however, was a bit more enthusiastic. "So, what does it do?"

Jimmy T. chimed in as well. "Yeah, it just looks like a TV remote."

You shove the manual in their direction, and say, "Read this. It'll take too long to explain." In all honesty, reading would probably take about the same amount of time as you explaining, but you just didn't want to explain. Mona took the manual from you and read it aloud to everyone. Everyone listened intently, fascinated by what this little remote could do. Well, everyone except you, who already knew what the remote did, Ashley, who was silently fuming that this remote you had stumbled across could do something her magic couldn't, and Kat & Ana, who had been secretly reading the manual over Ashley's shoulder.

Once Mona was done, Dr. Crygor asked, "Have you tested to see if it works?"

"I don't have time for that. We just need to hurry up and do my plan." Clearly you hadn't thought this through much, but you didn't think about that.

"So, what is this plan?" Mona asked, the most eager out of the entire group.

"And how does it involve us?" Penny added, possibly a little concerned about how Wario expected them to use this remote.

"Well, plenty of the bozos here hold some sort of power in their own world. All you gotta do is switch lives with them, and whatever else you want I guess, and then I'll be in control! Wa ha ha!" Your employees looked at each other awkwardly.

Ashley was the one to speak up. "And if we refuse?"

"Hey! This is my chance for riches beyond my wildest dreams!" This elicited many eye-rolls from your employees, as they knew no mater how much money you gathered, you'd never be satisfied. "So if you don't want to help, you can go find yourself a new job!" That seemed to quieten any concerns your employees had.

"So, how are we all going to be able to see the swaps?" Dr. Crygor asked.

"Huh?" you replied, picking your nose.

"Well, we can't exactly all hold onto the remote whenever we need to swap, that'd make the group too obvious."

Despite the fact that he was obviously right, you were still annoyed at the interruption. "Grrr. You're the tech guy aren't you? You figure something out."

"I'd happily do so if we weren't lightyears away from my lab."

From the back of the group, Orbulon spoke up. "I can take it into my ship to see if I can work something out."

"Alright, but make it quick. And in the meantime the rest of you figure out who you're gonna be. You know who's in the tournament, right?"

Most of your employees thought about it for a bit, as they knew some of the fighters but not all of them, 9-Volt was rather enthusiastic about it, however. "Ooo, I know! I know!" You had a feeling you knew why the Hands hadn't hired him as one of the assist characters for Diamond City; he was far too excited and hyperactive about being here at the tournament grounds.

His large friend 18-Volt tapped on his should and asked, "But what about the secret fighters?"

This seemed to calm 9-Volt down a little. "...Oh."

"Do I have to do everything here myself?" You asked out of frustration. You point at Ashley, Kat and Ana, "You girls have been here long enough, you should know."

Kat and Ana looked at each other. "Uhhhh..." That had been too focused on their training to really pay attention to who was here at the tournament.

Ashley pinched the bridge of her nose and sighed. She had gotten here the earliest out of all of them, since she had expected to be a fighter in the tournament rather than an assist character. "Red."

Her little demon minion grumbled, "I'll make a list."

"Good. But no swapping with any nobodies, like those apes or that fitness girl. There's nothing to to be gained from switching with them." You hand the remote to Orbulon, trusting that he wouldn't screw anything up, and that your employees would decide who they were going to be without much trouble. This amount of trust was actually pretty hard for you.
1553322222222222222222222222222222222212.title: Orbulon lands with the rest of the WarioWare In...

choices: Orbulon can't find anything on the remote
1553322222222222222222222222222222222212.content: While Orbulon went back into his Oinker to try and figure out how to make sure everyone you wanted could see the swaps, you were stuck outside as everyone tried to figure out who they wanted to be. 9-Volt explained who everyone was, except for a few he didn't know, where a brief description was given by Red. Everyone seemed to have some sort of demand about who they wanted to be. With good reason, they were giving up their own life and becoming someone else just to satisfy your selfish needs since you were the one who payed them, but their chatter annoyed you regardless. For instance, Mona wanted to be able to visit you easily if she wanted, so she'd probably need the life of one the people from the Mushroom Kingdom. Kat and Ana wanted to stick together, and they wanted to be able to continue their ninja training. Ashley wanted a life where she'd still be able to use magic, or something similar. And so on and so forth. You tapped your foot impatiently as you waited for Orbulon to hurry up and figure something out.
1553322222222222222222222222222222222212.title: Orbulon analyses the remote inside his ship

1553322222222222222222222222222222222212.content:
After much discussion, Orbulon finally came out of his Oinker, breaking up the bickering. "I think I've got just what you guys need." Orbulon had discovered six additional buttons, which he had already marked with symbols equally as cryptic as the symbols on the non-hidden buttons. The blue button, Undo, had an arrow pointing to the left. Red, Reset, had an octagon, like a stop sign. Yellow, Set, had an arrow pointing downwards. Green, Scramble, had arrows pointing every which way. Orange, Aware, had an open eye, and it's opposite, the purple Unaware button, had a closed eye. The plan was to make sure everyone what been hit with the Aware function, before you and Orbulon would take them out one by one to find the person they wished to swap with. Once found, they'd perform a life swap, Orbulon would render the Smasher in their life unconscious with some sort of alien technology, and unless they wanted to perform some sort of other swap with the Smasher in their life, you'd take the remote and the unconscious Smasher back to Orbulon's Oinker. Then you'd bring the next person out and repeat the process until everyone except you and Orbulon had been swapped. Orbulon would remain himself, since you figured he was more useful right now as himself than as one of the Smashers.

"Everyone got it?" you ask. You receive murmurs of acknowledgement from your employees. "I said GOT IT?!" You receive louder acknowledgement, but not exactly more enthusiastic. It was good enough for you though. You decide to take out one of the two groups of employees who were currently assist characters first, since they'd be the least suspicious. But who should go first; the twin ninja girls, Kat & Ana, or the young witch Ashley and her familiar Red?
1553322222222222222222222222222222222212.title: Orbulon finds the hidden buttons

1553322222222222222222222222222222222212.content:
"You two, you're going first," you say, pointing at Ashley and Red. Ashley seems unamused, aside from a knowing glint in her eye that went entirely unnoticed by you. Sure, Ashley wasn't entirely happy with this all being some sort of global domination plan, but she had been here the longest so she was somewhat glad she got first pick so she could use her knowledge of the fighters to good use before one of the others took her choice. She stepped forward, Red following behind. "So, who's it gonna be?"

Ashley paused, as if thinking it over, even though she knew who she was going to choose. Luckily she answered before you became impatient, uttering the name of the Smasher who's life she wished to take.
1553322222222222222222222222222222222212.title: Ashley and Red

1553322222222222222222222222222222222212.content: With a slight smirk, unnoticeable to anyone that wasn't looking for it, Ashley states the name of the Smasher she wished to switch with.
1553322222222222222222222222222222222212.title: Palutena/Rosalina

choices: Orbulon uses some alien technology to locate Rosalina
Ashley uses her magic to locate Rosalina
1553322222222222222222222222222222222212.content:
"Rosalina." Silence.

"Her!?" You ask.

"Is there a problem?" Ashley asks. "You wanted us in positions of power, and Rosalina is a princess."

"Oh sure she acts like a princess," you grumble, "But how come no one seems to know what kingdom she rules?"

Ashley narrows her eyes at you, but you weren't intimidated. You glare right back at her. It was clear neither of you wished to budge on the subject. Eventually Mona breaks up the staring contest. "Oh come on Wario. Ashley's been here longer so maybe she knows more about Rosalina than we do."

"Then how come she ain't tellin' us?" you bark back.

"Why do you care what I'm in charge of as long ad you get your money?" Ashley said flatly. This was no idle insult, Ashley knew full well that appealing to your greed would get you to do things her way.

"Fine! What about the demon?"

"Red will be taking the place of Rosalina's Luma."

"Aw man," Red groans.

"Oh no you don't. He can take someone else's life. We gain nothing from taking that star kid."

"Red is my familiar, not your employee. I shall do with him as I wish."

You grind your teeth together. Ashley was really getting on your nerves, letting some secret agenda of her own get in the way of your plans. Mona intervenes once again. "She's right y'know. You don't actually pay Red."

"Fine then. You'd better not mess this up," you growl, shoving your finger in Ashley's face. She leans back slightly to avoid being poked, but is otherwise unfazed. "Orbulon, get your stuff, we're going."

You leave the docking bay, Ashley and Red following behind, along with Orbulon, hidden by some sort of cloaking device. Your target; Rosalina and her Luma companion. You still weren't completely okay with this, but Mona had persuaded you. Now it was just a matter of finding them. You didn't pay enough attention to the other Smashers to have a rough idea of where she should be at this time of day.

"Don't either of you have some way of finding her?"
1553322222222222222222222222222222222212.title: Rosalina

choices: Ashley uses the remote as planned.
Palutena's roomate is also in the room, and Orbulon knocks her out as well.
1553322222222222222222222222222222222212.content:
"Leave it to me," Said Orbulon. He pulled out some strange device you didn't recognize. "My crew will do a quick scan of this place." He looked at Ashley and asked, "Can you recognize her silhouette?"

Ashley nodded, "I can."

"Excellent!" Orbulon spoke into the device, "Crew, start the scan."

You picked your nose as the device's holographic display cycled through the silhouettes. You saw Rosalina's silhouette, but you had no intention of doing Ashley's job.

"Stop," Said Ashley. "That's the one."

"Got it." The cycling stopped, and the silhouette changed to a map and a blinking dot. "There she is," Orbulon declared.

"Well quit wasting time and get going," You ordered.

Ashley looked at you with a bit of annoyance, not that you cared. Orbulon began walking ahead. Ashley and Red were behind him and you were behind them. Soon you were at Rosalina's room.

Ashley held out her hand for the remote. You wouldn't have given it to her if there was another way, but the remote said it only worked on the person who pressed the button and the person they were pointing the remote at, so you handed it over to her.

Orbulon knocked on the door. The door opened, but Orbulon didn't even give the person on the other side the chance to respond before activating his knockout tech. You hear a body slowly slump to the floor.
1553322222222222222222222222222222222212.title: Orbulon uses some alien technology to locate Ro...

choices: You swap lives with one of them.
You swap lives with both of them.
1553322222222222222222222222222222222212.content:
You heard a voice and brisk steps inside the room react to the fall, but it's quickly cut short as you heard another slump.

"Alright," said Orbulon. "Both Palutena and her roommate are unconscious."

Ashley crossed her arms, "I assume by roommate you mean Rosalina, the person I came here for in the first place."

Orbulon answered, "Well sure, but Palutena was the one who answered first and I can extrapolate from the current circumstances that this room belongs to both of them, so grammatically-"

"I don't care," You said. "Just step aside so that Ashley can do her swap." You turned to Ashley, "And make it quick. I don't have all day."

You saw Ashley and Red walk into the room and close the door behind them. You weren't worried. You and Orbulon would be aware of what they did, and Orbulon could knock them out if they got uppity.

**

You are now Ashley, child witch. You and Red are in Rosalina and Palutena's room. They are unconscious, and you have the remote with which you can take Rosalina's life.

Red points to Palutena and asks, "So what should we do with her. Do we keep her here? Take her back to the ship? Maybe I should switch lives with her?"

Looking at the two of them you thought for a moment and shook your head, "No. That is not the choice I wish to make just yet. I wish to try something first. Assist me in placing their hands next to each other."

"Huh? Why?" Asked Red.

"You will see," You tell him. The two of you get their hands positioned. You used the Unaware setting on the remote on both of them. "Now Red, you are to place both their fingers on the Life Swap button."

"Uhhhhh-"

"Do not question me," You told Red. "Do it."

"Well, alright," Red replied. You handed him the remote, and Red placed a finger from each woman's hand on the remote's Life Swap button.

You take your place in front of the remote. "Press the button, Red."
1553322222222222222222222222222222222212.title: Palutena's roomate is also in the room, and...

choices: You swap clothes with Rosalina and Palutena.
You swap bodies with Rosalina and Palutena.
1553322222222222222222222222222222222212.content:
Red did what he was told, and the results were instantaneous.

You see Rosalina and Palutena. Both of them now have their hair in your style, and both of them are wearing properly sized versions of your former clothing. You also see Red, who has remained singular. "Interesting," You say.

Red shuddered, "Yeah, I'm kind of remembering."

You ask him, "So their names are?"

"Both Ashley. Identical twin witches. They summoned me together and shared me," Red shuddered a bit.

You raised an eyebrow, "You find something unsatisfactory about this?"

Red began to sweat as he answered, "N-No. Just, you know, twice the work."

"Mama? Mama, where are you?"

You and Red turned towards the sound of the voice. It was a small star floating through the sky. It floated around Ashley. "Oh, hi mama! Who are these people?"

"They are... friends of mine," You lie to Luma. "They are fine. You should go to sleep too, little one, and keep them company."

"But I'm not tired," Luma complained.

"You need your rest if you are to be big and luminous," You replied. "And they would be a lot more comfortable if they had someone to be with them and keep them safe."

"Oh... okay..." Luma floated onto Rosalina's lap and quickly fell asleep.

Red pointed the remote at Luma. "And Relationship Swap. Now they're your pro-" Red stopped and met your glare. "Prize. Your prize," Red backpedaled. He turned to you and asked, "Are we done?"

You look at the mirror. Your hair was no longer in tails. Now it was in a style that it covered your right eye, but you knew that already. On your head was a sort of tiara with golden wings on the sides and a small silver crown in the middle. Each wing and the small crown had a gem studded into it. Golden winged bracers held detached sleeves in place. The golden necklace around your neck joined with the broach on your strapless dress that looked like a compass star.

Your dress was two-layered, and at the bottom the light blue gave way to unadorned ruffled white fabric. The dress was slit up the left side, and an eight-pointed star was there where the slit ended. The star itself was part of the belt (or was it a sash?) that wrapped around your waste. It was brown with a strip of red at the bottom, from which hung a simple repeating pattern of golden adornments. You were wearing short-heeled shoes, and their leather straps went up your leg, ending just below the knee.

"I look ridiculous." You tell yourself. And you do - this clothing was not meant for a child, and you should fix that right away.
1553322222222222222222222222222222222212.title: You swap lives with both of them.

choices: You give Wario back the remote. (Switch back to Wario's POV.)
You decide to keep the remote.
1553322222222222222222222222222222222212.content:
"Red, switch my bodies with theirs," you say.

"Right, right. No prob." Red placed a thumb from each woman on the Body Swap button, and then pressed both thumbs down.

You smiled as you see Rosalina and Palutena both look identical to how you used to. You turned back to the mirror and your smile grew wider.

You were now a beautiful goddess, and your clothes fit perfectly. A blue-green eye stared back at you, and light green hair ran down your body. It was longer and thicker than Rosalina's but not the sweeping spread-out mass that Palutena's hair had been. (http://i1.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/face... - the rightmost fusion of Rosalina and Palutena.)

"Ideal," You told yourself. Your voice carried both Palutena's authority and Rosalina's maternal aspect. It was an interesting voice, and you would make good use of it.

"So what's it like being two people?" Red asked.

As if to answer, you concentrate and pull out a large staff. It's head was a golden star outline with an orb in the middle. You concentrated, and you could feel the divine power flow through you. You remembered the basics of who you are - the Lady Rosatena, Cosmic Goddess of Light. Skyworld was your immediate domain, but in your Cosmic Observatory you held sway over the heavens of worlds all throughout interstellar space. Your loyal angel Pit led your Centurion army and your familiar Red led the Lumas. Thus did your divinity spread through the stars.

You opened the door and gave a victorious smile to Wario and Orbulon.

Wario let out his disgusting chuckle, "Ahahah! A two-for-one special! I like it! And now I have two employees. Even better! Now give me back the remote so I can get the others switched."
1553322222222222222222222222222222222212.title: You swap bodies with Rosalina and Palutena.

choices: You and your double use the remote again
You open the door to speak to Wario
1553322222222222222222222222222222222212.content:
After red presses the button, you suddenly find yourself laying on the floor, feeling a bit groggy. You can only assume that was a side effect of swapping lives with someone who was unconscious. You sat up, only to find yourself looking at... yourself?

Sitting in front of you seemed to be an exact copy of yourself, except this copy seemed to be wearing Palutena's clothes, adjusted to fit your smaller body. Just to confirm you weren't just looking into a mirror, you look down at yourself. It seemed you weren't wearing your usual clothes either; instead being clothed in Rosalina's dress, with your hair hanging loose and covering up one of your eyes. You look back up, noticing your doppelganger seemed to be doing the same. Red was looking between the two of you, somewhat confused.

"You're..." you start.

"...me?" your doppelganger finishes.

It would seem that trying to swap lives with two people at the same time had split you into two copies of yourself, one for each life. Looking at where you had previously been standing, a woman you didn't recognise was laying unconscious, wearing your dress. She seemed to have features of both Rosalina and Palutena. Just as you were split into two to fill two lives, Rosalina and Palutena had been merged together to fill one. You slowly stood up, watching as the other you did the same.

"Well, this isn't what I expected," you say.

"But I think we can make this work," the other you says, as if finishing your thought.

"I agree." If there was ever a perfect partner to have in an endeavour such as this, it would be another you.

Red, who had said nothing during this entire encounter, suddenly spoke up. "This is doing my head in." It seemed watching you speak to yourself like this was a bit too much for Red.

"Well, get used to it. You still need to swap with Luma," you tell him. He groans, picking up the remote and walking over to Rosalina's bed, where Luma had been sleeping.

"Why do you get to keep Red? What about about me?" The other you asked. It seemed the two of you didn't agree on everything, despite being the same person.

"Palutena has an entire army at her command, don't complain," you told her.

"Hm, I suppose you're right." While you made sure Red did as he was told, the other you busied herself looking in the mirror. Red ended up performing a relationship swap rather than a life swap, but this was preferable, as it would allow Red to keep his powers. Before you can do anything else, your double speaks up again. "I look ridiculous in this," she says.

"Hm?"

"This clothing wasn't meant for a, um, child." You, and by extension your double, hated being called a child, but you supposed she didn't have any other word to use in this context. She was right though, while Rosalina's dress wasn't too different from your own, and still looked pretty good on your body, Palutena's outfit was clearly meant for a more mature body, and didn't look as good when being worn by your double.

"Well, we still have the remote, and an unconscious victim," you suggest, gesturing towards the Rosalina/Palutena combo that was currently living your life. With the remote, your double could get your normal clothes back, or get a body more befitting her new attire. You could swap as well, if you so wished. Perhaps you should get a body more befitting your role as mother of the stars. You assumed that having both of you press the button at once, like you'd done with the life swap button, would split Rosalina/Palutena's body apart again, and give you each one of them.

Before either of you could do anything, though, you heard a banging on the door. "What's taking so long in there!?" Wario shouted from outside the door. "Hurry it up!" Both you and your double glared at the door.
1553322222222222222222222222222222222212.title: Double Trouble

1553322222222222222222222222222222222212.content:
Neither you nor your double needed to say anything, you both knew that Wario could wait.

"Red, the remote," you said, holding out a hand towards him.

"Oh, right," came the reply, as he placed it in your hand.

"So, will you be swapping as well?" your double asked, reaching her hand out to grab the remote.
1553322222222222222222222222222222222212.title: You and your double use the remote again

1553322222222222222222222222222222222212.content:
"Yes," you say as you offer the remote to your double, while still keeping your own hand on it. "I'm not yet content with my current situation."

"Okay," you double agrees, taking hold of the remote as well, before looking down at herself, Palutena's dress still clothing her child-like body. "I haven't actually decided whether I want to swap bodies or clothes yet. Do you have any preference?"

You calmly think over the options. You could swap clothes, giving both of you your original dress back. You knew it would look good on you, as it was your's in the first place, but it would also result in two identical Ashleys walking around, but both living different lives. You imagined that might get confusing fast though, especially for Red. Alternatively, you could swap bodies, giving both of you the bodies that belonged to the lives you were living. In addition to matching your lives, your new bodies would also match your new clothes, sorting out your double's predicament with Palutena's mature clothing.

Ultimately, you decide that the two of you should perform a...
1553322222222222222222222222222222222212.title: Both Ashleys swap

choices: Rosalina's Body (you have the correct bodies for your lives)
Palutena's Body (you have the bodies that match each other's lives)
1553322222222222222222222222222222222212.content:
"I think we should perform a body swap, and take the bodies that match our lives," you saw to your double, placing your finger on the Body Swap button, ready to press it together.

Your double seemed to still be thinking, as if she didn't want a body that would suit the clothing she was wearing, but ultimately nodded, and placed her finger next to your's on the Body Swap button. "Okay. On the count of three." You nod, and the two of your aim the remote at the unconscious combination of women that was living your life at the moment.

"One," your double says.

"Two," you continue.

"Three," you both say, pressing your fingers down on the button at the same time. Just as before, two bodies are merged into one, while one body is split into two, but this time it happens in reverse. The two copies of yourself are made back into one body, technically inhabited by both Rosalina and Palutena, but they thought they were a single person, in particular, they thought they were you. It kind of made you wonder how they would react to being one person if both of them were still conscious and aware of the situation. Meanwhile, their combined body was split back up again into Rosalina's body and Palutena's body, with you and your double each receiving one of them. But which one did you receive?
1553322222222222222222222222222222222212.title: Body Swap

1553322222222222222222222222222222222212.content: You shook your head. "No, I think I should be fine like this." You hand the remote off to your double, and she points it at the combined Rosalina and Palutena, before looking down at herself. You had a feeling you knew what was going through her mind; she was trying to decide whether to swap clothes and get your old dress back, or whether to swap bodies, and take the combined body of Rosalina and Palutena, which would probably suit Palutena's clothes better. Eventually, she seems to have made her mind up, and presses the button for a...
1553322222222222222222222222222222222212.title: Only Palutena-Ashley swaps

choices: "Find some other way to do it."
1553322222222222222222222222222222222212.content:
Ashley groans. "Red," she mutters.

"I gotcha," he replies, turning into Ashley's wand. She closes her eyes and mutters a few words, which go unheard by you. Not that you cared what she was saying, as long as it got you closer to your goal.

After a few moments, Ashley opens her eyes and said, "She's in the the library."

"Alright," you shout, "Let's get goin'!... Uh, lead the way." You didn't want to admit it, but you didn't actually know where the library. With another sigh and a glare, Ashley heads in the direction of the library, followed by Red, after he turned back to normal, Orbulon, and yourself. It takes you a little while, but you eventually make it to make it to the library, and with a bit of luck (or perhaps a little interference from Orbulon and Ashley) you manage to not run into anyone on the way there.

"There," Ashley says bluntly, pointing down one of the aisles of the library. Following where she was pointing, you see Rosalina, the supposed "princess" who didn't seem to rule over anything. Ashley holds out her hand for the remote. You wouldn't have given it to her if there was another way, but the remote said it only worked on the person who pressed the button and the person they were pointing the remote at, so you handed it over to her. "Red," Ashley says before swapping, "Once I swap, fly in and get the remote from me."

"Alright," Red says, transforming once more, this time into a broom.

And then, with the press of a button, Ashley was now down the other end of the aisle, dressed as Rosalina, while Rosalina stood where Ashley was before. Before Rosalina can say anything, Orbulon uses his device to make her fall unconscious. Red, in his broom form, flies over to where Ashley was, and transforms back so he can use the remote, which Ashley gives him. From where you stood, you could faintly here the Luma child say, "What's that, Mama?" before his life was stolen from him (but not in the usual sense).

The Luma was knocked unconscious too, and now the first part of your plan was complete. Orbulon grabbed the unconscious Rosalina and Luma, who now thought they were Ashley and Red, and got ready to head back to his spaceship. Ashley handed you the remote, Red now floating around at about head height. "Good luck with the rest of your plan," she says, although it comes out sounding rather sarcastic. "I'll be going now."

"Oh no you won't," you demand. "We need you so we can find everyone else we need to swap with." It hadn't been a part of the original plan, but considering Ashley had been able to locate her target, she should be useful in finding everyone else's targets too. Ashley glares at you, an expression you're all too familiar with, and says...
1553322222222222222222222222222222222212.title: Ashley uses her magic to locate Rosalina

choices: Ashley goes along with your plan
1553322222222222222222222222222222222212.content:
"WHAT!" you yell, earning a "Shhh" from the Mii in charge of the library. You were fuming at Ashley for turning on you like this.
