"I said, find some other way to do it. You're not in charge of me anymore," she said coldly.

"I'm the one who writes your paycheck, so you're gonna do what I tell you to!"

"No, your employee is Ashley. I'm Rosalina now, so I'm free to do as I please."

You grit your teeth, before grinning smugly. "Oh yeah, and who's the one with the remote here?" You hold up the remote Ashley had just handed you. Ashley eyes the remote, knowing you could fully well replace her with someone else or make her unaware of the swaps and remove her from the plan altogether.
1553322222222222222222222222222222222212.title: "Find some other way to do it."

choices: You hit her, and get the remote back
You miss, and Ashley escapes (switch to Ashley's POV)
1553322222222222222222222222222222222212.content:
With a quick wave of Rosalina's wand, Red is sent rocketing into you head-first, knocking you off balance and causing you to drop the remote, which Ashley catches. "That would be me," she says smugly, replying to your rhetorical question. "I hold the power now, so you'd be wise to not get in my way."

"You little brat," you growl as Orbulon helps you up. "You'll pay for this!"

"I don't see how you could possibly make me do that." Ashley begins to walk past you, towards the exit of the library, Red floating near her head and sticking his tongue out at you. Before she can make her exit with the remote, however, you charge at her with all your might. It didn't matter that she was a little girl (physically at least, since she was now technically as old as Rosalina had been), she was about to walk off with something integral to your money-making plan, and you weren't about to stand for it.
1553322222222222222222222222222222222212.title: Ashley takes the remote back

1553322222222222222222222222222222222212.content:
As you charge at her, Ashley dodges out of the way, and you end up ramming head first into the wall. As Orbulon helps you up again, Ashley makes her escape, taking the remote with her. "FIND HER!" you yell at Orbulon, earning another "Shhh" from the librarian.

~~~

You are now Ashley, the young witch under the employment of WarioWare Inc., although you currently occupied the life of Rosalina, the princess of the stars. You had just obtained her life as part of Wario's plan for riches and power, but now you had also taken the remote from him, and escaped with it. "That went rather well," you say to no one in particular.

Red, your minion who currently occupied the life of Rosalina's Luma, floated around eye level, and said "I hate to break it to you, but Wario ain't going to give up so easily."

"Hm, true. Once he has his eyes set on riches, he seldom lets go."

"Plus, the rest of the crew are still aware of the swaps, so they know exactly who we are."

"Well, we'll just have to fix that then, won't we," you say, looking down at the remote, particularly the coloured buttons which Orbulon had labelled.

"Ah, smart. If we make them all unaware again, then we get away with it completely."

"Now where to start..." Right now you could either head back to the library to make Wario and Orbulon unaware, or you could head back to the spaceship dock and make the rest of the WarioWare employees unaware.
1553322222222222222222222222222222222212.title: You miss, and Ashley escapes (Ashley's POV)

1553322222222222222222222222222222222212.content: With a slight smirk, unnoticeable to anyone who was actually looking out for it, Ashley states the name of the people she wishes to swap with.
1553322222222222222222222222222222222212.title: Robin/Zelda

1553322222222222222222222222222222222212.content:
"Robin."

"...Eh? Who's that?" you ask, caring little for what your employees thought of your ignorance.

"Robin is a skilled tactician and a master sorcerer when it comes to the art of using magic tomes. They also have a dark past I may be able to exploit," Ashley calmly explains.

"And why exactly should I let you swap with this magician weirdo, huh? What's in it for me?" It was clear Ashley had her own agenda. You weren't so dense so as not to notice at all, but so long as it was profitable for you, you didn't mind.

"Robin is the tactician of Chrom, the prince of Ylisse's army. You wanted us in positions of power, didn't you?" You grumble a bit, muttering things about how a 'tactician' was nowhere was profitable a swap as a princess or something. Ashley continues, "And if that's not enough for you, Red will be occupying the life of Lucina, the princess of Ylisse."

Before you can get a word in to agree with her plan, now that you knew you had a direct link to a royal treasury, Red interjects. "Hey! Why do I have to be a girl?" he complains.

"I need you in a position in which you can assist me when I need your help. Lucina fits that role the best," Ashley calmly explains.

"But aren't they just from the same world? I could be Ike or someone else instead."

"Even ignoring the fact that Marth and Ike lived in completely separate eras to Robin and Lucina, Lucina is still a better choice to have you where you can assist me. You see, Robin and Lucina share a special bond. Lucina is Robin's..."
1553322222222222222222222222222222222212.title: Robin

155332222222222222222222222222222222222.content: Are you the Balloon Pokemon, Jigglypuff?
155332222222222222222222222222222222222.title: More Characters

1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.content: Are you Bowser's equally evil son, Bowser Jr.?
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: More Characters

1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.content: Are you the robotic operating buddy, R.O.B.?
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: More Characters

choices: Find someone who can help you use the remote
Try to link up the remote with your system.
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
You are R.O.B., short for Robotic Operating Buddy. Your kind were originally designed as a fun little robot to be used as a playmate for children, but as technology advanced, you quickly became obsolete, and nowadays your model was no longer being produced. Luckily, the Hands had managed to save you from the scrapheap and recruit you into tournament. You weren't sure you were that good at fighting, but if you could continue your purpose of being a friend to mankind, you didn't mind.

You had been heading towards the leisure room, when you noticed a stray box lying on the floor. There didn't seem to be anyone around, so you guessed whoever had dropped it didn't think it was important, so you could probably just throw it in the trash if there wasn't anything good inside. You lean down and pick up the box, a little awkwardly due to not having proper hands, and analyse the contents. The box contains some sort of remote, as well as a manual that most likely explains how the remote works. You can't really pick up the manual and read it, but you manage to perform a manual analysis of the remote via your optical sensors and wireless connection. It would seem the remote was able to alter reality in strange ways by swapping things between people. That definitely sounded fun!

There was only one problem; you didn't have the hands, nor the fingers, required to operate the remote properly. But there were ways around that, right? You'd just need to find someone to play with and they could press the buttons for you. Or perhaps you could find some way to link the remote up with your system so that you could use the remote without needing to press the buttons. If you can figure that out, you might even be able to link the remote up with the electronics in the tournament grounds to get everyone in on the fun. That'd take a lot of work though, and you should probably start small.
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: R.O.B.

choices: Look for someone to swap with.
Try to hook yourself up to the living quarters.
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.content: It takes a bit of work, but you are eventually able to hook up the remote to your own robotic body, allowing you to use the remote's functions through a modified version of your Robo Beam. Now you just needed someone to use it on. That shouldn't be too difficult, you'd just need to wander around until you found another competitor. Then again, having helped out with building the current tournament's stadium and living quarters, you understood how a lot of the electrical wiring here worked, so with a bit more work, you might be able to hook yourself up to the tournament's living quarters, and use the remote's power to swap everyone at once.
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: Try to link up the remote with your system.

1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
Are you an alternate costume character?

(E.g. Male Wii Fit Trainer, Wireframe Little Mac, Alph, The Koopalings)

1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: Pokemon Trainer/Daisy

choices: Do a life swap with one of the competitors
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
You are Red, the Pokemon Trainer. Walking around the halls of the Smash Bros Tournament was a little bittersweet for you. Although you had participated in the previous tournament, commanding your Pokemon from the sidelines, the Hands no longer wanted fighters who could switch between forms mid battle, and that included you switching Pokemon. With that in mind, they felt your participation was no longer necessary, and only wished for your Charizard to compete. They had still gotten you in to design a trophy modeled after you, for their Hall of History. That in itself was an honor, but not as much as it would have been if they let you participate in the tournament. Since you had previously been a participant, they let you say hello to the other participants and catch up for a while before you had to head home. It had been nice getting to see everyone, but your time was up, and it was time to leave.

On your way to the exit, however, you find a package lying on the ground. You plan to take it back to its owner before leaving, but find no label on the box identifying the owner. You check inside the box to see if you can find something about who owns it from the contents. Inside is some sort of remote, and an instruction manual. Since you have nothing else to go off, you quickly read through the instruction manual. You are surprised to find that this remote is far more advanced than anything in your world. In fact, it seemed far more advance than anything from any of the competitors' worlds. Switching around bodies and lives, and making it so no one else notices? That seemed crazy!

You were originally going to try to find its owner, but now you weren't so sure. Maybe you could do a life swap or something so you'd still get to participate in the tournament, albeit a little more up close in personal than last time. But then you'd be stealing someone else's place, and their whole life. And unless you swapped with one of the Pokemon, your own life would be gone, back to your own world, and you'd have no way of getting it back... well, unless you did a relationship swap from your new life with one of the Pokemon.
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: Pokemon Trainer

1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.content: You decide that you don't want to risk screwing up reality and ending up unable to get back to your own world or something. It'd probably just be better to find someone who might be the actual owner and give it back. But who could own something so advanced? From the fighters you remembered two cam to mind; Samus, and Fox (or Falco, either really). Both of their worlds had space travel, so maybe this belonged to one of them. With that in mind, you head back to the area where the competitors stayed in search of...
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: Look for the remote's owner

1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.content: You decide that, despite the risks, this opportunity is too good to pass up. You'd be able to compete in the tournament again, albeit a bit more up close and with a different set of skills. You'd be taking someone else's place, but they wont know that. The only thing was then who to swap with? It'd probably be easier for you to swap with another human (or at least human-like) competitor, just so you didn't have to deal with some weird stuff like people treating you like an animal. However, that'd cause a few complications once the tournament ended. The person in your life would probably head back out to your world once you swapped, but you'd be staying here in their life. Then once the tournament ended, you'd end up getting sent back to their world. Of course, once the tournament was drawing to a close (or at any point really) you could do a life swap or relationship swap with one of the Pokemon competitors so that you'd get sent back to your world and reclaim your life. Things would get a bit jumbled up, but you could probably manage. Of course, all this could be avoided by swapping lives with a Pokemon in the first place. That way the Pokemon would end up in your life, so you'd end up back in your world when the tournament ended and you'd be able to go back to your own life. It also meant you'd gain all of the Pokemon's moves, with the downside of being treated like an animal. You'd also lose your clothes, but you could fix that with another clothes swap.
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: Do a life swap with one of the competitors

1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.content: You decide that even though it make swapping back a good deal easier, you decide you don't want people to treat you like a Pokemon. Instead you decide to go in search of one of the human competitors in the tournament. They'll end up in the wrong life or wrong world once everything's said and done, but they wouldn't notice anything out of the ordinary so it should be fine. Now there was the question on who to swap with. The newcomers would be at some training session, so they'd be easy to find. You didn't really know any of their personalities though, so you weren't sure whether you could convincingly act like them. Although, since some came from worlds that no other competitors came from, maybe the other competitors didn't have as good of an idea of how they were supposed to act either, which could work in your favor. Of course, you knew the competitors who had been in the previous tournament a lot better, and could probably imitate them pretty well, but they didn't need to be anywhere in particular so finding them would be a bit harder. The time it took could be worth it, but it might also mean screwing up one of your friends' lives.
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: Swap with a human competitor

1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.content: You decide to go in search of one of the newcomers, since you figured you'd be able to more easily imitate them. You didn't just want to be wandering around with no sense of direction though. You decided to swap with the first person you come across. As you turn a corner you see...
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: Swap with a newcomer

1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.content: You decide to go in search of one of the veteran competitors, since you figured you'd be able to more easily imitate them. You didn't just want to be wandering around with no sense of direction though. You decided to head to one of the places where there was usually at least one or two fighters. You head towards the...
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: Swap with a veteran

1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
You head over to the gym, where the fighters usually trained. There was usually someone there. You luckily don't run into anyone on the way there, so no one questioned why you hadn't left yet. You hear sounds of fighting from inside the gym, so clearly someone's there.

Peeking around the door frame, you see two people, each beating up their own sandbag. On one side was Samus, clad in her Power Suit. You had actually sort of become friends with her during your time at the tournament. She had befriended a Pikachu participating in the tournament, and since you were the only human here from the Pokemon world, she'd come to you when she needed advice. You'd probably be able to imitate her fairly well, and since she was the only competitor from her world, you wouldn't really have to worry about people talking about what went on outside of the tournament. However, you would feel a little bad about taking her place in the tournament, and trapping her in your world just so you could get back to your own life. On the other side of the gym was Ike, beating up a sandbag with his large sword. You weren't as close friends with him, so you probably couldn't imitate him as well, and there were other people here from his world, but because you weren't as close to him, you didn't feel as bad about taking his life. Weighing up your options, you decide to swap lives with...
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: Gym

1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.content: You decide that despite feeling a little bad about taking her life, you'd have an easier time pretending to be Samus than Ike. You point the remote at her and press the life swap button. Almost instantly, you are transported over into the gym, your vision distorted by the visor on Samus's helmet. You look down at yourself, although you can't really see anything except the power suit, which covers your whole body. There are probably slight alterations to the suit to accommodate for your body, but you can't really tell. Under the suit, you can feel your body covered completely by Samus's skin tight Zero Suit. Its tightness is a little uncomfortable on your groin, which reminds you that people will see you as a girl now. You turn to look at the entrance, where you see Samus, dressed in your clothes, looking into the gym with a sad smile on her face. You felt a bit guilty, stealing her life and everything, and leaving her in yours to go back to your world. You look down at the remote in your hand. Maybe there was something you could do. Maybe you should go talk to her before she left and find a way to include her in all of this. Maybe you could make her aware of the swap and see if she was okay with this, or get her to help you find a life you could use that you wouldn't feel so guilty for taking but could still imitate fairly well. As her face disappears around the corner, you realise you've got to decide fast.
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: Samus

choices: "You can use my life for now."
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
You quickly run out into the hallway over to where Samus went once you're close enough for her to notice you, you swap back.

"Red?" she says, "I thought you left already."

"Actually, there's something I need to talk to you about."

"Oh... okay." She seems a little confused.

"You see, I found this remote," you say, showing her the remote and handing her the manual for her to read through, which she does while you explain the rest. "I thought I might be able to use the life swap option to stay here at the tournament instead of having to head back home."

"So why did you need to talk to me about this?"

"Well, I already tried it out on you, since I just needed someone who I could find quickly and knew how it sort of imitate, and you happened to be there. But I got too guilty seeing you walking away with my life to go back to my world. So I swapped back and thought I'd ask for help from you."

"O-okay." You can't see her face clearly, but she sounds a little weirded out by the fact that you swapped lives with her. "How can I help?"

"Well, maybe you could help me find someone else who's life I could have instead. Someone who I won't feel as guilty about taking their life for a while."

"How are you planning to get back to your own world if the person if your life leaves?"

"If I swap lives or relationships with one of the Pokemon, I'll get to go back to my own world. It'll just screw things up a little and leave them stuck as a resident of my world. So, will you help?"

"Well, alright. But only because it makes reality so no one else sees the changes."

"So you'll help me find someone to swap with?"

"Yeah. Although, you sure you don't still want to be me?" You can hear in her voice that she's clearly joking. She's probably just making fun of the fact that you're a guy and you went into her life before, becoming a girl. You give a serious answer though.

"Well, if you're okay with living in my world from now on, then sure."

"Wait, but what'll happen to my world then?"

"It'll still have someone doing all the hero-y stuff you do. It just won't be you."

"So, I'll get to be a Pokemon Trainer?"

"Well, while you're in my life you definitely will be. And then when I'm back, we can probably get you the life of another Pokemon Trainer. Or I guess you could keep my life as a trainer and I could find a new one."

"Hm..." You're honestly a little surprised that she's actually considering letting you keep her life and spot in the tournament for now while she goes back to your world in your life. Maybe getting her closer with Pikachu is influencing her decision a bit. After a little while, she says, "Alright..."
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: Go talk to Samus

1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
"You will?"

"Yeah. It'll fun having you around again, but I'm not giving up my spot here so you can be here." You smile. Samus had your back. "So, why'd you take my life instead of Ike's? He was in the gym too."

"Well, I don't know Ike as well as I do you. I didn't think I'd be able to impersonate him well enough."

"Hm, makes sense. Anyway, I think I have someone in mind for you to swap with. Follow me." You nod, and follow Samus as she leads you down the hallway. What kind of competitor does Samus have in mind?
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: "I'll help you find another life."

1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.content: What kind of competitor does Samus have in mind?
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: A human one

1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.content: Who does Samus take you to see?
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: A female one

1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
"There," Samus says. Down the hallway is Peach, princess of the Mushroom Kingdom.

"W-Wait, Peach?!"

"Yeah. What's the problem?"

"W-Well, she's a girl."

"So am I. Didn't stop you from trying to borrow my life. Do you know her well enough to imitate her?"

"I guess... But what about Mario? I don't want to go out with a guy."

"We can fix that later with another swap. Right now, you just need a life you can borrow so you can stay at the tournament."

You sigh. This is probably her way of getting back at you for trying to borrow her life. You didn't really want to be Peach, but it was only a matter of time before the hands realised you hadn't left yet.
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: Peach

1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
You raise the remote, set it so samus will be aware, and hit the life swap button. Instantly, you are wearing peach's clothes and visa versa. Upon seeing you in peach's dress, samus laughs
Samus: nice dress, Peach!
You: haha very funny
But peach heard all of the laughing and turned around
Peach: is everything alright Peach?
You: uh... yeah...everything is ok
She then starts to walk away
Do you want anything else from her before she leaves?

choices: A real animal (like Donkey Kong or Duck Hunt)
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.content: What kind of animal?
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: Some sort of animal

1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
"Wait, really?" you ask.

"Yeah. I mean, your world is probably a whole lot less dangerous than mine, and being a Pokemon Trainer actually seems pretty fun. Plus my world will still have someone doing my job, so I won't have to worry about what's going on back there. I you really want to go through the tournament living as a female bounty hunter, then be my guest."

"Well, alright then. Just hold onto this for a second." You point the remote at her, and she puts her hand on it too, before you press the life swap button. The two of you swap places again, but this time you are both aware of the changes.

"So," Samus says, adjusting your cap (or should you say her cap now?), "I guess I should get going before the Hands just flat out kick me out.

"Wait," you say. "Before you go, I should ask whether I should do a life or a relationship swap when the tournament ends."

"What's the difference?"

"Well if I do a relationship swap, I can still bring you your life back, so you can still be Samus, just you'll be Samus in my world instead of yours. If I do a life swap, then your life will be back in your world, and unless you want to be a Pokemon, one of us will have to find a new life."

"Hm, I guess do a...
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: "You can use my life for now."

1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
"So you don't want to be Samus anymore?"

"Well if I'm going to be living in your world I want to be a Pokemon Trainer instead of a bounty hunter, you know?"

"Yeah, I get you."

Samus makes as if she's about to turn and leave, but she quickly turns back again. "Wait, how am I going to know it's you? I won't be able to see the life swap."

"Oh... uh, maybe the remote has some sort of hidden feature of something?" you say, hoping it was true.

"Use my suit," Samus says, "It should be able to find it if there's anything there." You nod, and use her suit to search the remote for any hidden features. You wonder how you know how to operate Samus's suit, but you suppose that since you're currently in Samus's life, you know what Samus knows. To your surprise, you manage to locate a secret panel with 6 buttons, one of which is exactly what you're looking for, so you quickly remove the panel. You point the remote at Samus and press the orange button.

Samus blinks a little bit. "What did that do?" she asks.

"Now you should be able to see any swaps I do," you explain, happy that you've found a way to make this work.

"Oh. Cool." She pauses for a second. "Well, I guess it's time for me to head home." She holds out a hand for you to shake.

You shake her hand with your non-arm canon hand. "I'll see you after the tournament's over. Thanks for letting me do this."

"No problem. Bye." She waves as she turns around and heads towards the exit. You wave back, until she disappears around a corner.

You smile. You were going to participate in the Smash Bros tournament again, albeit as Samus Aran instead of Pokemon Trainer Red. This littler remote had changed your life, quite literally. You were kind of curious about what else it could do, but you also didn't want to mess things up too bad. Samus would know if you returned home after the tournament with other swaps still affecting you. Maybe you should just put the remote away somewhere in your (Samus's) room so it would be safe until you needed it once the tournament ended.
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: Life Swap

1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.content: If you swapped with one of the human competitors, you wouldn't be able to get back to your world unless you swapped with one of the Pokemon later on. That'd leave a Pokemon in the place of the person you swapped with, and the person would be stuck in your world, or even worse, in the life of a Pokemon. No, you couldn't do something like that to someone, even if it mean you'd be living as a Pokemon until the tournament was over and you headed back to your world. But who to swap with? Charizard seemed the obvious choice. He was your partner Pokemon, and the one chosen out of the three you had taken with you during the last tournament to compete this time. Getting back to yourself wouldn't be difficult at all, since you were his trainer, so you'd be sent back to him (in your life) once the tournament was over. But could you really do that to him? He had seemed so excited when he found out he was going to be in the tournament again. Were you really going to take this away from him?
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: Swap with a Pokemon competitor

1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.content: You decided that Charizard would probably be the best choice. Not only was he your own Pokemon, which made for easy access back to your own life, but you also knew all his moves and abilities. If you were to take the life of a Pokemon and fight as them, Charizard would be your choice. You had a feeling you knew where he'd be, so you quickly headed over to the gym. Just as you suspected, Charizard was there, practicing the new moves you had taught him. All you had to do was point at him and press the button. But by now, the guilt was really setting in. Charizard was your partner, you couldn't just take his place. Could you? Maybe you should at least tell him first. Maybe he'd be okay with it.
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: Swap with Charizard

1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
You couldn't just steal Charizard's life and place at the tournament without at least telling him first. As you approach, Charizard hears you footsteps, and after seeing that it's you, he runs over to you. He lowers his head expectantly, and you give him a pat.

"Hey Charizard."

"Char char?" You can only assume he's asking why you're still here.

"Well, they were modelling a trophy after me, when I found this." You show him the remote, which he looks at curiously. "This remote can apparently swap things around, so I was thinking of trying to use it to swap with one of the competitors so I could still compete."

Charizard nods, understanding, but soon narrows his eyes as he realises why you're here talking to him.

"I'm sorry to ask this of you, but I wanted to swap with one of the Pokemon so I'd be able to easily get back to our world without jumbling people up too much, and you seemed like the best option. I know how much you've been excited for this tournament, though, so I'll only do it if you're okay with it. If we do this, I'll be competing in the tournament with everyone thinking I'm you, and you'll get to be a trainer, with everyone thinking you're me. So, what do you say?"
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: Tell Charizard first

1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
Charizard refuses to look at you for a while while he thinks it over. You can understand why; this is a pretty big thing you're asking of him. After a while, though, he looks back at you, and nods.

"Really? You'll do it?"

Charizard nods. He seems to be happy at how excited you are.

"Alright, just hold onto this so we can both see the swap." You hold out the remote, pointing it at Charizard, and Charizard grabs onto the end of it with his claw. You press the life swap button, and soon the two of you had swapped places the remote was still in your hands, but now you were completely naked, and Charizard was dressed in all of your clothes.

"Well, that's interesting." You hear an unfamiliar voice say. You look to see Charizard examining the changes. You didn't expect him to speak, though. "Huh, I guess I can speak your language now." You keep your mouth shut, a little hesitant to hear what you'd sound like spouting Charizard's dialect out of your mouth. "So, is this it? Everyone thinks I'm you, but I still look like me?"

You nod. Then Charizard suggests something you hadn't really considered. "Could this thing swap our bodies too? If I'm gonna be a trainer, I want to have a human body too." Now it was your turn to think about it. Were you ready to give up your body, just like that? Living Charizard's life, pretending to be him, that was one thing, but actually becoming a Charizard was another thing entirely. Although you were already starting to feel a little self conscious about walking around nude. Perhaps having the body of a fire breathing dragon, one accustomed to not wearing any clothing, might help with that.
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: Charizard lets you swap

1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
Eventually, you decide it would probably be best to borrow Charizard's body along with his life, and Charizard would probably have an easier time mimicking you and doing all your trainer stuff if he was human. You nod, and try to say, "Okay." It ends up coming out as "Char," though, and you sound just as dumb as you thought you would speaking like Charizard. You point the remote at Charizard again, he grabs onto it, and you press the body swap button.

This time the change is much more drastic. Rather than simply losing your clothes, your entire body had been restructured. You were much larger, your skin felt scaly, you had extra appendages in the form of your new wings and tail, and all in all, everything just felt different. It was too much to put into words. Charizard seems to be a bit surprised but all the changes too. However, he seems to have gotten over it quicker than you have. He says, "Well, I guess I should be going back to our world." He reaches up and pats you on the head. You finally understand why he liked it when you did that so much. "Good luck in the tournament. Don't lose for me." And with that, Charizard heads out of the gym with your life and body, waving to you, presumably heading to the craft that would taking him back to your world. You wave back with your little dragon-like claw. Even though it was probably about the size of your normal hand, it felt smaller due to the larger size of Charizard's body.

You stomp around the gym a bit, getting used to controlling Charizard's large, reptilian body. You felt so big and bulky, but your arms felt scrawny by comparison. Having such a long neck and three extra limbs to control was a bit confusing too. You weren't sure how you were going to get used to all this by the time you had to compete in the tournament. It'd take a lot of practice. However... You look down at the remote, still held in your claw. If the manual was right, Charizard would only be aware the two swaps you made while he was holding onto the remote. You could still swap body or clothes and the like, and he'd still think whatever you had was his original body. You could just borrow someone else's body; someone you'd be a bit more comfortable as, perhaps.
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: Swap bodies with Charizard

Even operating the remote was difficult for someone as small as you.

For now, you wanted to test the remote, and then you could figure out the specifics of what you wanted to do later. You look around for anyone to swap with, holding the remote about your head, until you spot a potential target.

Still, there was no one else around, so if you wanted to test out this remote, it was Samus or nobody. Doing your best to maneuver the remote which was almost as large as you were, you point the remote at Samus and press the button for a...

1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
Suddenly a whole new world of sensations washes over you, and you experience new things like smells, the weight of your new chest, and a bit of a draft. You look down and realize that you're dressed in the same outfit you were wearing as a robot, nothing. You instinctively feel a need to preserve your modesty, but the other people nearby don't seem to think anything of the nude bounty hunter body. It appears that the remote really does keep people from realizing that anything changed.

A nearby mirror on the wall lets you finally get a good look at the kind of body you now find yourself in, and it is definitely a body to behold. From what you understood, a body like this was something most women, and some men, would kill for. Long legs, a thin waist, wide hips, a large bust, a firm butt, and a pretty face made you feel pretty amazing. Your newfound height was also pretty incredible, as going from a tiny robot to a rather tall woman made for quite a significant difference.

Your head swirled with possibilities for what you could do with your new body, but seeing your naked reflection gave you an idea of where you should start. Holding the remote in your hand, now with far greater ease than before, you set your sights upon the Life Swap and Clothes Swap options. Who would be a good candidate to perform your next swap with? You could always try to find Samus in your old body to get something that matches your current status, but who knows how hard it's going to be to find that tiny thing. You hear someone coming around the corner as you pondered your choice, and you make your decision.

Take the risk and try to find someone close to Mario.
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
You are Pauline. By the standards of normal humans you are quite attractive, if in a slightly old-fashioned way. You are a slim, not too-short woman with wavy chest-length burgundy-brown hair. Your violet eyeshadow goes well with your blue eyes, and the gold bangle on your left arm matches your large gold teardrop earrings. Your red halter neck dress accentuates your beauty without being immodest, and your black ankle strap high heel pumps look just as good in a pose as they sound walking across a hallway.

If you're being completely honest with yourself, these were probably the reasons you were picked to have a trophy modeled after you. After all, you aren't among normal humans here. This is the Smash tournament, and even the human competitors are famous for their incredible fighting prowess. The competitors are legends, and your place here is as an almost literal trophy.

You were already on your way out when your shoe bumped into a small box on the floor. You bent over to pick it up. Looking inside you found a small grey metal box and and a manual. Reading the manual you couldn't help but be amazed. If the manual was telling the truth, this could be a very powerful device indeed. With this device you could become a real somebody, get back into the spotlight, maybe even become something more than a background character in Mario's life.

But right now you were still you. You were still Pauline, and you knew being spotted as yourself in the wrong place could get you kicked out by the Hands or their minions. On the other hand, every extra swap would make things messier and increase the risk of something else going wrong.
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: Pauline

choices: "Okay. Follow me and don't cause any trouble."
"No. I'll stay behind you and watch you as you go to her room."
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
You decided that if you were going to try this remote, you might as well take the highest risk for the highest reward. You walked through corridor after corridor, hoping to find someone you recognized who was close to Mario.

Unfortunately, the first run-in you had was with someone you didn't recognize. She looked like a human, but their large head had an odd angry expression to it, "Hey! What are you doing poking around here?"

"Oh, well... I need to speak to Princess Peach," You lied. "She wanted me to have some of my toys delivered here."

The person crossed their arms and said, "You're not supposed to be in this area." Apparently they were a guard of some sort.

You answered, "She told me to see her in her room so we could discuss the details in private."

A skeptical look on her face, she asked, "Is that so?"

You looked at her and then realized that this could be an opportunity. You smiled, nodded, and replied, "Yes. If you don't believe me, you can escort me there yourself. You lead."

The guard scrutinized you and replied,
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: Take the risk and try to find someone close to ...

"Okay. Follow me and don't cause any trouble."

"I promise," You tell her.

She turned her back and started walking. You followed her. She apparently wasn't one for conversation, and you had no interest in starting one up yourself. Now that you had a guide things were going much faster. You were looking at the box with the remote in it with anticipation.

Soon the guard stopped in front of a door. You watched quietly and grabbed the remote as she knocked on the door.

Soon the door opened. Princess Peach was right there. "Can I- Oh! Pauline! What-"

With no time to lose, you pressed what you hope was the Life Swap Button.

choices: You let her leave the room and the tournament grounds.
You invited her to stay, at least until the toys arrived.
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
An instant passed, and you were no longer outside Peach's room. Now you were inside Peach's room looking out. The guard was in front of you, and Peach wearing your clothes was behind her. She was glancing at the box in her hands. You realized you'd have to take that from her, and soon.

Smiling at the success of the remote, you say sweetly, "-Took you so long? Come in, come in." You open the door all the way for her.

Peach smiled in a way that kind of reminded you of yourself, "Oh. Thank you, Princess." She turned to the guard, "And thank you."

The guard stepped aside. Peach entered what was now your room, and you closed the door. "I see you brought my box," You said. You took the box from her unresisting hands, "Thank you, I really appreciate it."

Peach was looking around the room, confused. You wondered briefly if she remembered being the Princess of the Mushroom Kingdom. "Is something wrong?" You asked her.

Peach sat on the pink and white bed, "To be honest, I'm not quite sure why I'm here. I remember the modeling session where they built a trophy based on me, and then exploring this place, and running into that guard, and coming here..." Peach rubbed her temples, "But what am I doing here, and why did I have that box?"

You tell Peach, "You're probably disoriented. I remember standing still a long time so they could get the trophy just right." That wasn't technically a lie, so you hoped she would buy it.

Peach thought. You could tell by the look on her face that she wasn't sure if she believed it, but there didn't seem to be any other explanation in her mind. "I guess that makes sense," She finally said. "But that doesn't explain why I'm here."

"I asked you to deliver some of those wonderful wind-up toys of yours, the ones that look just like me," You answer.

Peach looked like she had just swallowed a fish. "Oh. Well Princess Peach, those aren't ready yet, but I can have a batch here by tomorrow, I promise."

You managed to not frown. You had taken the life of Princess Peach, and her name had come with it. Not being referred to as Pauline would take some getting used to. "It's no problem," you tell her.

Peach smiled, "Thank you. I'm sure you'll enjoy them." She stood up and smoothed out what had been your dress. "I guess that's it then. I should be going now.

choices: You use the remote, pushing the Clothing Swap button.
You use the remote, pushing the Body Swap button.
You put the remote away. You'll get used to this.
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
You look at Peach, who was now living your life as Pauline. You decide that maybe it would be best if she stayed, just in case this plan didn't work out and you wanted or needed to return to your own life.

"Actually I'd like you to stay Pauline," You tell her. "I'd really love for you to be here when the toys arrive."

"Really? Are you sure it'd be okay?" Peach asked.

"I'll make sure," You said. You reopened the door, "Miss, I personally request that P-Pauline stay here a day or two as my guest. Would you be able to find her a place to sleep?"

The guard saluted, "This Mii won't let you down, Princess. I'll find her a guest quarters."

"Thank you." You turned to Peach. "I hope this is acceptable to you."

Peach smiled, "It would be nice to see Mario and Donkey Kong again. It has been quite a while. Yes, I'd like that very much. Thank you, Princess Peach."

"No problem," You reply. You step to the side as Peach walks past you. You look down at Peach's dress that you are now wearing and can't help but feel bothered by the mismatch. But you remember you have the remote; this could easily be fixed.
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: You invited her to stay, at least until the toy...

1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
Before Peach and the Mii walked out of view, you aimed the remote at Peach and pushed the Clothing Swap button. You watched as Peach left, wearing her signature dress. It was the dress of a Princess, but she wasn't a Princess anymore. You were.

You closed the door and explored what was now your room. It was more spacious than what you would have expected. Perhaps it was because the room was designed for two people? The walls were mostly white, with small trimmings of pinks and blue. It was all rather ornate. The room was divided into two halves, and judging by the beddings (the right bed being mostly deep shades of purple, blue, and some gold while the left was more white and pink), you judged that the left bed was most likely yours. Thankfully, a large curtain cut between the abode, meaning that it was unlikely that your new roommate would catch a glimpse of your remote. You opened the small closet and laughed. There were several dresses and pairs of shoes just like yours.

You noticed a trunk at the edge of the bed. It was locked, but the key was on top of a nearby drawer. Peach clearly hadn't expected any sort of intrusion. You opened up the trunk. It was mostly filled with sporting equipment. Golf Clubs, tennis rackets, etc. You stashed the device underneath these things and locked it, choosing to hide the key under Peach's mattress. If anyone did come looking for the remote, you thought, it would be unlikely that they'd be able to track it here specifically.

As you get up, you notice a full length mirror next to the dresser. You look as you always did, but now the world recognized you as Princess Peach. You smiled, amazed by the powers of the remote. You posed happily, realizing that this would be your life to live as you saw fit. Bowser would be a problem, but you'd work on that, maybe better than the original Peach did. You felt strong enough to-

You clasped your hands. You did feel stronger. You weren't a normal human anymore; you were one of the fighting legends. Perhaps you should go train and see what kind of strength you had. On the other hand, you had all the time in the world. Perhaps you could explore the grounds and see what this place was like.
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: You use the remote, pushing the Clothing Swap b...

1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
You left what is now your room, exploring the corridors. You were no longer afraid of being caught. As far as everyone was concerned you were Princess Peach of the Mushroom Kingdom. As long as you didn't go into some really restricted area there wouldn't be any trouble.

Well, none except for the fact that you were lost. You could feel the memories of Peach's life very dimly in your head. They weren't nearly enough to lead you to a place to see how strong you were, and you didn't want them to be - you wanted to be Pauline on the inside if you could help it. It occurred to you that you may need to swap back every once in a while to refresh yourself, so to speak. You made a note to make sure Princess Peach and Pauline stayed in contact, regardless of which one you were at the moment.

Right now though, you were lost. You realized that you really needed to get a map sooner or later, and an explanation of why you'd need one in the first place.

Maybe this random exploration was a bad idea. Perhaps you should return to your room and wait for your roommate to assist you in navigating this place.
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: Go training.

choices: You had swapped bodies with Peach.
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
In your rush to press the Life Swap button, you accidentally pressed another button by mistake.

After a moment, you were shocked to discover that:
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: You pressed the wrong button.

1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: Lanky Kong/Reyn

choices: Go find Shulk and show it to him
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
You are Reyn, a member of Colony 9's defence force on the Bionis, and one of Shulk's childhood friends. With Shulk being asked to fight in the tournament, the Hands had requested that you pay them a visit so they could model a trophy after you, whatever that meant. It was a shame you didn't actually get to fight like Shulk did, or help him out like Dunban and Riki, or ever just stay and cheer him on, but you'd be cheering him on back home all the same.

After the Hands's helpers had done their thing, you were free to go back home. You wanted to say goodbye to Shulk first though, so you wandered for a bit instead of heading straight to the exit portal. On your way, you happen across a box lying in the hallway. Since no one in the immediate vicinity seemed to be looking for it, you decide to pick it up yourself and check inside. Maybe you'd find its owner while looking for Shulk.

Inside the box was some sort of odd looking remote control. "Heh, looks like something Shulk would like," you muse. Along with the remote, a manual was also inside the box. "Ah, instructions." According to the manual, this remote was not for any sort of electronic device, but rather for altering reality by swapping things between people. "Blimey..." You were at a loss for words.

You were somewhat tempted to just test it out here and now on someone nearby, but machines were really more Shulk's thing. Perhaps you should find him and show it to him. "I wonder what he'd have to say about something like this."
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: Reyn

1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.content: Which character are you?
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: CommanderVideo/Wii Fit U Trainer

1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
You are the Wii Fit U Trainer, a fitness trainer at the Wii Fit U institute. You had been called to this interstellar stadium to be used as a model to create a trophy based on you, since one of the trainers from your institute's predecessor, Wii Fit, had been selected as a fighter in this tournament. You had been sent since you had just finished up work with a client and had a little time before your next client would arrive. You had no interest in this tournament. You could barely believe that any Wii Fit Trainer, U or not, would neglect their work for this long just to participate in some sort of fighting tournament. Not to mention some of the fighters you had seen. From portly plumbers to obese bikers, it seemed like the beings who put together this tournament together needed a fitness trainer on their team more than anyone, and yet the trainer drafted into the tournament had neglected her duties of whipping these fighters into shape. It was almost no wonder she was sent over other trainers; she clearly wasn't cut out for the job and they were probably just trying to get rid of her somehow.

While musing over this, you notice a box lying open in the hallway. Unhealthy, AND messy? You could barely believe the Wii Fit institute would associate themselves with these people. You pick up the box, intending to throw it in the nearest trash can. However, judging by the box's weight, it was clear whoever had left the box here had not removed its contents. Normally you weren't one to snoop, but something about the box made you curious so you checked to see what was inside the box. It seemed to be some sort of television remote, once again adding to your view of how lazy these fighters must be, as well as a manual explaining how the remote worked. Deciding you should at least give these people a bit of a chance, you check the manual to see what the remote is for. To your surprise, the remote is not for a TV system, or any form of electronic device at all. Rather, the remote can somehow alter reality in strange ways by swapping things between the user and the person the remote was pointed at. That idea was absurd! Although it did get you thinking, perhaps you could do some good for this tournament after all. If you switched with someone here, you'd be able to give the fighters a proper training regime. Especially if you swapped with the Wii Fit Trainer already here; you'd be doing away with a lousy trainer and it wouldn't seem too out of character for her. Of course you had no real interest in actually fighting in the tournament, so maybe you should swap with one of the assist or background characters instead.
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: Wii Fit U Trainer

choices: Get Rosalina to read the manual to you
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
You are Luma, or at least, one of the Lumas. You were here accompanying Rosalina here at the tournament. She was still a little worried about you participating in the tournament, even if she was there to protect you, but you were determined to help out. You had been heading to the library with Rosalina to pick out some books, when you noticed something and went to investigate. Rosalina knew you knew your way around the tournament grounds, so she let you investigate yourself, and said she'd meet you over at the library.

The thing you had spotted turned out to be a box. Inside was a remote control, like something for a TV, and a little booklet. You didn't know how to read, so the booklet was practically useless to you right now, but you could always press the buttons on the remote without reading it to just find out what they'd do yourself. Although, Rosalina hadn't gone too far, so you could probably ask her to read it for you.
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: Luma

1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.content: You figure Rosalina probably wouldn't like you picking something random off the ground for yourself. She'd probably want to turn it in in case someone lost it. No, you'd have to try it out yourself. But what to try? You didn't know what the remote was for, so you figured you should just point it at something and press one of the buttons. But what to point it at?
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: Test the remote yourself

1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: Red/Yellow

1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
You ran though the large corridor, you tiny red feet shifting in front of the other quickly, as the leaf on yo head flaps around wildly. You are a red Pikmin, a small mix of animal and plant. You had become separated from captain Olimar and you were searching for him.

On you long travels, you came across a box, smaller than the ones on your planet. You scaled it, hoping to get a better view for finding captain Olimar. On top, a hole allowed you to see something inside. So you jumped in, and throw out the things from inside, a booklet, and a strange box.

Climbing out, you could see the strange objects better now. The strange smaller box had several different colored things sticking out with pictures, and the book was no help, it only had words, and you were unable to read it.

Thinking, you could get someone to help you read it.
Or
You could just jump on the buttons and see what it does.
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: Red Pikmin

1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
Deciding that you should test it, you pushed away the paper pad, and took hold of the box, and dragged it along, into the rest room.
You stepped on top of it, and looked over it. There were six things sticking out of it, somethings called 'buttons' by Captain Olimar.

Each of them had a picture on. The first one was the shape of man, there was another button like it, but the man was empty. Another one had just a face, causing you to place a small red hand against you head. The next button had two bits of clothing. The last button had two strange shapes, one being blue, the other being pink, both had circles, and some sticks in the shape of an arrow and cross. You had seen these before, on doors and other places, but Olimar never let you in.

It also had three others, each with a number on, you recognized the first one, 1, but 2 and 3 looked a little strange to you. The button with a 1 on, was already pushed in.

You jumped down on to a random button with a picture on.
You saw a blink of a light from the front of the box, as you looked up when you landed, someone was in the door way.
Who was it?
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: Use the strange box

choices: Attempt to use the remote again
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
As you landed, you looked up, you saw the remote was pointing towards the door, where someone had just walked in. You recognized her from the newcomer introduction. A tall figure in a blue dress with a star flying with her. But that changed after you button had sunken in.

In an instant that had changed. Her dress had been replaced with a long sleeve t-shirt and pants, both the same colour of her dress, they look a little like pajamas. Her Hi-heels were now flat, but that was the least of the changes. Her face was now devoid of any make up, her hair was shorter, a little passed her neck, and flattened out. She was also now flat on her chest. And her curvy figure was much more straight, she had also gained more muscle mass, becoming less slender.

Looking down, figuring that the remote had something to do with it, you saw that the button was the one with circles and sticks. But that wasn't the only change. You own small red, plant-animal body had also changed. The center of your button had pulled inwards, and your chest and hips had expanded outwards. There was also now a wrapping covering your body. Undoing it, you saw two dots on your chest, and something in between your legs. You pulled it closed feeling ashamed.
You were quite confused to what just happened.
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: Rosalina

1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
You are literally a giant floating hand, bored and tired of regulating Smash bros. For four games, you technically did the same thing over and over again. You decided that you need a break and a replacement that is not Crazy Hand. You then magically created a remote for this occasion, but you lost it so you decided to make another one.

You decided that your replacement must be responsible, but good looking at the same time. You then saw one of them appear before you for battle. You think this is an opportunity to swap right now. This person is...
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: Master hand

1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
You see Zelda appear, ready to fight you. As she was about to attack, you decided to stop.

"Wait! I want to congratulate you for being... uh the 1 million person to reach here. Yes!" said you.

"Really? Are you sure this is no trick?" asked Zelda.

"Uh no. It's just that I have a prize that you might be interested in. How would like to have my power for a while? I need a vacation and someone responsible and wise to take my place." said you.

"Well if it's only for a little while, I guess. I always wonder what you do?" said Zelda.

"I just need you to make sure Smash Bros runs smoothly. You have the power to do as you wish." said you.

You then have the remote in hand and aim it at Zelda. You both begin to swap and the type of swap that occurred is...
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: Zelda, she is a good ruler when not kidnapped

choices: Swap with more people for fun
Zelda's POV or as the new Master
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.content:
Suddenly, you find yourself with a body of a woman. You look at a random reflection and see a hand for a head on Zelda's body. You then look up and saw Princess Zelda as a giant floating head. As big as you were before.

"Uh, I never thought that it would be this weird." said Zelda, "Could you scratch my nose for me?"

You proceed to do so as the floating princess's head felt at ease.

"You can create things to replace as your hands. I'm just scratching just to be nice." you said, "Time for my vacation."

"Wait! You didn't left me any instructions!" cried Zelda.

"Just wing it." you said.

And so you...
1553322222222222222222222222222222222222.title: Head swap
